story:
We (the production team) want to ensure that this film is a brilliant spectacle, not only for our final grade, but for the enjoyment of those who have both watched and/or donated to the production of the film.

We are a creative and imaginative group of individuals who are striving to make a film that reflects our cinematic talents and values - but our skill set can only take us so far.
 

That is why we kindly ask for any donations that can help put towards the production of a film that can be enjoyed and hopefully set us up for a successful future in the industry.

Your donations will be benefitting both the production team and the audience members of the film, in terms of creative freedom and enjoyment respectively.

The funds we receive will be accepted with the utmost gratitude, and will be put towards costumes, props, travel and casting - all of which will benefit to the overall feel and success of the film.

The support will not only offer an opportunity to express ourselves as creative students, but it will also mean that we are giving ourselves a huge chance to get ourselves noticed and create a portfolio that hopefully, employers cannot ignore.

All who donate will be credited in the film, as a means of us showing our gratitude and sticking to our values.

We look forward to getting started with our project, and with your donations, making a short film that will captivate imaginations and provide sincere enjoyment to all.

story:
The Protectors is a Sci-Fi/Action-Adventure movie, about a young adult who discovers that he is a descendant of an ancient alien race with special abilities sent here to protect this planet from harm. After his father and the rest of their kind died trying to protect humanity from an another alien race that has been secretly controlling the governments of our world, he decides to follow in his father’s footsteps and protect the innocent on Earth, doing his best to become the hero this world needs.

If you’re a fan of the action-packed Marvel and DC Comics shows such as Arrow, Daredevil, The Flash, Luke Cage, Supergirl, and more, or any of the Marvel and DC movies, then you will definitely want to get behind The Protectors.

The main character’s name is Michael Matthews, with the hero alias: The Angel. His powers include super strength, super speed, enhanced endurance and enhanced healing. He’ll be called The Angel because his costume is all white from head to toe. His costume will also slightly resemble that of Marvel’s Iron Fist (The comic version, not the Netflix version).

Also, the villains will have enhanced intelligence, and the ability to shapeshift. So that’s cool too. 

The Protectors will be approximately 40 minutes, will begin shooting in June 2018, and is scheduled to be released by the end of 2018.

I, Ben Hughes will be directing, producing, and writing this film. I currently work as a freelance  music video director and have been doing so for over 7 years now, and I have been making my own films and videos for over 10 years now. I’ve made hundreds of videos since I first picked up the camera, and on top of that My YouTube Channel has over 45 million video views. And I will be putting my all into this project.

The Protectors will be officially released on my YouTube channel, and will also be available on DVD and Digital Download.

Most Hollywood movies cost several million dollars or more to produce, and most Network TV shows cost upwards of a million dollars per episode, but I’m only looking to gather $17,372.25 to produce this film as a whole.

That money will be used to cover the essentials such as:
-Costumes                                  
-Equipment & Rentals                               
-Props
-Locations & Permits
-Food for Cast/Crew
-Transportation
-Potentially paying some of the actors/crew that can’t work for free

& if you’re reluctant to help because you don’t think this project will be seen, then don’t worry because the rest of the money and any extra that we make will be spent on Promotion through Google and Facebook ads, guaranteeing at LEAST around 480,000 viewers.

Click HERE for more specific information on production costs.

If we aren't able to reach our goal, then I will be drastically cutting the advertising budget, and will only be using actors that will work for free.

So why should you support this production? Well, not only do you get to be a part of what could be a cinematic viral sensation, but you also get various gifts in return depending on how much you contribute.

If you can’t afford to support this production, then at least share the campaign link with your friends! It would mean the world to me and everyone behind this film.

UPDATES:
As of January 25th, 2018. We've received a total of $226 raised by 4 backers, which is approximately 1% of the total goal. We've still got around a month to go. Thank you to everyone who contributed, but we still have a long way to go to make sure this project is fully funded! Every contribution counts!

story:
About Girls Night Out

Girls' Night Out is a short narrative film about two best friends, Andrea and Jen, who decide to join an old colleague for drinks at a nightclub in San Francisco. Like any other night out at the club, the girls are drinking and having a good time. Their night suddenly goes south when one of the girls is drugged.

 

Why This Story?

Date Rape is a very misleading term, which describes a serious crime that is wrongfully perceived and often not reported. Date rape and other sexual violence cases are major public health, human rights, and social justice issues. We're here to address this issue and raise awareness in hopes of reaching out to everyone, both men and women who have been victims, potential victims, as well as potential predators. 

As someone who has gone through a horrifying and traumatic experience of being drugged and sexually assaulted, and after years of keeping it to myself, I would like others who are currently suffering with post-traumatic stress/depression to understand that if you talk about it, speak up and let it out, you too, can heal. Don't continue to carry on those negative emotions. Though it may have changed your views, you are not your experience. 

 

What We Need 

Our goal is to raise a total of $3000. Donations will help our campaign develop all stages of the film including production, post-production, marketing, and film festival fees.

Your generous contributions will go towards the following expenses:

  • Compensation to our professional actors
  • Production equipment rentals
  • Craft services to feed the cast and crew during production
  • Makeup
  • Marketing and Film Festival fees.

Love the idea, but just can't contribute? That's ok! You can still help by simply sharing this link on your social media. Anything helps :)

story:
<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

We, at Historia Films, sincerely appreciate you considering our campaign and our project. We are an independent production company, based in Mississippi, with a proven track record, having produced three feature films (The Historian, The Hollow, Demons) and two shorts (Two Birds, Light & Shadow) in the last four years. All these projects have attained distribution and are available to the public on various platforms. Our features all received at least limited theatrical distribution as well as widespread visibility/availability in the world of streaming and DVD/Blu Ray. 

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

Historia Films believes that HALLOWED GROUND may be its best, most resonant project yet. At its core, the film, for all its nerve-jangling horror elements, is about the triumph of love in the face of insidious evil and seemingly insurmountable obstacles. For us, filmmaking is as much about advocacy as it is entertainment. HALLOWED GROUND is part of that idea and mission. It has never been more important that artists, especially in Mississippi, but also around the country, demonstrate just how open, how all-embracing, how inclusive and how poignant the arts have been and continue to be. We believe that the arts change lives. We believe that the arts can save lives and the more fiercely independent the art is, the more life-changing it can be. Independent films, so often great labors of love that a filmmaker has literally willed into existence, deserve to be championed and seen just as much as the latest Hollywood tentpole, perhaps more so. We make films that we hope demand to be seen, films that can find champions, films that can find a home among a wider audience and, when they do so, to entertain, to inspire, to unnerve and to make those audiences think, at least for a moment, about the nature of what it means to be human, about why they believe what they believe.

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

Where Your Contributions Go

As independent filmmakers, we greatly value every contribution and won't let a single dollar go to waste. In order to bring the film to life, we need funding for:

  • Hiring additional crew
  • Securing filming locations
  • Renting video production equipment
  • Creating and dressing sets
  • Wardrobe, Props, and Makeup
  • Feeding our cast and crew over multiple days
  • Submitting to film festivals

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

We already have some very talented people on our team! Follow our Facebook page to get updates on when we add more people to our team.

Checkout our IMDB page, and see what other projects our team members have worked on.

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

We really care about our final product. The look and feel of the film is very important to us.

We look at our past projects, and a few other projects to find inspiration, in order to piece together the terrifying look for the film.

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>-<<>>

Please help us continue to do what we do, to create ... to make a great, entertaining, thought-provoking film, and, maybe, just maybe, change some hearts and minds for the better.

 

Want To Play An Even Bigger Role?

How does the title Executive Producer sound?

If you’re interested in being a private equity investor and fully (or partially) funding our production, contact our team through historiafilms@gmail.com. We’d be happy to go over our business and financial plans for Hallowed Ground and discuss working together.

story:
In order for us to compete in the busy world of film marketing we need to have a large publicity campaign. As well as this we also want to sponsor our theatrical release. During this next stage of our journey we are aiming to raise the following:

1. $3000 to go towards promoting the film. This money will go towards: Hiring a  publicist,

                     Designing and printing posters.

                     Putting out ads.

2. $6000 to go towards organising our own theatrical release.  This money covers our venue hire for a two week run.

This particular campaign however is just focused on raising the initial $3000 needed for publicity.  Please understand that every little bit helps and we truly are grateful for anything you can manage.

Best - The Devil's Cove Team

story:
Short Summary

My name is Casey Schoch and I am a female filmmaker at Ithaca College finishing off my junior year. 

"Your Loving, Virginia" showcases not only the thought process of Virginia Woolf, but the traumas she was faced with every day and the toll it weighed on her. Upon her death, Virginia Woolf  was ridiculed for being a weak woman, reporters claiming she simply could not handle the stress of the looming war. However, it is through her husband's unconditional devotion to her that we see another side of her, the true terror she was met with. Through this film, we live through Virginia's last day with her, exploring the world she created for herself surrounded by the characters she created as a tribute to the people she loved most.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Because this is a time period piece, the majority of our funding will be put towards recreating this setting through recreating her home and depicting the authenticity of the settings of her books. 
  • Since we will also be supplying food for our cast and crew for the number of days we are filming, we are accounting for that price as well.
  • The final cost comes down to the prices for film festival submissions as we are confident even now in pre-production that this project holds a beautiful message and extreme promise.

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you can help create a voice for women who have been silenced because of their gender or even their mental health. Virginia Woolf lived with manic depression, an illness not yet understood by the world to the degree it is today. By telling her story, Virginia Woolf can live on to give support for anyone suffering from the harshness of reality, too, and serve as a driving force to empower women who have been put down for too long.

As a female filmmaker, I am driven to creating projects with the voices of powerful women. It is my goal to sufficiently represent women in films, no matter the genre. My last film, Dead Weight, showcased the mind of a woman in a suspense film, and the film generated a huge film festival appeal. Moving forward with this non-fiction piece for this extraordinary author, I have no doubt that this story will hold even more ground.

Mental illness and gender inequality are prevalent now more than ever, and it is our job as visual creators to strive for representation in this medium.

Risks & Challenges

  • Because this film is a time period piece, it will be nothing without the authenticity of our production and costume design. The inability to fulfill these needs will result in an injustice to Virginia's lifetime of achievements, an obstacle we refuse to overlook. 
  • We will also be battling the Ithaca elements as we move to film Virginia's last moments, but our safety team is prepared to undergo all necessary precautions to ensure that everyone is safe on set.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign! If you can't contribute, others can!
  • Make it your mission to help spread the word about equal representation in film! It only takes one voice to start the discussion.

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone,

My name is Devon Coull the writer/producer and lead actor behind the film Recondition. I'm a bi-coastal actor working mainly out of the Los Angeles, and Boston markets. While catching my dreams I've watched close relatives and friends from my hometown fall victim to the heroin/opiod crisis that is destroying families in a lot of small cities across the country. I wrote Recondition my first short film and started my own business Reconditioned Images LLC this year to develop great stories of triumph and struggle and get them to the screen.

Last year I ran an Indiegogo campaign and raised 75% of our overall budget goal allowing us to roll into pre-production, but now we need help to finish our film.  So far we've managed to assemble a major league cast and crew and have filmed our story. Now its time to edit it and get it out to our great supporters. Post production costs are all we have left in completing this amazing story of a mans struggle with temptation and addiction.

Your Impact is Very Important!

As much as it'd be great for a high dollar contribution its more important to us that we receive smaller donation, and that your share this campaign with your friends. The more eyes that see this campaign and eventually the finished film the closer we get to achieving our goal of influencing a person in need.

Other Ways You Can Help

If your budget is tight all we can ask is that you please spread the word of our project. Thank you so much for your generous support.

Meet the Team!

Devon Coull

Meet Jack Sawyer himself. Devon is the lead actor/writer/producer of Recondition. Along the way hes had some great opportunities. In 2013 he was directed by the great Frank Darabont in his TNT series Mob City. Frank is the mastermind behind The Shawshank Redemption, Green Mile, and AMC Walking Dead series. In 2016 luck struck again being rewarded with a small role in CBS's American Gothic directed by Matt Shakman known for directing It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. Acting is Devon's passion, but when not on set hes usually getting his hands dirty working full-time for Mack/Volvo Trucks as a Diesel Technician. www.imdb.com/name/nm4658506

Graham Patrick Martin

Recondition's director is no other than highly talented Graham Martin series regular "Rusty" of TNT's Major Crimes. Some of you may recognize him as "Eldridge" from Two and a Half Men. Graham is such a major league player in our project. He not only supported the original campaign, but he took it a step further and decided to take the drivers seat in our project as the director. At a young age of 26, his years behind the camera on various shows has given our project the precision laser focus our movie needed. I'm really fascinated to work close with him, and being many young people are suffering from this epidemic its nice to have someone in charge that is also the same age. We couldn't have dreamed of anyone else! www.imdb.com/name/nm2269032

Paul Guilfoyle

The extremely gifted NYC stage and television actor Paul Guilfoyle, known for his role as "Jim Brass" on 319 episodes of CSI Crime Scene Investigation jumped on board Recondition to play Gerry Sanders grandfather to Jack Sawyer. Our team was so thankful to have Paul work on our project. Guilfoyle is a native to the Boston Massachusetts area and brings such authenticity to his role. www.imdb.com/name/nm0002117

Brad Carter

Brad a force of nature joined us to play autoshop owner "Craig". He's well known for multiple roles including "Charlie Lange" in HBO's True Detective, and "Leland Gruen" in FX's Sons of Anarchy. Early into pre-production Mr. Carter's name had been thrown into the mix. Graham and myself both felt highly in regards to the great work hes done in the industry and were so happy we felt that way. Brad Carter is such an amazing soul. If one positive thing comes from this movie outside of helping others. Its another chance for the world to meet the overly talented Brad Carter. www.imdb.com/name/nm1012967

Marguerite Insolia

Its a no brainaahhhh that Boston's native and overly talented actress Marguerite would be on board this project to play the role of "Rachel" Jack's love interest. Insolia is well known for her work in the web series "Massholes" and the viral video "Shit Boston Girls Say". The director and I needed an actress that would deliver the power to control Jack's world. We got what we needed and then some. For anyone unfamiliar with her work be sure to subscribe to her youtube channel. She's wicked talented!! https://www.youtube.com/minsolia

www.imdb.com/name/nm3638581

Thank You in advance!

On behalf of Reconditioned Images we'd like to thank you for taking the time to learn about our first film project. Our campaign isn't about giant contributions its about word of mouth. We all know someone who is suffering. With the help of sharing it means more eyes will receive the great message of Recondition!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey Everyone,
My name is Devon Coull the writer/producer and lead actor behind the film Recondition. I'm a bi-coastal actor working mainly out of the Los Angeles, and Boston markets. While catching my dreams I've watched close relatives and friends from my hometown fall victim to the heroin/opiod crisis that is destroying families in a lot of small cities across the country. I wrote Recondition my first short film and started my own business Reconditioned Images LLC this year to develop great stories of triumph and struggle and get them to the screen.
Last year I ran an Indiegogo campaign and raised 75% of our overall budget goal allowing us to roll into pre-production, but now we need help to finish our film.  So far we've managed to assemble a major league cast and crew and have filmed our story. Now its time to edit it and get it out to our great supporters. Post production costs are all we have left in completing this amazing story of a mans struggle with temptation and addiction.

Your Impact is Very Important!
As much as it'd be great for a high dollar contribution its more important to us that we receive smaller donation, and that your share this campaign with your friends. The more eyes that see this campaign and eventually the finished film the closer we get to achieving our goal of influencing a person in need.

Other Ways You Can Help
If your budget is tight all we can ask is that you please spread the word of our project. Thank you so much for your generous support.
Meet the Team!

Devon Coull
Meet Jack Sawyer himself. Devon is the lead actor/writer/producer of Recondition. Along the way hes had some great opportunities. In 2013 he was directed by the great Frank Darabont in his TNT series Mob City. Frank is the mastermind behind The Shawshank Redemption, Green Mile, and AMC Walking Dead series. In 2016 luck struck again being rewarded with a small role in CBS's American Gothic directed by Matt Shakman known for directing It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. Acting is Devon's passion, but when not on set hes usually getting his hands dirty working full-time for Mack/Volvo Trucks as a Diesel Technician. www.imdb.com/name/nm4658506

Graham Patrick Martin
Recondition's director is no other than highly talented Graham Martin series regular "Rusty" of TNT's Major Crimes. Some of you may recognize him as "Eldridge" from Two and a Half Men. Graham is such a major league player in our project. He not only supported the original campaign, but he took it a step further and decided to take the drivers seat in our project as the director. At a young age of 26, his years behind the camera on various shows has given our project the precision laser focus our movie needed. I'm really fascinated to work close with him, and being many young people are suffering from this epidemic its nice to have someone in charge that is also the same age. We couldn't have dreamed of anyone else! www.imdb.com/name/nm2269032

Paul Guilfoyle
The extremely gifted NYC stage and television actor Paul Guilfoyle, known for his role as "Jim Brass" on 319 episodes of CSI Crime Scene Investigation jumped on board Recondition to play Gerry Sanders grandfather to Jack Sawyer. Our team was so thankful to have Paul work on our project. Guilfoyle is a native to the Boston Massachusetts area and brings such authenticity to his role. www.imdb.com/name/nm0002117

Brad Carter
Brad a force of nature joined us to play autoshop owner "Craig". He's well known for multiple roles including "Charlie Lange" in HBO's True Detective, and "Leland Gruen" in FX's Sons of Anarchy. Early into pre-production Mr. Carter's name had been thrown into the mix. Graham and myself both felt highly in regards to the great work hes done in the industry and were so happy we felt that way. Brad Carter is such an amazing soul. If one positive thing comes from this movie outside of helping others. Its another chance for the world to meet the overly talented Brad Carter. www.imdb.com/name/nm1012967

Marguerite Insolia
Its a no brainaahhhh that Boston's native and overly talented actress Marguerite would be on board this project to play the role of "Rachel" Jack's love interest. Insolia is well known for her work in the web series "Massholes" and the viral video "Shit Boston Girls Say". The director and I needed an actress that would deliver the power to control Jack's world. We got what we needed and then some. For anyone unfamiliar with her work be sure to subscribe to her youtube channel. She's wicked talented!! https://www.youtube.com/minsolia
www.imdb.com/name/nm3638581
Thank You in advance!
On behalf of Reconditioned Images we'd like to thank you for taking the time to learn about our first film project. Our campaign isn't about giant contributions its about word of mouth. We all know someone who is suffering. With the help of sharing it means more eyes will receive the great message of Recondition!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Maalik Gunnell. I have been directing and writing and creating for over a year. This Will be my 3rd short film and my first one with a budget.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $800. This is what the money will go towards

  • Lenses, and Lights
  • Camera
  • Props
  • Food and Catering
  • Location

 

Risks & Challenges

Even if the goal is not met we will still try to shoot this project. Some of the risks we face are scheduling and onset issues that occur with every project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some other ways you can help is become apart of the crew. I am also Looking for people to help some stuff behind the scenes. If this interest you then you can email me directly at gunnellmaalik@gmail.com

story:
Hand Rolled: A Film About Cigars is a feature length documentary on the artisanal craftsmanship of premium cigars, and the beautiful people that are involved in the process! You might have thought that cigars are factory made like cigarettes, but in actuality, over 300 pairs of hands are involved in the making of each and every premium cigar. This is a truly one of the last remaining industries that manufactures 100% hand made products and uses only 3 ingredients to do so: tobacco, distilled water for fermentation, and vegetable based glue to hold the wrapper on.

    Our background is in commercial filmmaking, but we’ve always prided ourselves on being able to tell stories through our videos. This is why we’ve decided to make our first documentary. We chose premium cigars is because we both smoked cigars and enjoyed the culture and figured that if we’re going to keep indulging, we should have our facts straight. Moreover, we did a little digging and saw that there really wasn’t any relevant and contemporary documentary on the premium cigar industry, so we decided to change that! 

We want to tell the human story.  Of course, we’ll include the lifestyle and consumption side of that story but we think it’s important to know that every cigar you smoke is the product of a labor of love of hundreds of individual people. There are millions of people worldwide who depend on the sale and distribution of premium cigars and their stories are seldom told.

    The documentary has been filmed thus far on a Red Epic-W camera and will be released in UHD 4k. Why is that important? Firstly, if you’ve seen any photos or videos from countries like Nicaragua, Dominican Republic or Cuba, you’ve seen how beautiful they are. We want you to be able to see every single detail of the locations we are filming! Also, by releasing it in 4k, we are future proofing it for many years to come!

    With the help of some private backers like Pete Johnson from Tatuaje Cigars, Daniel Marshall from Daniel Marshall Humidors, Nick Melillo from Foundation Cigars and the Sinners and Saints club, along with our own personal funding we’ve filmed in Nicaragua, where we interviewed some of the biggest names in the industry and some people you’ll have never heard from like farm workers from the fields. We’ve shot with manufacturers, celebrities and influencers in Los Angeles, Florida and Connecticut.

    We’ve got a total of about 50 interviews and hundreds of hours of footage! Here are some of the folks we’ve worked with so far:

We need to film in the Dominican Republic next. We have Carlito Fuente, Nirka Reyes, Litto Gomez and Manuel Quesada already lined up from the DR. We also need to film in Cuba, and the people we will be interviewing there are still TBD based on the access we are granted. Our goal is to premiere the film in July with the ultimate goal of getting it on a streaming platform like Netflix. 

    With $50,000, we will be able to travel to, and finish filming in the Dominican Republic and Cuba, as well as pay for our editor. Our remaining projected budget for the film is $150,000 which will include music licensing and all the post production work so any money we raise on top of the $50,000 will go directly to these things.

We also need your help in sharing about our project! Share our facebook page, our instagram page, our website, and of course this campaign. The more people know about the film, the more successful it will be when it gets released!

story:
Short Summary

Due to a life-long fascination with outer space, Arron Kinser has always wondered if we were alone in the universe, and after traveling the globe he discovered that this curiosity is inherent in all human beings. Then, while traveling through the Mojave Desert, the question dawned on him: How do the world's religions, both ancient and new, answer that curiosity? What's more, do they tend to believe these visitors Extraterrestrials, Demons, or Angels?

Mesopotamian, Inuit, Asian, Indian, and European religions vary in their interpretations of global phenomena, so what might they all have to say about extraterrestrial life forms? Our goal is to answer that question by talking to as many leaders and followers of these religions as possible; to find out what similarities and differences arise in the perception of drawings, writings, and even first-hand accounts of Alien visitation.

This documentary will consist of our crew traveling the continental US and visiting both religious and UFO-sighting hotbeds, complete with interviews, archival footage, dramatic re-enactments, and coverage of some of the most exclusive filming locations known to experts in the field.

Your contribution will help us share the knowledge we receive, with the goals of ushering in a better understanding of what life may exist beyond our planet, discovering how our perception of that life has affected religion, culture, and history, and perhaps even demonstrating that while religious beliefs as a whole may differ, their interpretation of this undeniable phenomena may serve as common ground.

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $20,000, which will help cover fuel and maintenance for our mobile production studio, (otherwise known as Arron's decked-out RV) contributions to various organizations that will provide either information or filming permits, production and post-production expenses, and server/distribution costs so that we can provide the documentary to viewers on our own terms. If we do not reach this goal, we will complete the documentary to the best of our ability with what we have raised.

If you contribute any amount, you will have played a role in the uncovering of religious views on Extraterrestrials, some of which are guarded and controversial, which will lead to a better understanding of how human beings regard our place in the universe. 

The very first perk that your contribution will entitle you is to vote on the name of the documentary: "ANGELS or ALIENS", or "DEMONS or ALIENS?" Religions have varying views on this topic, so we're leaving it up to our benefactors!

Check out our "Perks" page to see what else you could receive for your contributions!

The Impact

For as long as written history has existed, humans have asked, "How did we get here? What is the meaning of life? Are we alone in the Universe?"

Religion has always been the balm to these burning questions, so we want to find out where each individual religion stands in their belief of Extraterrestrial life, UFO phenomena, technological reverse-engineering. Do sects of Judaism believe that Aliens helped with the pyramids? Might Buddhists believe that humanity is a result of directed panspermia? Who believes these otherwordly visitors to be Demons, Angels, or Aliens?

Answering this question is just the tip of the iceberg, and if we are successful in this campaign we hope to delve even deeper into the history of Extraterrestrial encounters as they pertain to religion, and do so all around the planet.

Risks & Challenges

We are hopeful that experts and laypeople alike will be willing to share their experiences and beliefs, but we also know that these beliefs can sometimes be controversial or hard to share. Aside from this, we are seeking access to locations, documents, and individuals that could prove difficult or, in some cases, impossible to capture on film.

We have had tremendous luck so far and are working with the very best organizations to bring the absolute, unadulterated truth to our viewers, but we are not ignorant of the fact that this subject matter, on a grand scale, could place both our subjects and ourselves under a lens of intense scrutiny, at the very least.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute financially there are a number of invaluable services you can provide to us! Sharing the project with your friends and family, talking to anyone you know who has an interest in this subject, and sending us information or experiences of your own would all be incredibly helpful.

story:
OUR JOURNEY TO IFUGAO - BRIDGING ANCESTRAL WISDOM

We live in a time of abundance, ease of communication, the free flow of information, yet we struggle to maintain the natural resources that flow freely from the earth.  As we move forward, we feel it's vital to re-establish our connection to the life giving planet. It's especially important to acknowledge our ancestors who came before us. They are the keys to our past and the doorway to the future.  There is a wealth of indigenous tradition to help us establish our connection and reverence that we have the opportunity of preserving and revitalizing.

Mamerto Tindongan has shown his dedication in preserving the practices of the Ifugao people. His vision includes keeping the traditions alive  to help individuals deepen their connection with their spirituality through connecting with the land. Mamerto is hosting a retreat in Banaue, Philippines from April 28 - May 1st of this year to promote the Ifugao people’s main heritage from their ancestors.  These traditions are maintaining the terraced rice-fields (payo), building the hut (beleh), showing reverence to the rice god (bulul), and honoring the fertility symbol pendant (lingling-o).

Our team, Kultura Films will partake in these rituals and document the wisdom of the Ifugao tribe, learning and sharing the power of Ifugao traditions. Kultura Films is an advocate for Filipino traditions. We honor the Philippine ancestral roots, zooming in to focus on indigenous practices that uncovers a part of ourselves.

ABOUT THE IFUGAO

The Ifugao are an indigenous tribe located in the province of Northern Luzon of the Philippines.  They have maintained the man-made rice terraces, also known as the "eighth wonder of the world." "Ifugao was one of the places in the Archipelago least influenced by the Spaniards, even though they did venture into Ifugao territory; the Spaniards were unable to transform their culture and values. Anthropologists have regarded the Ifugao as possibly the oldest residents of the highlands; their origin attributed to Indonesian migration, dating back as early as 800-500 BC" (Bigornia, 2011).

WHY THIS MATTERS  

Since 2013, Kultura Films has been documenting Mamerto from building the healing hut, beleh, in Ohio to his journey revitalizing the dwindling mumbaki in the Philippines in 2016.  Our relationship with Mamerto and documenting his journey has already reached a generation and has inspired individuals to look deeper into their ancestral selves and connect to other Filipinos on the shared journey. By helping to support & fund our "Journey to Ifugao - Bridging Ancestral Wisdom", you will be contributing to a movement that seeks to preserve indigenous traditions so that others can connect to our Filipino ancestry.  With the intention of revitalizing the interest of indigenous traditions in Ifugao, we hope to build powerful bridges by connecting to the ways of our ancestors to influence our spirit with our modern day life.

If we surpass our goal, any additional funds will be supporting the movement to help revitalize and preserve indigenous traditions.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET 

We need $8,888 to film and create "Our Journey to Ifugao - Bridging Ancestral Wisdom" Film.

Video production $3,888

Travel Grant $5,000 

In helping to create this documentary, we have unique perks of limited edition to get you excited.

ABOUT US

There is a growing movement to connect to indigenous spiritual practices. Not only on the Journey to Ifugao, but in the diaspora, we have been cultivating our connection and relationship with Mamerto’s vision of preserving and promoting indigenous practices with the Ifugao Healing Hut Project in Ohio. With the spirit of Bayanihan in creating the Ifugao Healing Hut Project in Ohio, we want to help continue the larger vision of creating a school of living traditions across the diaspora. Here is a link of the Healing Hut: 

https://vimeo.com/116400661

https://vimeo.com/155468066

https://vimeo.com/232211337

 

BIO

Nicanor Evans 

Founder of Kultura Films , he was born and raised in the Philippines then later migrated to Los Angeles. A profound artist that loves to create sacred geometry mandalas and producing videos, he continues his  journey by learning and propigating ancestral sacred arts .

Diane Valencia

Diane Valencia, aka,  Diyan BukoBomba is tawo of Bikolan@ ancestry born on Turtle Island in the territory of the Tongva people in Yangna. A self taught multi-media artist, crystal ball magic- solar pyromaniac, creator, community & youth organizer, her artwork uses creation as a way of finding freedom from inner pains & colonial traumas.

Veronica Mercado

Veronica Mercado, aka, Vero Kapwaves is a creative and energy worker. She weaves spoken word and plant medicine to explore the intersection in all and the divinity within ourselves. Through her heart centered oral artistry and culinary creations, she channels the connection to our ancestors and mother earth to inspire soulful movements and freethinking. Co-founder of Ubekabute- plant focused Filipino cuisine. garden teacher. holistic nutrition educator.  

Chona Bernardo

Chona is a second generation Filipino born and raised in Long Beach, CA.  The past decade of her life has been a path of healing to remembering her authentic self.  She's cultivated a spiritual practice that has humbly led her to become a certified Reiki Master/Teacher, yoga instructor, and artist. She believes she can evolve herself by absorbing the teachings of the elders and shamans in the motherland. By being surrounded by her kapwa and other Filipino artists/healers on the rise,  Chona is inspired to embrace where she is from, so she can have a clearer direction of where she is going in order to serve her community.

Gary Jornacion

Gary was born on Tongva land and has Ilocano/Visayan ancestry. Gary visited the Standing Rock Reservation in North Dakota in 2016 to stand with native tribes to protect clean water. He met Mamerto the summer of 2017 at a cultural festival in Oregon. Indigenous elders from all of the globe had convened to share their medicine and say prayers for the healing of the planet. This synchronicity left a huge impact on his quest to rediscover and heal. Gary wishes to continue on this quest by joining Mamerto and his kapwa on this Journey to Ifugao.

She believes she can evolve herself by absorbing the teachings of the elders and shamans in the motherland. By being surrounded by her kapwa and other Filipino artists/healers on the rise,  Chona is inspired to embrace where she is from, so she can have a clearer direction of where she is going in order to serve her community.Gary JornacionGary was born on Tongva land and has Ilocano/Visayan ancestry. Gary visited the Standing Rock Reservation in North Dakota in 2016 to stand with native tribes to protect clean water. He met Mamerto the summer of 2017 at a cultural festival in Oregon. Indigenous elders from all of the globe had convened to share their medicine and say prayers for the healing of the planet. This synchronicity left a huge impact on his quest to rediscover and heal. Gary wishes to continue on this quest by joining Mamerto and his kapwa on this Journey to Ifugao.

story:
Short Summary

After three years filming in the streets with Chilean social movements, Their Dreams Endure is almost ready to premiere.  Before we realize our dream of bringing powerful voices sharing the learning of generations of struggle in Chile to students and social movements around the world, we need your help to pay classical musicians to record our hair-raising original score! You can listen to a sample of the score in our trailer.

Impact

 Our documentary can inspire and inform activist audiences in a critical moment for social movements around the world, offering practical learning on resisting 500 years of indigenous genocide, a CIA backed dictatorship and a corporate take over of public education. 

You can make a difference by helping students and activists around the world learn from the resilience and courage of Chilean social movements. 

Their Dreams Endure has been an all volunteer project up to this point. All funds are managed according to non-profit accounting standards. 

Director, cinematographer and editor Joshua Tucker is an award-winning journalist and filmmaker. From Chile, he has reported for Democracy Now!, Discovery Channel, Unicorn Riot, Sub.Media and Free Speech Radio News. His last feature length documentary, We Can't Eat Gold, was covered in The Guardian. He holds a  journalism degree from the University of Alaska. 

What We Need & What You Get

One starving artist to another, I feel for classical musicians. After years of painstaking study and practice, they struggle to be paid for their heartfelt art form. I'm committed to paying dignified wages to the musicians who record the breathtaking original score for Their Dreams Endure written by composer and conductor Sebastían Colarte Martínez.

Your name will appear in the Special Thanks of  our film, with a donation of $27 or more. Please do not hesitate to contact us at TheirDreamsEndure@gmail.com with any Ideas, requests or questions. 

Facilitation is often the key to making change. Please share this page on social media and think about who you know who might be able to chip in. 

Gratefully,

Joshua Tree Tucker

story:
About The Bob Zula

My name is Brandon Reich and I’m a filmmaker based in Austin, Texas. The Bob Zula is a coming-of-age comedy based on my experiences growing up in East Texas. Ten years ago I made the original short film with the help of my family and friends. This year, I’m shooting my first feature film based on that short.

I studied film at the New York Film Academy, and later moved to Chicago to learn improv at The Second City and film at Columbia College Chicago. Since then, I’ve been freelancing as a filmmaker, and shooting shorts and sketches. I'm excited to be making my first feature film because this is an amazing challenge, and dream come true. A few coming-of-age comedies I love are American Graffiti, Rushmore, Superbad, and Rocket Science to name a few. They have influenced this project in that I have watched and been able to see aspects of my own life's successes and failures in the characters, and the most relatable are the relationships that are shared in those moments.

I’m excited to have a talented and passionate team involved in this project, many of whom were involved in the short ten years earlier. I am grateful for their willingness to donate their time, skills and resources to The Bob Zula, and to the art of motion pictures.

What We Need

As you know, making a movie isn’t cheap. It’s our goal to raise $20,000 for the following costs:

  • $12,000 covers food costs
  • $15,000 covers food and gas
  • $17,000 covers food, gas, insurance and location permits
  • $20,000 covers all costs, plus stipends for the hardworking cast and crew

We're passionate about this project and plan to make The Bob Zula no matter what, but anything you give will help fuel and encourage the team. Even if it's just a few dollars!

Other Ways To Help

If you can’t contribute financially, we still need your help spreading the word about this campaign and supporting us throughout the project! Follow the Indiegogo campaign here, share it on social media and subscribe to our newsletter to see how the project progresses.

story: A Motivational Film , with Music, passion and Dancing the Tango. To gain a  very special spiritual and emotional relationship with our families. Different stories of our real lives and how can we resolve the problems, through good friends, family and God. We are filming in Las Vegas (Sin City), because we need to show that even with difficult circumstances, everything is possible.  With the right attitude and the love connection with family it all works out. Thanks for supporting this project to show that we can became better people with music, love and the right motivation .

story:
"A contact-seeking child, beset by fantasies, I was quickly transformed into a hurt, cunning and suspicious day-dreamer. 

But a day-dreamer is not an artist other than in his dreams."

Ingmar Bergman

What is A Dreamer?

Freddie, a passive, taciturn, naïve film student, dreams about finishing his screenplay while also hoping to reconnect with Audrey, an actress he met  during the summer. The screenplay he is writing, “Monochrome Fantasy,” is in fact a recollection of their memories, which he deems fit for the big screen. He hopes that his creative endeavor will impress Audrey and make her desire him.

Director's Statement

My name is Jeremy Gumener. I am a film student from Geneva, Switzerland, studying Film & Media Studies and English at Tufts University. 

A Dreamer is an idea that I've been developing for the past year, a story I've taken my time to write and now finally have a chance to produce and direct. It's my first short film. It's a relatable story that will speak to anyone who has made the decision to follow through with their creative callings, and, paradoxically, to those who haven't, because of the unpredictability and lack of tangibility of such a dream. But this story also questions the essence of one's creative drive, as well as the genuine "goal" of an artist. Freddie idealizes what he believes to be Hollywood grandeur, and hopes that his creative ambitions will attract the attention of the woman he idolizes. But through his daydreams, we realize Freddie wants to make "art" for all the wrong reasons.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this project is to reach $3,900. This money will fund all stages of production, and will support props acquisition, locations rental, set design, crew & cast fees, food and beverages for the entirety of the shoot, and post-production necessities such as sound mixing & color grading, as well as festival submission fees. 

Without your donations, we would not be able to afford certain locations, material, and personnel. The film would not come to life as we intend it to.

We believe that you deserve some unique perks for donating- The perks are listed on the right side of the page. Find the one that interests you most!

The Team

Meet our team- We all study a variety of subjects but are all passionate about film and photography. Our team has worked together before on various other projects, and can't wait to collaborate again on this one! 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also be of great help by sharing this page to friends, family, anyone you think may be interested. It’s extremely important to get this page circulating and seen by as many eyes as possible. Again, this can’t be done without all of you. Thank you for your help!

story:
The Plan

Pansy Pachanga explores the roots of the LGBTQ+ community of the Rio Grande Valley and the unique social, historical, religious, political, and cultural forces that led to the repression of many of these identities. Forces that have made— and in some ways— continue to make the region a particularly challenging space to be openly queer in.

Some of these stories which speak to the some of the unique culture of the Valley include: Sister Strohmeyer, a Catholic nun who opened her family’s home to those dying of AIDS; a campaign by a local AIDS service provider to engage local curanderos (faith healers) in addressing the virus; a “male impersonator” troupe whose members organized fundraisers for children living with HIV; In Touch- a monthly, bilingual, DIY zine published on local LGBTQ+ news and issues in the early 1990s; a park where queer people publicly congregated despite to police repression; a downtown dive bar that catered to “gays” by night  where drag queens in the early 1970s performed their first songs to the tune of a jukebox in the corner, and a play depicting key moments in queer history written and performed by a group of queer and trans high school students affectionately known as “The Little Darlings.”

Pansy Pachanga takes its name from a 1992 Pride fundraiser organized by an organization called Valley Voice and The Little Darlings. This event— a backyard BBQ with chicken plate sales to raise money for LGBT advocacy— was the last in a series of events that happened in June of that year that made up the Valley's first known LGBTQ+ pride celebration.

This project will be a collaboration between One Scene Studios and Neta. Neta is an online platform creating culturally relevant content about the Rio Grande Valley from a progressive perspective. In 2017, Neta was recognized at the GLAAD Gala in San Francisco for elevating LGBTQ+ voices from the RGV and received a “Rising Star” grant sponsored by Target. One Scene Studios are the creators of “As I Walk Through The Valley,” a documentary about the secret history of underground music in the Rio Grande Valley of south Texas.

The estimated public release of the film is June 2019. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $6,000  to help us create the documentary. The $6,000 will be used as follows:

  • $2,700 for publishing fees
  • $1,200 for stipends
  • $1,000 for travel, food, and gas expenses
  • $1,000 for marketing
  • $100 for website related costs

All of our equipment is being covered thanks to the ACLU of Texas. 

Here are the perks you get:

  • Donate $10 or more & get a Pansy Pachanga sticker
  • Donate $30 or more & get a Pansy Pachanga T-Shirt
  • Donate $100 or more & get your name on the credits as a supporter
  • Donate $500 or more & get a guaranteed seat in our RGV premier
  • Donate $1,500 or more & get Associate Producer* credit
  • Donate $5,000 or more & get "Brought To You By"* credit at the very beginning of the film

Any money raised beyond our $6,000 goal will be used for stipends and incidentals. 

The Impact

At a time when LGBTQ+ people and especially LGBTQ+ people of color are forced to confront challenges on many fronts and border communities are increasingly targeted, it is important to document how queer communities of the past have faced and overcame obstacles to equality and managed to find community during even less accepting times.

LGBTQ+ history— when it is covered or given attention at all— often focuses on white queer experiences or cities that have larger, more well-known queer communities. The Rio Grande Valley, with its position on the U.S./Mexico border and its multi-layered, complex history and blend of cultural influences, provides a unique backdrop for the telling of one queer community’s story.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a contribution, don't worry! If you just share our campaign on Twitter or Facebook, you could help us reach out goal faster by encouraging your friends and family to donate. 

(*To ensure the most accurate and ethical representation of history, the Associate Producer and "Brought To You By" sponsors will not receive any creative or editorial control over the documentary. These perks only include credit in the film. If you have further questions, please email dani@netargv.com.)

Credits: Quote used in teaser by Joan Nestle, founder of the Lesbian Herstory Archives in her anthology A Restricted Country​ from 1988.

story:
Short Summary

 

WHO ARE YOU INVESTING IN?

Over a 23 year career, I have a proven track record of producing professional films at very low costs, both as a writer, director and an editor... 

I've written and directed 75 short films/music videos/corporate videos and 1 feature film...

I also recently, edited sequences for the Martin Scorsese produced film 'Tomorrow'.

For more about me : http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1836630/

 

WHAT ARE YOU INVESTING IN?

YELLOW JACKET (Trailer: https://vimeo.com/170963459) was my first micro-budget feature film which was made for £10,000 ... We have a sales agent (Carnaby) who loves the film and is trying to secure it distribution!

We've had such success with this film, that we decided to make another one the same way!!!

Somero is a feature film, based on a stage play, originally written in 1997 and since then (alongside making 75 short works and 1 feature), I have been developing this project to adapt it successfully for the screen.

The story is a character driven drama, focused on a universal theme... fear - and how we can overcome those fears... all against the backdrop of a very ambitious Sci-Fi concept... Two young woman are trapped in the fallout, of a truly world changing natural event.

This film is also an opportunity, for two women to lead a feature film, with the male characters taking a 'back-seat' for a change. Developing female roles in film, is something I'm most passionate about.

It's an extremely personal project and to be able to tell the story and for others to then enjoy it... would be a personal and professional dream come true.

THE PERKS:

There are various perks available, but please(!!!) if you'd like to see a perk that is not available, email me at: laymanproductionsltd@hotmail.com  and I will do my best to create your perk!!!

THE FUNDS:

Firstly, I will not take a wage, but a percentage of any money made from any eventual sales of the film - I'm betting on himself.

Any funds raised are going towards:

-Paying the two lead actors a wage (that is Equity minimum and is largely compensating for their taking unpaid leave from their day jobs). 

And of course feeding everyone throughout the duration of the shoot + all the travel costs to bring the three key players to the location down in Devon!

-And in the spirit of equal pay, the sound engineer on the film (Janis Balodis) has agreed to take the same pay.

-The funds are also going towards all other production costs, including; the camera and lenses, costumes, props, adjustments to the central location, travel and accomodation and most importantly... any other elements needed in creating the world the story takes place in... the money should be on screen!

The shoot is scheduled for 2-3 weeks, to begin as of: 23 July 2018 to 13th August 2018, so the funds would need to be raised no later than 1st July 2018.

I have the cast already assembled, the location, the script, the choice of camera and lens and the crew.

Everything in terms of pre-production is falling into place beautifully to be honest. The biggest challenge if I'm perfectly frank, is raising the funds (however low for a feature), to make it happen. It's the most confident I've ever felt in pre-production to be honest!

story:
​ABOUT THE FILM:

Inspired by actual events that occurred the day after the Parkland, FL shootings. 

On February 14, 2018, the Parkland shooter pulled a fire alarm to create panic, then began shooting indiscriminately. When an unscheduled fire alarm went off at a nearby Florida school the very next day, nobody knew if the nightmare was happening all over again. 

This under ten-minute film contains no guns, and no violence, nor does it take political sides. It depicts something far more powerful: how far teachers will go to protect their kids when fearing the worst. 

The film’s producers have a proven track record, and are working with a talented crew of local film students, as well as casting two-dozen local schoolchildren to portray students in the film. All involved are volunteering their time.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Having read the script, the Santa Barbara Unified School District generously granted permission to film at a local elementary school, to help make this film as realistic as possible.

However, the use of this important location presents certain challenges. The school must charge facilities fees, plus the hourly salary of staff required to be present. Though we're shooting as economically as possible over only one weekend, these fees, plus insurance, add up to over $1,500. On the positive side, the bulk of these fees go right back into our local schools, so if we can raise the funds, it's a win-win.

In addition to location expenses, it is necessary to feed the volunteer crew and cast, including the children, as thanks for their hard work and volunteer efforts. We would like to provide healthy options for all. 

WHY THIS FILM?

From lockdown drills and preparing for the worst, to lives on the line, both teachers and children live in a different world today than the one many of us grew up in. We humbly ask your help in making this film, to keep this important conversation going.

No amount is too small, and if you are unable to donate, please consider sharing our project on social media.

Thank you for your consideration!

ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS:

Jorrit van der Kooi (Producer, Director)

Born and raised in the Netherlands, Jorrit began his career as a radio producer and presenter for several local radio stations when he was 18 years old. He earned a Bachelor’s Degree in TV Journalism and started producing TV shows for Dutch National Television at the age of 23.

Jorrit divides his time between the Netherlands, Belgium, and Santa Barbara, California, where he has presented, directed, and produced several TV series such as “Rodeo Drive,” about the life of millionaires in Beverly Hills, and “Ranking the Cars” (currently on third season) about special and expensive cars in Las Vegas and Hollywood. These TV shows were aired on Dutch National TV. He also directed and produced several short movies in Hollywood and Belgium, published a novel, and has directed many TV series for Dutch National TV. His one-hour documentary about the life of Colonel Parker had a theatrical premiere and received high acclaim. Jorrit directs and shoots in many countries such as the Congo, France, Sweden, Norway, Austria, Switzerland, Ireland, Italy, Spain, and Germany.

Christina Eliason (Producer, Screenwriter, Actress)

Born and raised in Santa Barbara, California, Christina began her acting and modeling career at age 16. She received her Associate’s Degree in Theater from Santa Barbara City College, where her performances garnered national recognition in the form of an Irene Ryan Nomination for Best Actress (American College Theater Festival) and winner of Best Production (American College Theater Festival). A former model with Elite Agency with dozens of commercials under her belt, she continued her acting studies at private conservatories in New York and Los Angeles, as well as at the National Institute of Dramatic Arts, in Sydney Australia. She has performed all over, including by invitation at the Kennedy Center in Washington D.C., and in a leading role at the Sydney Opera House.

She completed both her Bachelor of Arts in Film Directing, and her Master of Fine Arts in Screenwriting, at the University of California, Los Angeles, where she graduated summa cum laude and won the prestigious UCLA Screenwriting Showcase. She is winner the Alfred P. Sloan Fellowship in Screenwriting for “Divine Mistress,” the biography of brilliant French mathematician Emilie du Chatelet. Her most recent film credits include Co-Producer/Co-Screenwriter: “The Bet” (winner: Best Feature Film, La Femme Film Festival), Screenwriter: “Treasure Island” (Andrew Davis/Phoenix Pictures, in development), Screenwriter: “New Breed” (Panic Attack Films, in development) and Producer/Screenwriter: “Your Favorite Place,” a touching film about the love passed down through generations of mothers and daughters, also with Jorrit van der Kooi, currently making festival rounds.
story_txt: ​ABOUT THE FILM:Inspired by actual events that occurred the day after the Parkland, FL shootings. On February 14, 2018, the Parkland shooter pulled a fire alarm to create panic, then began shooting indiscriminately. When an unscheduled fire alarm went off at a nearby Florida school the very next day, nobody knew if the nightmare was happening all over again. This under ten-minute film contains no guns, and no violence, nor does it take political sides. It depicts something far more powerful: how far teachers will go to protect their kids when fearing the worst. The film’s producers have a proven track record, and are working with a talented crew of local film students, as well as casting two-dozen local schoolchildren to portray students in the film. All involved are volunteering their time.WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?Having read the script, the Santa Barbara Unified School District generously granted permission to film at a local elementary school, to help make this film as realistic as possible.However, the use of this important location presents certain challenges. The school must charge facilities fees, plus the hourly salary of staff required to be present. Though we're shooting as economically as possible over only one weekend, these fees, plus insurance, add up to over $1,500. On the positive side, the bulk of these fees go right back into our local schools, so if we can raise the funds, it's a win-win.In addition to location expenses, it is necessary to feed the volunteer crew and cast, including the children, as thanks for their hard work and volunteer efforts. We would like to provide healthy options for all. WHY THIS FILM?From lockdown drills and preparing for the worst, to lives on the line, both teachers and children live in a different world today than the one many of us grew up in. We humbly ask your help in making this film, to keep this important conversation going.No amount is too small, and if you are unable to donate, please consider sharing our project on social media.Thank you for your consideration!ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS:Jorrit van der Kooi (Producer, Director)Born and raised in the Netherlands, Jorrit began his career as a radio producer and presenter for several local radio stations when he was 18 years old. He earned a Bachelor’s Degree in TV Journalism and started producing TV shows for Dutch National Television at the age of 23.Jorrit divides his time between the Netherlands, Belgium, and Santa Barbara, California, where he has presented, directed, and produced several TV series such as “Rodeo Drive,” about the life of millionaires in Beverly Hills, and “Ranking the Cars” (currently on third season) about special and expensive cars in Las Vegas and Hollywood. These TV shows were aired on Dutch National TV. He also directed and produced several short movies in Hollywood and Belgium, published a novel, and has directed many TV series for Dutch National TV. His one-hour documentary about the life of Colonel Parker had a theatrical premiere and received high acclaim. Jorrit directs and shoots in many countries such as the Congo, France, Sweden, Norway, Austria, Switzerland, Ireland, Italy, Spain, and Germany.Christina Eliason (Producer, Screenwriter, Actress)Born and raised in Santa Barbara, California, Christina began her acting and modeling career at age 16. She received her Associate’s Degree in Theater from Santa Barbara City College, where her performances garnered national recognition in the form of an Irene Ryan Nomination for Best Actress (American College Theater Festival) and winner of Best Production (American College Theater Festival). A former model with Elite Agency with dozens of commercials under her belt, she continued her acting studies at private conservatories in New York and Los Angeles, as well as at the National Institute of Dramatic Arts, in Sydney Australia. She has performed all over, including by invitation at the Kennedy Center in Washington D.C., and in a leading role at the Sydney Opera House.She completed both her Bachelor of Arts in Film Directing, and her Master of Fine Arts in Screenwriting, at the University of California, Los Angeles, where she graduated summa cum laude and won the prestigious UCLA Screenwriting Showcase. She is winner the Alfred P. Sloan Fellowship in Screenwriting for “Divine Mistress,” the biography of brilliant French mathematician Emilie du Chatelet. Her most recent film credits include Co-Producer/Co-Screenwriter: “The Bet” (winner: Best Feature Film, La Femme Film Festival), Screenwriter: “Treasure Island” (Andrew Davis/Phoenix Pictures, in development), Screenwriter: “New Breed” (Panic Attack Films, in development) and Producer/Screenwriter: “Your Favorite Place,” a touching film about the love passed down through generations of mothers and daughters, also with Jorrit van der Kooi, currently making festival rounds.

story:
Short Summary

Tampa Beer: Crafting the Bay is a love story to the Tampa Bay craft beer scene.  Tampa has a long history with beer; in fact, the first brewery in Florida was established here and is still standing.  The coolest thing about beer is that it means something completely different to everyone.  Beer is brewed in the same way, with the same ingredients, yet you give a recipe to 10 different brewers, you will get 10 different variations of that same beer.  Every beer has a journey from grains to glass and that drink you get at the bar is not just a beer, it's a beverage that has had multiple hands brew it - every beer starts with the farmer who supplies the grains to the brewer who throws them all together.  Our documentary features those people - the brewers that spend their lives brewing and learning and always getting better.  We meet many of the faces behind the beer and learn why they do what they do here in Tampa.  Tampa has recently exploded over the last few years in the sheer number of craft breweries opening up and has been dubbed "the craft beer destination of the Southeast." We learn what makes Tampa so special - so much so, that Yuengling's only brewery outside of Pennsylvania is here!  Every beer has a story and this is Tampa Bay's.

Like us, most of the craft beer drinkers don't really understand the drink.  People have always asked, "Why is craft beer so expensive?"  People drink beer quickly, slam the glass down and run off to the next brewery without really giving the drink much thought.  I filmed a short promotional video for a local brewery over three years ago and only then - meeting the people behind the drink, seeing the process that goes into creating this "craft"  beverage - did I truly appreciate where it came from and what I was drinking.  I made it a point to create a film that not only showcases who these brewers are and the history that Tampa has with craft beer, but puts the drink back in the spotlight as one that people can appreciate when they drink it.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $20,000 to help us complete this film.  We were safely able to begin production in July of 2020 and have just completed filming.  But this is just the beginning.  Over the next few months, my team and I will begin editing all of our footage together to tell Tampa Bay's story.  Once we have our film edited together, we will be hiring a composer to create original music for the film, as well as a few other people that will be able to take this film to the next level.

The funds that we raise will go towards:

  • Hiring a composer to create an original score for our feature documentary
  • Hiring a sound designer to clean our interview audio and do "soundscaping", which is creating ambient noises, the popping of bubbles when an image of beer being poured is shown to really enhance the imagery
  • Securing Errors & Omissions Insurance, marketing and submission to local and national film festivals and all associated legal fees.

Should we not receive our full $20,000 wish, the funds we have raised will be used for music composition and cleaning up the dialogue so that we can have a fully finished film.

And you will receive some AWESOME PERKS!  Everything from shirts only available to backer's of this campaign to movie posters to digital downloads and a ton of experiential rewards that will be sure to satisfy any craft beer lover!

The Impact

This documentary is very special to me because it's been a passion of mine for the last two and a half years. I've always loved beer but I drank it just for taste and never really understood how it was made, what the ingredients were, or the hard work that someone had to go through to build the brewery that I'm sitting in, enjoying their lager or IPA.  But seeing the passion and hard work that these brewers have put into making sure I have this amazing experience with their beer really opened my eyes that there was a story to be told.

I've met some incredible people along this journey and saw how beer has truly changed their lives. It has given them the opportunity to make friendships and connection not only within the craft beer industry, but also within their community that they never would've made without beer.  It has benefitted the city and the local economy, provided jobs for thousands of people and put Tampa Bay on the map for having some of the best craft beer in the Southeast.

My hope with this documentary is that not only will it teach you what beer is and how it's brewed, but that you will gain an understanding of where that beer came from. That you will raise that glass to say "thank you" to the brewer that spent years learning how to perfect that beer so that you can enjoy it.

Our local craft beer scene helps the Tampa Bay economy and contributes to local business. My hope with this documentary is that we will be able to benefit the city and local community here in Tampa by showing the world that this is a craft beer destination and one that you want to check out first-hand!  Now more than ever, breweries need our help and support as they begin to recover from the effects of COVID-19.  

Risks & Challenges

The toughest challenge that we encountered with this documentary was-by far-filming during a global pandemic.  We successfully, and safely, completed filming, but now our challenge is delivering the best quality film to our audience.  Every step going forward will be easier as the remaining tasks and contributions can be completed without required physical proximity. However, we risk not having the funds to complete this process.  We are hopeful that there are enough people out there (like you!) that love craft beer or have even experienced Tampa Bay's craft beer scene, and that we'll be able to achieve our funding goal to be able to see this film through to completion.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are financially unpredictable for many at the moment. If you can't contribute but appreciate what we're trying to create, please spread the word, follow us on Instagram & Facebook and be sure to share our campaign with your beer-loving friends!  You can also find behind-the-scenes stills and short video content on our social channels.

The Filmmaking Team

James Blankenfeld - Director, Producer, Director of Photography

James has been behind the lens of a camera for the last 10 years.  Before moving to Tampa, he spent five years living in Manhattan where he was a camera operator for reality television shows like Project Runway, My Fair Wedding, & The Celebrity Apprentice.  James owns and operates his production company Blu Kamera Media in Tampa, as well as his wedding videography company, Imagery Wedding Films.

Ian Corry - Cinematographer

Ian is a graduate of Florida State University and is a very talented camera operator.  His work favors the real-life scenes of documentary films, with a clean and commercial edge that is polished and visually stimulating.  His work shows a strong technical proficiency and creative ambition that is well suited for any production environment.  Ian currently owns and operates his own company, Yellow Tree Studios, in St. Pete, FL.

Daniel Peacocke - Cinematographer

Born in South Africa, Daniel is a talented cinematographer that has been working in the United States for the last three years producing amazing content.  Daniel brings raw and emotional camera work to this documentary, matching perfectly with the grittiness that is the craft beer industry.  Daniel currently owns and operates his own production company BreakBox Studios in Anna Maria, FL.

Justin Wright - Composer

Justin is a Southern California-based composer and producer that specializes in telling stories through music.  Every composition he releases is carefully crafted to take the listener on a journey. Each album is intended to be like a book, leading the listener along a path of transformation through music and emotion.  Instrumental music has the power to lead people through a story that they can individually create in their minds as they listen. 

Over the years Justin's compositions have been synced in thousands of videos via licensing agencies.  MTV, Progressive Insurance, TBS, GoPro, Harley Davidson, Square Inc., and countless other filmmakers have found that his music fits perfectly with film.  Using his extensive knowledge in audio engineering, and wide experience working with other composers, Justin blends together classic tones of acoustic instruments with the progressive sounds of the digital world.

story:
SALVATION

Salvation revolves around a young tortured gay man who has deeply rooted religious values influenced by his father. The protagonist struggles to find happiness battling his father's homophobia as well as his own religious values due to which this feeling of his, towards the same gender or being a gay man is a big sin to him. So this conflict between his own feelings, his values & beliefs, to be acceptable to his father and to get so-called salvation misleads him to become a psychopath.

 

 Use of colors in the title 

In the title we can see the use of 3 colors. The tonal background of the film will be inclined towards these 3 major colors Black, Blue and Red. The colors help us to constitute certain feelings and emotions. So the inclination of the film towards these 3 colors with variance to their shadinesss will help us to bring the theme more vividly to the viewers. Below are some reference shots for the film.  ( ** That's only a title name not a poster of the film.** ) 

 

                     

What We Need & What You 

We need your help to raise money for the production of this film. Every help you provide will eventually help us to achieve what we have aimed . In exchange we have some small rewards for your great help .  You might me skeptical regarding the money and how they will be used. For that we have breakdowns of how and where the money will be used. 

 

                                      Your monetary contribution(s) will go towards the following: 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help doesn't only limit to financial. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If the story excites you and wanna help us : 

  • Share our campaign on social medias.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

  • Night at the Arcade is going to be a big hit all around the world, at least we hope. We're planning to film this short in August! Whoever likes cosplay, action movies, comedy, or fantasy is going to fall in love with this short. We are twin brothers who make epic films. We want to make a big short film that can bring our community together. So why do we need funding? My brother and I don't make money off of any of our short films. We want to pay everyone on set while pushing this to be a bigger film than our usual ones. 
  • When it comes to cosplay-style films, there is so much copyright involved that we won't be making money off the film when it's complete. So we need a little bit of help so that we can pay for our actors, crews, food, and other crazy ideas that we can't yet reveal (don't want to ruin the movie). 

What We Need & What You Get

What do we need? All we need is your support. (WE ALSO NEED SPONSORSHIPS IF YOU KNOW ANYONE!) What you get, let's dive straight into that!

$10 - A virtual hug from my brother and I (I know, that's crazy!)

$20 - Your name in the credits as a thank you

$50 - Your name in the credits in a special and unique way...keep an eye out for it

$100  - A print of a unique still from the set, signed by the directors AND a personalized singing videogram from the lead actor, Bourke Floyd

$250 - A handwritten thank you letter from the directors AND a small, surprise gift

$500 - Producer 

$1000 - Executive Producer 

The Impact

We want to bring creativity and enjoyment to your screen. Arcades are places where your imagination can run wild, and we want to bring that to life. We try to keep our films kid-friendly (with the exception of some action), so we hope that kids (and former kids!) around the world watch this and feel inspired to be creative. 

Our last film, John Doe: A Western Tale, was a big hit. We had 80+ volunteers and some crazy hot temperature days. So far that video has gotten about 70,000 views on YouTube and it won several film festival awards. We are pushing to make this film go much further!

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't want you to be bummed out if you can't give anything. We totally understand! If you're in the Tucson area and want to volunteer your time to the project, please reach out and let us know! If you know a company that may want to sponsor us (and get their logos in the credits and possibly a mention in the script), then please reach out and ask for us. Also, when the video is released, share it everywhere! That's one of the biggest ways you can help us. Finally, prayers go a long way for us as well! Thank you!
