story:
In October 2005, authorities in Hunt County Texas discover Norma and Dennis Woodruff dead in their home, shot and stabbed repeatedly. A Texas Ranger quickly zeroes in on the couple’s son, Brandon Woodruff, after learning the young man was leading a double life. To High School and College friends he is still a fun-loving, horse-riding Urban Cowboy. But, he is also living a gay lifestyle, dancing at clubs in Dallas and acting in gay adult films.

Check out the trailer the docu-series here:

 

The Team

Scott Poggensee

For many years, first-time filmmaker Scott Poggensee and a small group of friends and family waged something of a crusade in the defense of Brandon Woodruff. To help in their efforts Poggensee produced a documentary to show to supporters. In doing so he uncovered a series of lies and deception that bent the truth that led to the conviction of Brandon. This documentary will be used as the foundation of our series. In late 2020, Poggensee’s film came to the attention of Emmy winning journalist and documentarian Richard Ray. After examining the evidence, Ray agreed to help produce and write a documentary series. Since then both the Innocence Project of Texas and Lamda Legal have signed on, offering Brandon’s appellate lawyer assistance. The Free Brandon Woodruff movement grows by the day.

Richard Ray

Richard Ray is a five-time Emmy winning TV journalist and documentarian who spent 36 years as an Anchor/Reporter at KDFW-TV in Dallas/Fort Worth. He covered the Contra War in Central America and won Emmys for his coverage of the Oklahoma City bombing, the standoff at Waco and and the JFK assassination. He won numerous other awards, including those for his work on the Waco Standoff and the South Asia tsunami. Ray became interested in Brandon’s story in late 2020, after seeing Scott Poggensee’s rough cut documentary and listening to the American Justice Podcast. Ray’s examination of the evidence has since led him to join the movement to get to the truth.

The Impact

Brandon Woodruff is a very sympathetic figure -- a sweet kid and class clown who was never in any serious trouble. He won scholarships for his skill in raising show animals. He loved caring for and riding horses. He was a budding actor and model. At 140 pounds and slightly built, it’s hard to see him committing the brutal crime he’s accused of. 

By all accounts, he loved his parents and they loved him. In one, particularly poignant moment during a behind-bars interview Brandon explains how he feels his parents are still with him. “I’ve never been raped in here. I’ve never been seriously hurt,” Brandon tells Scott Poggensee. His parents, he believes, are with him in the penitentiary every day and protecting him. Brandon Woodruff has been behind bars for 15 years and counting. But he has never wavered in proclaiming his innocence. Brandon believes one day it will be proven. With your help, we can work faster to exonerate an innocent man.

Risks & Challenges

We want to make it very clear -- this film will be made and will eventually expose the corruption and homophobic bias that was used to convict Brandon Woodruff of something he didn't do. Please help today so that we can make that sooner rather than later.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to our Facebook page, FreeBrandon.org, and sign our petition to get the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals to look at Brandon's case. You can see it here:

https://www.change.org/BrandonWoodruff

THANK YOU!
story_txt:
In October 2005, authorities in Hunt County Texas discover Norma and Dennis Woodruff dead in their home, shot and stabbed repeatedly. A Texas Ranger quickly zeroes in on the couple’s son, Brandon Woodruff, after learning the young man was leading a double life. To High School and College friends he is still a fun-loving, horse-riding Urban Cowboy. But, he is also living a gay lifestyle, dancing at clubs in Dallas and acting in gay adult films.
Check out the trailer the docu-series here:

 

The Team

Scott Poggensee
For many years, first-time filmmaker Scott Poggensee and a small group of friends and family waged something of a crusade in the defense of Brandon Woodruff. To help in their efforts Poggensee produced a documentary to show to supporters. In doing so he uncovered a series of lies and deception that bent the truth that led to the conviction of Brandon. This documentary will be used as the foundation of our series. In late 2020, Poggensee’s film came to the attention of Emmy winning journalist and documentarian Richard Ray. After examining the evidence, Ray agreed to help produce and write a documentary series. Since then both the Innocence Project of Texas and Lamda Legal have signed on, offering Brandon’s appellate lawyer assistance. The Free Brandon Woodruff movement grows by the day.

He won numerous other awards, including those for his work on the Waco Standoff and the South Asia tsunami. Other Ways You Can Help
Please go to our Facebook page, FreeBrandon.org, and sign our petition to get the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals to look at Brandon's case. You can see it here:
https://www.change.org/BrandonWoodruff
THANK YOU!

story:
Run is a tapestry of interconnected stories set against the coasts of southern England about how three young adults are confronted with loneliness, fear and trauma. 

We don't want to give too much away at this point but we can tell you that we have been inspired by films like Crash and Magnolia - both of which follow many interwoven tales of mental health. Telling this story in a raw and honest way is so important. Run is not sugar-coated in anyway. It's tragic, yes, but also the reality for too many young people across the UK.

The three young adults we follow in Run are all strangers, yet converge on a similar path of seeking closure and moving on. Some find more success than others. These tales follow people that you won't expect suffering from worsening mental health conditions that infiltrate their lives. We want to show that mental illness doesn't discriminate. It latches onto anyone who is feeling remotely vulnerable. 

Director's Statement: Run is unlike any other film. We do not glorify mental health, we address it and observe it in its grittiest form. Who are we to give the answers of how to deal with abuse, depression, loneliness and addiction. This is not a film with an easy fix. Our film captures a snippet of the journey our characters go on. It will be up to the audience to decide of how they think the stories end or even if they have an end. We do not tell the audience how to think, we will simply put these stories forward and the audience can take whatever they like from it. Because we have no specific target audience for this film, every individual will take something different from it. That is our aim and the motivation that has inspired us to create this film.

Producer's Statement:  I'm really wanting this film to encourage people to speak out about mental health and check up on their loved ones. I believe it is such an important message and I want people to know that they don't have to struggle on their own. I'm hoping our film can reach as many people as possible and change people's perception of the mental illnesses and troubles that we are addressing. 50% of our profits will be split between two fantastic charities close to our heart, helping people that I love dearly, and I am so happy to give back in an inspiring way. 

 

 

Unfortunately, filmmaking is not a cheap process! We are crowdfunding £1500 to make this film the best it can possibly be. Comparably to the industry as a whole, this is a micro-budget but in order to tell these stories in the most truthful way possible, we really need your help.

We will be using your hard-earned money to create the visual tone for the film with high-end kit and cameras, the colour grade, the crew costs and so much more. Additionally, we have hired some truly talented actors to help us tell this story. They will be tackling challenging themes of loneliness, depression and sexual assault in their multi-layered characters.

As our story is set against the backdrop of the southern England coasts, we will also be providing travel & accommodation for some of our cast and crew not based down south to help us on set. 

50% of all profits made from 'Run' will be split between two charities very close to our hearts.

MAN DOWN is a Cornwall based Non Profit. They run safe talking and listening spaces to help meet the current emotional and mental health needs of men who struggle to cope with the pressures facing them in our modern society. In 'Run', one of our characters struggles to understand and cope with their own trauma due to those expectations and stigma surrounding male mental health. It is very important to us to show people that it is strong to seek help and support: https://www.mandown-cornwall.co.uk/ 

WOMEN'S CENTRE CORNWALL, formerly known as the Women’s Rape and Sexual Abuse Centre (WRSAC), are a specialist provider of services for women and girls (11 years+) who have experienced any form of Sexual Violence, Rape, Sexual Assault, Childhood Sexual Abuse and/or Domestic Abuse at any point in their lives. They are dedicated to supporting and helping all women and teenage girls address the impact of the trauma they have experienced and to reclaim the life they want for themselves. As strong advocates of women’s rights, they campaign for and champion change to make women’s lives better at both a local and national level. We hope that people who connect with Tegan's story in 'Run' will recognise the support available at all levels to seek closure: https://www.womenscentrecornwall.org.uk/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/run_short_film/

------------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you for reading. We really hope you can support us and help tell this story by donating to our campaign or sharing with your family and friends!

story:
Summary

“We wanted to do a film that would directly impact our own community. This project is something we’d talked about doing a few times before and we came to the conclusion that the right time for it is now.” -Born Logic, the director

In "Walk on the River" we touch on religion, politics, education, social organizations and community all in an attempt to paint a vivid picture of life for Black San Antonians in the past to help create a knowledge base, a sense of pride and a blueprint for the next generations moving forward.  This is the reason for this documentary.

Progress

Thus far we have compiled and conducted over 10 hours of interviews with professors, historians, business owners, educators and citizens.  

“Walk on the River” will feature very influential people from our community like:

  • Mario Salas
  • Ed Glosson
  • Dr. Rudyard Hillard
  • Netti Henton
  • Lon Taylor
  • Vera Williams Young
  • D.L. Grant

and many more

We’ve employed the help of researchers, students and volunteers to help read books, articles and newspaper clippings to gather information. We've collected more than 50 historical photos and digital images ranging from the 1870's to the 1980's. The documentary as it stands now is about 35% completed.

What We Need & What You Get

Reaching our financial goals through this crowd funding campaign will help us complete this project this year (2018) and make it a high quality film. Recording a documentary is expensive, and much more intense than our first film.

Our goal is $9,150. This money will help us pay for:

  • Legal fees
  • Research Materials and Resources
  • Video Production equipment
  • Photo & Music rights and licensing
  • Professional marketing & PR services
  • Travel Expensed to conduct interviews

You can rest assured that at the end of this process we will release and make public documentation for how the funds we collect have been used and allocated. If we make our goal, this summer we will premier the film at the Carver Cultural Center as an official event for San Antonio's Tricentennial (300 year) Celebration

For helping us reach our goal we have special gifts and prizes for our contributors based on the level at which you give. These gifts include:

  • Autographed DVD copies of our first film "Message to the People  A Story of Malcolm X"
  • Your name mentioned in the credits of the movie
  • Associate producer credits
  • Tickets to the premier of the film
  • Executive Producer Credits
  • Dinner with the Director, Producers and the staff

 

The Impact

Reaching our financial goals through this crowd funding is very important to us. It allows us to keep creative control of our projects, ownership of the products we make and sell. Self financing also insulates us from outside entities that might try to influence or distort the narratives we choosing to tell. Melaneyes Media is devoted creating culturally enriching, educational Black films and videos.

Why This Is Important

As the city grows and changes, as the “Eastside” (historically considered the Black side of town) becomes more gentrified, as historical locations and landmarks are being demolished or forgotten- we, along with other movements and organizations in the city- are doing our best to help preserve our own history and tell our own story.

We want to preserve this rich history for our children, grandchildren and future generations of African Americans who choose to live or visit our great city.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. We are also in need of:

  • Researchers
  • People who collect data and verify information
  • Social media assistance
  • Actors for reenactment scenes
  • Volunteers to conduct and organize meetings
  • Outreach communication

Any help that we receive whether it be financial or through sweat equity will b greatly appreciated. This is a community Project that will take community effort! 

Thank you in advance for your time and support!

story:
A Little Bout' Me 

  • My name is Ashley Pierre.
  • I am a filmmaker, and this is my second short film.
  • The first one didn't go so well, but it was about 3 years ago, and I've learned a lot since then.

Where Does My Money Go?

The money will go towards purchasing equipment for the short film, such as new audio equipment, new cameras, and new lights. All of the equipment I will purchase (if we hit our goal), will be used to film this short sci fi, and many more films to come.

What Have You Already Done?

Well, so far, my team and I have scouted all the locations, found the actors, and hired some of the stage crew. I'm in the stage of writing the script, we have the plot figured out, we just have to actually write the script.

Sigh* Risks and Challenges

The challenges with completing this project will mainly be raising the money. If you're reading this, that means this campaign is live, but I am doubtful that I will reach the money goal. Hopefully, we can do it, because I promise you, 100% of the money donated will go towards equipment for my films. I really do love improving my craft, and I believe working with the equipment will only make me even better. Thanks!

How to Help Without Spending Money...

If you're not in the situation to donate any money at the moment, you can still help by sharing this page with as many people as possible, via social media or word of mouth. The more people view this page, the more money I'll raise.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary

You can get involved in the production process and the actual making of the film, if you choose. 

Have a say in how the film develops.  Help us make decisions during production, to solve problems, give your opinion on choosing characters, what sets you think work best, and even on how story sequences should progress.  We want to hear from you. 

Join the team with the purchase of any one of our perks (starting at $5), become a valuable part of the production pipeline, and help to make the film.

Get access to a first-look at the completed film

Get access to a first-look at the completed film which you helped create.  AND if you're in Los Angeles at the time, attend a cheese-and-wine pre-screening - be one of the first to see a live screening as you mingle and network with other contributors and filmmakers. 

Producer / Director.  A quick note.

About me, briefly.  I've been making films for many years.  Short films, specifically animated shorts, are my passion.  I have a BA (English / Theatre), MA (Screenwriting), MFA (Screenwriting), and was a professor in the film department of California State University, Northridge.

My most recent film, "Ben and Big", released in 2017, was qualified for Oscar consideration.  "Ben and Big" is currently doing the rounds in many prestigious 2018 festivals here in the USA, and abroad, where it has already been awarded three laurels.  Take a quick look at our Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/LunarSeaProductions/.

Why this latest film is so important to me

From the moment I read the script, I wanted to do this film. 

Since the death of my mom (best friend and an unwavering champion) the question of whether she exists, maybe in some other form somewhere in the multiverse, haunts me.  Is there an afterlife? Can we communicate with loved ones who have passed?  Are they aware of us?  Is there a way to get closure with a message from the afterlife?  And, why do the answers to these questions have to be such a confounded secret?  

Anita's wonderful script offers a painful, tender, and uplifting look at the enduring power of love beyond life.

Your contributions

We're pleased to say that cost of the actual animation process, by far the biggest demand on resources, is covered.  Editing will probably be done in-house, so that's also covered.

The campaign will help us cover:

Design and purchase of elements needed for the animation, including, characters, sets, and props.

Purchase of music for the film.

Color grading at a professional lab, preparation of the master DCP, Title FX, and post-production costs for sound design and mixing, including Sound FX and music.

Even if you can't donate right now, you can still help us a ton

We know some people just can't contribute right now.  If you can't, no prob, you can still be a huge help to the success of the campaign.  It'd be so helpful if you would:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page, to help with the social media blitz !
  • Twitter hashtags are #aGuidingLight   and   #LunarSeaProductions

Whatever you can do to help spread the word... we love it !

story:
THE STORY

Joseph Alexander - husband, father of five young children and butcher by trade - was a white man married to a black woman, Alberta Jones, in the pre-integrated Chicago suburbs. In 1964, his severely mutilated body was found in a shallow ditch a block from their family home. A day later, his wife received a threatening phone call, securing her and her family’s silence for decades. To compound this event, strangely absent from the record books are any signs of a coroner's report and criminal investigation logs.

 

THE STORY & ME

Joseph and Alberta are my grandparents, for years I've grown up knowing very little about their love, why he was murdered, and the reason for Alberta’s silence.  The trauma of the brutal slaying has permeated their son’s, my father’s life.  It's as much his story as it is Joseph and Alberta's. 

 I need your support in revealing the truth and finding peace for my family.

 

 

When I was 9 years old, I picked up my first camera and have been creating stories ever since. I received a degree in Film/Video production from Columbia College Chicago in 2012, and began my "adult" life working in the industry.  I find excitement in filming and solace in editing.   

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

For the last six months, a small team and I have been doing research and conducting preliminary interviews. Contributions will help push the project from the research phase into production. We will start filming the investigation, interviews and recreation footage.

 

Our goal of $50,000 is a portion of production costs, contributions will be distributed as shown:

With continued engagement and further investments, we hope to elevate the production to tell the story in the most visually and emotionally intriguing way.

 

The perks are created in hopes that you will join us on this journey, be a part of the ups and downs, and have your name on a film that makes an impact. 

 

Short Term Goal: 

My short-term goal is to create an ambitious 90-minute documentary to submit to Cannes, Sundance, Tiff, SXSW among other festivals.  Using this avenue to raise the film into the spotlight and garner interest will help secure independent theatrical distributors.  

Long Term Goal: 

There's more than 90 minutes

An hour and a half film is enough time to tell the story, but there's a lot more where that came from.  My ultimate dream is to turn this journey into 8, one hour, episodes that will bring audiences along for a compelling ride of a suspenseful investigation, imaginative recreation, an emotional reflection. We’ll be targeting distributers such as Netflix, Hulu, HBO, Showtime, etc. to maximize the impact of the story. 

 

If the goal is not met, the film will still be made....and still be compelling.  Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, a premiere will be held.    

 

THE IMPACT

Why tell this story?

  • Joseph and Alberta were pioneers, race was an afterthought to their love, they fought discrimination on a daily basis and they strived for their piece of the American dream they would never grasp. Their love should serve as an example for us today, as we live in a country often divided by race, religion, and country of origin.  Inclusion of a more diverse narrative is needed.

 

  • The trauma of the victim's family is often untold. The events that shaped my fathers life and his emotional journey into this ugly past will help humanize the effects of trauma. His courage and willingness to open old wounds will provide an example for viewers to reflect on what events shaped them into the person they are today. 

 

  • Crime and corruption are what kept this story buried in history for so long.  Finding justice shouldn't be a fearful process. For many generations, Joseph's murder has been concealed to keep the family safe. Our family is not the only one coping in silence. The telling of this story can inspire others to speak up about injustices and open a dialogue on how crime is handled in America. 

 

RISK & CHALLENGES

One of the biggest challenges involved with telling this story is time. This event happened over 50 years ago, and a lot of the key players are elderly or deceased. We have been able to identify individuals that were either co-workers, neighbors, or friends of Joseph and Alberta.  We've been fostering relationships for a few months now as the subject matter is sensitive and building trust is essential. 

I am also new to the long form documentary space, this is something I want to be very clear and open about. I believe I have a natural knack for storytelling and drive to get shit done. That said, I believe the story doesn't depend on one person. I have a very talented team, which I'm hoping to grow by fostering connections with creative collaborators who share my vision. 

. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! If you know a friend of a friend that is involved in the entertainment industry, reach out and tell them about this story. If the story intrigues you, share on social media, talk about it, and get the word out that this is a story that needs to be told.
story_txt:
THE STORY

Joseph Alexander - husband, father of five young children and butcher by trade - was a white man married to a black woman, Alberta Jones, in the pre-integrated Chicago suburbs. In 1964, his severely mutilated body was found in a shallow ditch a block from their family home. A day later, his wife received a threatening phone call, securing her and her family’s silence for decades. To compound this event, strangely absent from the record books are any signs of a coroner's report and criminal investigation logs.
 
THE STORY & ME
Joseph and Alberta are my grandparents, for years I've grown up knowing very little about their love, why he was murdered, and the reason for Alberta’s silence.  The trauma of the brutal slaying has permeated their son’s, my father’s life.  It's as much his story as it is Joseph and Alberta's. 
 I need your support in revealing the truth and finding peace for my family.

story:
Here are some of our many supporters from the worlds of sport and entertainment:
 

 

What's the Story?

In 1958 a wonder drug was introduced into the UK, a drug that would cure morning sickness and anxiety in expectant mothers. Sadly, this drug Thalidomide would be the root of the world’s biggest man made disaster. It was not tested properly and rushed to market, before long it was revealed to cause devastating birth defects in unborn babies.
An estimated 123,000 babies died at birth or shortly afterwards, those that did survive had stunted or missing limbs, and a range of symptoms that would prove common to victims of the drug.
Some parents rejected the babies, some families split up from the pressure of raising them, many were sent into care homes out of society’s sight and conscience.

Sixty years on, the Thalidomide babies have become remarkable adults, with an impressive array of accolades and achievements, despite their obvious and immediate physical disadvantages.
Gary Skyner is a stand up comedian, actor, motivational speaker, pilot, paralegal and all round inspiration since he was the country’s second born Thalidomide baby. But despite being born with a severe and limiting deformity, in his own words Gary declares; “Well you can sit in your pyjamas all day and feel sorry for yourself or you can get on with it and live your life!’

Gary believes that the Thalidomide adults deserve some recognition and celebration to mark their remarkable and inspirational lives, so he is calling upon his extensive network of showbiz and sporting celebrities to get behind his night of entertainment and celebration. Gary wants to put on a show in a prestigious theatre, featuring A-list acts and personalities attending, to celebrate the Thalidomide babies and their extraordinary lives. It is to be a distinguished and honourable invitation-only event featuring a who’s who audience, and of course, the creators of the drug are invited.

We are raising money on IndieGoGo to produce the documentary of Gary’s quest. Featuring a host of well loved celebrities and partnered by the inimitable Ricky Tomlinson, the documentary ’60 Years On’ is to be made by a crack team of multi award winning film makers who will bring laughter and tears to a compelling and unforgettable story.  

Who are We?

Ricky Tomlinson - Executive Producer

National Treasure Ricky Tomlinson needs no introduction as one of the most loved actors in the country. Ricky has worked alongside  Hollywood royalty, been a leading figure of one of the best loved TV shows ever and won lifelong respect playing realistic, heartfelt characters with the iconic director Ken Loach. Ricky is a true living legend. With his comforting earthy persona and infectious enthusiasm, there is never a dull moment when Ricky is on screen.

Karl Hall - Producer

Karl Hall is a hugely respected Film and TV producer with an enviable career working with some of the most respected high profile programme makers in the UK. Recently Karl line produced the BAFTA winning film, ‘I am not a Witch’.

Gary Cargill - Executive Producer

With his infinite range and accomplished emotional depth, Gary has a reputation as one of the the most verisimilar actors in UK drama. Gary’s commitment to his roles is exemplary and evidenced in his appearances in mainstream TV and Film. Gary has worked with exceptional directors including Mike Leigh and David Yates.

Steven Nesbit - Director

Steven is a multi award winning writer and director, whose material spans drama, comedy and advertising. Steven is proud to be part of the '60 Years On' Campaign.

Why are We Using Indiegogo?

The story of the Thalidomide babies is delicate. Years of passing blame and wriggling out of responsibility has resulted in adding insult to injury for the victims, and although their fight to be recognised and compensated will continue, this is a story of achievement and inspiration. This is a celebration of human spirit, of determination, of hilarity in the face of adversity and as such cannot be coloured by the agendas of third parties. We must remain democratic in our voice and provide an unbiased film that presents the story, as it happens.

Without the commercial pressures of film making, we are free to allow the film to be seen by as many people as possible world wide, which is our mission.
    

In a world that is intent on creating damning headlines to sensationalise, it is difficult to celebrate the great and come together as humans, but this is our intention. The Thalidomide survivors are truly amazing and transcend the base concerns of our modern world that is obsessed with image and equality, yet fails so many. The survivors have built careers and lives by adapting and being undeterred. The survivors shame us all for whingeing that we don’t like the colour of our hair or want to cover up our freckles! Only crowd funding can make this extraordinary event happen and only you, the sponsor, can empower Gary and Ricky to succeed.

Be part of something fantastic and get your Perk now!

Connor McIntyre signs a Pat Phelan shirt for us to auction.

Ricky 'The Hitman' Hatton signs a pair of boxing gloves for us to auction.

story:
THE STORY
Victor Carter retires from the Marines and heads to his hometown of Dayton, North Carolina to become the new sheriff, expecting speeding tickets and late-night patrols to be the bulk of his work. Of course, every town has its tales and secrets, but none of that affects him. When a group of local teenagers who go missing was last seen entering the nearby ‘Death Woods’, a Victor leads a search party of 30 out to find them. Then things take a turn for the worse.

PRODUCTION DETAILS
The Death Woods script is complete, and the filming will take place in North Carolina with a small team of producers, actors, and crew. We will be using local talent and services throughout the course of the filming.


CAST AND CREW

Drakeo Horton - Producer and CEO of HF Creative Group – Has worked on ‘Klown Forever 2’ and "Solomon Steele"
Charles Horton, Writer and Producer – Has written for and done trailer production on "Solomon Steele"

Joel Fernandez, Producer and Co-Founder of HF Creative Group – Has worked on ‘Klown Forever 2’ and ‘Solomon Steele’

Hamilton Cuthrell, Actor – Will star as Sheriff Victor Carter.

Felicia Renee, Actress – Has starred in ‘Lovers Lane’, ‘For My Man’ and ‘Provision’. Will Play the role of Mrs. Carter. 

Marlin Goodwin, Cinematography - Has over 20 years of video production experience and has produced over 3 short films. You can find more of his work at krucifixproductions.com 

WHAT WE NEED
We’re looking to raise $3000 to cover the cost of equipment, casting, location rental, and other necessities during production, as well as editing during post-production. We will also be paying to have the film placed in festivals. 
It will be made available for digital and on-demand distribution.
 

WHAT YOU GET
Check out our reward tiers that let you support the filming while copping limited-edition Death Woods merchandise. You can also get your very own copy of the film once it’s complete, and find out what happened to the missing teens.


HELP US GET DEATH WOODS MADE!
We can’t do this without you! Please share this campaign with friends and family so they can help Death Woods get made, and lay the mystery to rest once and for all!

story:
Some Background, Some Introduction

When I started writing Ankou, I wrote it because I don’t believe I have ever seen a good horror movie about Death or the Grim Reaper.  So I taxed myself with the challenge to write one and after nearly a year of writing and editing and redrafting, I know I have it.  When I collaborated with Elizabeth and her husband, T Scott Ross, on our award-winning short, The Re-Renaissance (Audience Choice, Sparrow Film Project ‘14, New York, NY), I knew that they were the perfect duo to help be bring Ankou off the page and to life.

Also, the representation of women behind the camera in movies, though getting better, is still sparse, especially in the horror genre.  I couldn’t be more excited that Elizabeth is with us as our cinematographer and essentially my co-director.  Our production manager, Tiffany Gale, is also a woman starting her career in the movie industry.  I don’t want this to start sounding preachy or anything but this is a huge opportunity for all of us, Elizabeth and Tiffany and every woman in our cast and crew in particular.
 

The Story

Ankou tells the story of six friends who are celebrating the New Year and suddenly find themselves caught in Ankou’s sights.  Now, you make ask yourself, ‘Who’s Ankou?’ Well, Ankou is a centuries-old Briton-Celtic myth about a ghostly figure that wears a wide-brimmed hat that goes around collecting souls to ferry to the afterlife.  Some would say he’s the Grim Reaper of that region of the world.  But I think he’s more.

Unlike the Grim Reaper, who remains the same through all of time, Ankou is ever changing.  Ankou is said to take on the form of the last person in his village to die each year and that person must spend the next year collecting and carting souls to the afterlife if he has any hopes of moving on.

How much more interesting is that than a spirit with a skull-face wielding a scythe (don’t worry, there will still be a scythe in this movie)?  This is an incarnation of Death that has a purpose, just as a protagonist does in any movie. Thus, Ankou was born.

So this is our Get-Ankou-Off-The-Ground campaign.  We are running this campaign to cover every expense so we can move to filming.  That includes travel, housing, locations, costumes, insurance, rentals, salaries, catering, and all the other stuff that goes into making a movie that people, including myself up until about 7 months ago, don’t realize.

We will run another campaign while we are filming, based on the success of this campaign, to cover post-production costs but we won’t have any need for those without a film to take to post-production.  

You can make that happen for us.  So let’s scare some people and make a movie!


Who Are We?

 

Dave Stishan is Baltimore native, actor, and an award-winning screenwriter and filmmaker brandishing a BFA in Acting from Shenandoah Conservatory.  His most recent project, The Re-Renaissance, in conjunction with Faux Reel Studios, took home the Audience Choice award at The Sparrow Film Project in New York.  As a writer, Dave has written two full length plays and numerous one-acts. Most recently, his one-act, The Fitting, was produced as part of the 2018 New York Winterfest Play Festival.  In 2011, his play, September 11th Was a Tuesday, took runner-up honors in the New Voices of Virginia Playwriting Competition.  His screenplay, Seahorse, won the Bronze in the 2016 World Series of Screenwriting and Top-10 honors in the Hollywood Screenwriting Competition.  As an actor, he’s performed all along the East Coast as well as co-starring roles on Blacklist and HBO’s Vinyl.

 

Elizabeth Eckert-Ross hails from NYC and is an award winning filmmaker, actor, and musician. She is the founder and lead creative mind behind Faux Reel Studios, whose most recent production, The Re-Renaissance, received "Audience Choice" at The Sparrow Film Project '14.  Other productions include Prepared (Preparing for Audition Season) -Winner for "Best Music Video" at The 2017 Portland Comedy Film Festival and Put 'Em Up -Featured at The December 2017 Iron Mule Short Comedy Festival in Brooklyn NY. When she's not making films, you can catch her around the city playing with her band-Bourbon & Bliss. Elizabeth holds a B.F.A from Shenandoah Conservatory. Check out our work at www.fauxreelstudios.com

 

How You Can Help

We’ve taken the budget and looked at exactly what we’ll need to get this production started and the magic number we came up with was $44,750.  That breaks down like this:

 

In a nutshell, that is everything we will need to get ourselves ready for the production and start filming.  Anything extra that we raise will go towards ‘General Overhead’ for on-set purchases (props that break, duct tape, batteries, more duct tape, etc.).

 

Now, this isn’t the entire budget.  Like we said above, we will be running another campaign based on the success of this campaign, to cover all our post-production costs, but this is the number that will Get-Ankou-Off-The-Ground.

Wait, What's a 'Big Actor Cost'?

We have been very fortunate to enter very serious contract talks and negotiations with the legendary horror actor, Michael Berryman, and his agent.  Mr. Berryman is known for films such as The Hills Have Eyes, The Hills Have Eyes Part II, The Devil's Rejects, Weird Science, The Lords of Salem, as well as countless others as well as recurring spots on Star Trek.  Trust me, you know his face.  This is a number I have come up with that would cover (most of) his salary plus is travel, lodging, and any other riders he may have in order to be a part of this picture.

Having Mr. Berryman onboard for this project would be humungous.  It would be like Bill Gates endorsing a new app or Bruce Springsteen publicly endorsing a rising talent's debut CD.  He's an icon and legend in every sense of the word and having him onboard definitely does raise the budget a bit but the benefits of having someone of his expertise, experience, and presence vastly outweighs the rise in budget.  There's no doubt that he will give what is already a solid script and concept that extra X-factor.


So Why Should I Give You My Money?

 

Now, like with every Indiegogo campaign, we have some pretty exciting perks and rewards to reward your generosity.  Everything ranging from signed movie posters to in-person or online acting sessions, digital downloads, advanced viewings, and even visits to the set (if you’re local-ish).  We might even throw in an invite to join us at a film festival. However, every single donation, no matter the size, will get you listed in the credits because, at the end of the day, this movie will not have been able to be made without your donation and that deserves to be seen and recognized.

And we know times are tough for everyone and if you aren't able to donate right now, then we ask that you please share this campaign.  Every share is as impactful as a donation.  Even if you do donate, please share the campaign.  There can never be enough eyes on this campaign.  And, if you do donate, please leave us a comment.  We'd love to hear from you and what you thought of this presentation!

Simply put this is what Elizabeth, T Scott, all of our actors, our crew, and I have been working for.  This is what we want to do for a living (not create crowdfunding campaigns but create movies and stories and art).  We want to show people that it doesn’t matter what credits do or don’t come along with your name, what matters is if there’s a will.  Like the message in Field of Dreams, “If you build it, they will come.”  Well, that’s the plan.

And, just to reiterate, I could not be more excited that the majority of our crew, as it currently stands, is female and for that to be the case in this male-dominated industry and genre is all the more reason to get behind this project and make sure that this movie is made.  Everyone has a voice and everyone has the opportunity.

Making a movie is not easy.  Well, if you have a $50M budget, things might be a little easier, but those productions are still not without their own sets of challenges.  We do not have a $50M budget. We, as of now, do not have the reputation of a Wes Craven or John Carpenter or Stephen King or James Wan. When we yell ‘That’s a wrap’ on the final day of shooting in a way, our true challenge will just be beginning.  We will have a movie, now we’ll need to get people to see it. But at one point, all those people I just mentioned had the same worry. ‘Who will watch my movie once it’s done?’  That remains to be said but one this is for sure, they’re going to want to see; a quality product, a professional shoot, a solid story, an honest portrayal, and, most of all, they’re going to want to know that the time they spent watching Ankou was time well spent.  

With your donation to this project, we all can ensure that all of those ‘worries’ will be well taken care of. Like it’s been said; we have a very solid story, a top-notch crew waiting to be discovered, a cast eager to bring the words to life, and a confidence that you will thoroughly enjoy the time you spent watching Ankou.  Don’t believe us?  Donate and let us prove you wrong.  You do believe us? Donate and let us show you that your generosity was well placed.

Also, the representation of women behind the camera in movies, though getting better, is still sparse, especially in the horror genre.  I couldn’t be more excited that Elizabeth is with us as our cinematographer and essentially my co-director.  Our production manager, Tiffany Gale, is also a woman starting her career in the movie industry.  I don’t want this to start sounding preachy or anything but this is a huge opportunity for all of us, Elizabeth and Tiffany and every woman in our cast and crew in particular. 
The Story
Ankou tells the story of six friends who are celebrating the New Year and suddenly find themselves caught in Ankou’s sights.  Now, you make ask yourself, ‘Who’s Ankou?’ Well, Ankou is a centuries-old Briton-Celtic myth about a ghostly figure that wears a wide-brimmed hat that goes around collecting souls to ferry to the afterlife.  Some would say he’s the Grim Reaper of that region of the world.  But I think he’s more.
Unlike the Grim Reaper, who remains the same through all of time, Ankou is ever changing.  Ankou is said to take on the form of the last person in his village to die each year and that person must spend the next year collecting and carting souls to the afterlife if he has any hopes of moving on.
How much more interesting is that than a spirit with a skull-face wielding a scythe (don’t worry, there will still be a scythe in this movie)?  This is an incarnation of Death that has a purpose, just as a protagonist does in any movie. Thus, Ankou was born.
So this is our Get-Ankou-Off-The-Ground campaign.  We are running this campaign to cover every expense so we can move to filming.  That includes travel, housing, locations, costumes, insurance, rentals, salaries, catering, and all the other stuff that goes into making a movie that people, including myself up until about 7 months ago, don’t realize.
We will run another campaign while we are filming, based on the success of this campaign, to cover post-production costs but we won’t have any need for those without a film to take to post-production.  
You can make that happen for us.  So let’s scare some people and make a movie!

Who Are We?
 

Dave Stishan is Baltimore native, actor, and an award-winning screenwriter and filmmaker brandishing a BFA in Acting from Shenandoah Conservatory.  His most recent project, The Re-Renaissance, in conjunction with Faux Reel Studios, took home the Audience Choice award at The Sparrow Film Project in New York.  As a writer, Dave has written two full length plays and numerous one-acts. Most recently, his one-act, The Fitting, was produced as part of the 2018 New York Winterfest Play Festival.  In 2011, his play, September 11th Was a Tuesday, took runner-up honors in the New Voices of Virginia Playwriting Competition.  His screenplay, Seahorse, won the Bronze in the 2016 World Series of Screenwriting and Top-10 honors in the Hollywood Screenwriting Competition.  As an actor, he’s performed all along the East Coast as well as co-starring roles on Blacklist and HBO’s Vinyl. 
Elizabeth Eckert-Ross hails from NYC and is an award winning filmmaker, actor, and musician. She is the founder and lead creative mind behind Faux Reel Studios, whose most recent production, The Re-Renaissance, received "Audience Choice" at The Sparrow Film Project '14.  Other productions include Prepared (Preparing for Audition Season) -Winner for "Best Music Video" at The 2017 Portland Comedy Film Festival and Put 'Em Up -Featured at The December 2017 Iron Mule Short Comedy Festival in Brooklyn NY. When she's not making films, you can catch her around the city playing with her band-Bourbon & Bliss. Elizabeth holds a B.F.A from Shenandoah Conservatory. Check out our work at www.fauxreelstudios.com
 
How You Can Help
We’ve taken the budget and looked at exactly what we’ll need to get this production started and the magic number we came up with was $44,750.  That breaks down like this:
 In a nutshell, that is everything we will need to get ourselves ready for the production and start filming.  Anything extra that we raise will go towards ‘General Overhead’ for on-set purchases (props that break, duct tape, batteries, more duct tape, etc.). Now, this isn’t the entire budget.  Like we said above, we will be running another campaign based on the success of this campaign, to cover all our post-production costs, but this is the number that will Get-Ankou-Off-The-Ground.
Wait, What's a 'Big Actor Cost'?
We have been very fortunate to enter very serious contract talks and negotiations with the legendary horror actor, Michael Berryman, and his agent.  Mr. Berryman is known for films such as The Hills Have Eyes, The Hills Have Eyes Part II, The Devil's Rejects, Weird Science, The Lords of Salem, as well as countless others as well as recurring spots on Star Trek.  Trust me, you know his face.  This is a number I have come up with that would cover (most of) his salary plus is travel, lodging, and any other riders he may have in order to be a part of this picture.
Having Mr. Berryman onboard for this project would be humungous.  It would be like Bill Gates endorsing a new app or Bruce Springsteen publicly endorsing a rising talent's debut CD.  He's an icon and legend in every sense of the word and having him onboard definitely does raise the budget a bit but the benefits of having someone of his expertise, experience, and presence vastly outweighs the rise in budget.  There's no doubt that he will give what is already a solid script and concept that extra X-factor.


So Why Should I Give You My Money? Now, like with every Indiegogo campaign, we have some pretty exciting perks and rewards to reward your generosity.  Everything ranging from signed movie posters to in-person or online acting sessions, digital downloads, advanced viewings, and even visits to the set (if you’re local-ish).  We might even throw in an invite to join us at a film festival. However, every single donation, no matter the size, will get you listed in the credits because, at the end of the day, this movie will not have been able to be made without your donation and that deserves to be seen and recognized.
And we know times are tough for everyone and if you aren't able to donate right now, then we ask that you please share this campaign.  Every share is as impactful as a donation.  Even if you do donate, please share the campaign.  There can never be enough eyes on this campaign.  And, if you do donate, please leave us a comment.  We'd love to hear from you and what you thought of this presentation!
Simply put this is what Elizabeth, T Scott, all of our actors, our crew, and I have been working for.  This is what we want to do for a living (not create crowdfunding campaigns but create movies and stories and art).  We want to show people that it doesn’t matter what credits do or don’t come along with your name, what matters is if there’s a will.  Like the message in Field of Dreams, “If you build it, they will come.”  Well, that’s the plan.
And, just to reiterate, I could not be more excited that the majority of our crew, as it currently stands, is female and for that to be the case in this male-dominated industry and genre is all the more reason to get behind this project and make sure that this movie is made.  Everyone has a voice and everyone has the opportunity.Making a movie is not easy.  Well, if you have a $50M budget, things might be a little easier, but those productions are still not without their own sets of challenges.  We do not have a $50M budget. We, as of now, do not have the reputation of a Wes Craven or John Carpenter or Stephen King or James Wan. When we yell ‘That’s a wrap’ on the final day of shooting in a way, our true challenge will just be beginning.  We will have a movie, now we’ll need to get people to see it. But at one point, all those people I just mentioned had the same worry. ‘Who will watch my movie once it’s done?’  That remains to be said but one this is for sure, they’re going to want to see; a quality product, a professional shoot, a solid story, an honest portrayal, and, most of all, they’re going to want to know that the time they spent watching Ankou was time well spent.  With your donation to this project, we all can ensure that all of those ‘worries’ will be well taken care of. Like it’s been said; we have a very solid story, a top-notch crew waiting to be discovered, a cast eager to bring the words to life, and a confidence that you will thoroughly enjoy the time you spent watching Ankou.  Don’t believe us?  Donate and let us prove you wrong.  You do believe us? Donate and let us show you that your generosity was well placed.

story:
Synopsis

Fisher takes place in the small town of Eden, TN. Where Clara Banks, a high school senior, has an unusual hobby. Catfishing. It was all fun and games until she started receiving twisted messages at her school and her home. Now Clara fears for her life. Will she ever feel safe again, now that evil has come knocking?

What We Need

We are seeking $11,000.

What Will It Be Used For

$6,000 will be used for film production.  Funds will be put towards wardrobe, set design, make up, food for cast and crew, equipment, props, music, and others necessities needed to create a quality film.  Our talented crew is revved and ready to begin production this Fall. We are currently in pre-production and so far the storyboards have been completed, the script has been revised, set location scouting has begun, and casting is currently in progress. We have seen an enormous amount of talent so far and will update you on who we cast by mid-July. We will be sharing images from set throughout the film and keep you updated on the films progress. We want you to be with us every step of the way!

The other $5,000 will be donated to the local high school that we use as a set location. Out of that $5,000, $4,000 will be donated to the arts programs (split between band, choir, drama, and art)  because the arts are important. They are what drive the creativity of our youth.  It is that creativity that enables them to become the innovators of tomorrow. We have to continue to nourish it.

Speaking of nourish this is where the last $1,000 comes into play. That last $1,000 will go to the lunch program. You cannot properly create on an empty stomach. 16 million children go hungry a year in the U.S. That is 1 in 5 children. Sometimes their school lunch is their only opportunity for a balanced meal and no kid should go hungry. With proper nutrition a kid can thrive and have the fuel needed to succeed in their studies. With kids thriving it helps to shape a better generation of adults. If we go over our campaign amount, more funds would go towards the lunch program.

Additionally after post production is complete, a percentage of each film sale, will continue going into the lunch program. It only takes one act of kindness to cause a ripple effect and I would like our project to be a cause of a ripple. 

What You Get

We have some great perks for you! Perks like finding your name in the film, film memorabilia, copy of the film, and obscure gifts (just to keep it interesting). We are sure the obscure will make ya smile. 

You don't only get perks but you get to be a perk in the lives of the children from the school. And that is the greatest perk of all!

Trials and Tribulations

All films, no matter how long you plan will have hiccups, but you learn to adapt in order to create your vision. Not that much different than life. We learn and adapt. We are ready for what comes our way because we believe in what we are doing. For every hiccup that tries to take you down, the perfect moments fuel the fire to see it through.

With YOU!!

We can bring a vision to life and make a difference. With one small step for a film and one giant act of kindness for a child's life.

story:
Our Mission

Is to produce a social impact documentary showcasing the Bronx community and literacy activists, educators, families, publishers, writers, librarians, bookstore owners, and city representatives collaborating toward a mutual goal of increasing literacy.

As of August 2018, The Bronx has a population of 1.5 million - 42 square miles and no independent bookstores. We will have our first independent bookstore in the South Bronx, this year.

We believe an increased emphasis on reading and consistently volunteering to encourage and aid those to read in Bronx communities is the start toward ending this literacy crisis.  We need to inform our current and new representatives that this is a topic of importance to us and  that stimulating legislative measures that provide access to affordable education opportunities are essential. These measures would act to curb economic discrimination, end segregated education, and ignite the process of lifting families out of poverty.

Why a documentary?

We believe one of the best ways to solve a major problem is to showcase both the problem and solution, visually. This systemic crisis, has been born out of years of neglect, ignorance, racism.

We will make sure this film is seen globally. It will be screened for national legislatures, city councils, and literacy organizations.  Our goal is to incite policy change and social change. We want to bolster the culture of reading in The Bronx.

What We Need

Our fundraising goal is to raise $40, 000 for a 40 minute film. The budget below lists the cost of our projected production and post-production.

Production includes:

-Hiring the crew ( 40%): Our crew will consist of Camera Operators, Assistant Camera Operators, Sound Mixers, Production Assistants, Grips & Gaffers.  We see to pay the rates that are respectful of their experience and housing needs. As we need to notify our cast where they will be filming, location costed have been included in this section.

-Feeding Our Crew ( 20% ): To exemplify our mission and support the community that we will be documenting, we will be eating at Bronx venues and businesses.

-Renting Video Equipment ( 13% ):  For this project we will be renting and purchasing various equipment for capturing film. Some of the equipment that we have selected is  the Panasonic Gh4 4K Camera, Lens, Lighting and Audio gear.

-Purchasing Equipment/ Liability Insurance ( 5% ): Accidents happen; to protect our crew and rented equipment we will be purchasing insurance for filming on locations.

-Other production costs ( 8%  ):  We also need to purchase external hard drives that will store the media that we capture. 4K footage takes up lots of spaces. As we will incur hours and of footage and thousands of gigabytes. Additionally, the Bronx is vast and we need support with transportation costs of our crew.

-Post-production ( 8%): This means we've captured all the moments needed and it is now time to make the documentary come to life through Editing, Color Grading, Scoring , and Audio mastering.

-Distribution ( 6% ): Distributing our film to festivals, screening it throughout Bronx at schools, theaters, parks, museums, our first bookstore, and other Bronx businesses will require money.

 

What You Get

Our unique perks, include our BX Turning the Page on Illiteracy in the Bronx t-shirts.

Our Partners

In collaborating with nonprofits in and around The Bronx, we are continuing to establish our involvement in the Bronx community.

 

The Impact

Illiteracy and poverty are often intertwined. Without the ability to read, your chances of securing employment, a home, and food, the life you want, dwindles. This is not to say that it is impossible! That would be a disservice to the countless people who have survived, and thrived against the odds. We do not seek to diminish those accomplishments. We seek to increase the support that Bronx residents receive, and believe that a literary culture could move us forward as community.

It begins with the desire to learn, but continues with the opportunity. Your contribution will help us to visually highlight the need of this opportunity for the people of The Bronx.

The positive impact we seek is an increased number of readers, books in the home to promote the importance of family literacy, students reading at and beyond their grade levels, widespread and affordable ESL programs, authors visiting Bronx institutions to see, read, and inspire people of color, and more literary arts, accessible college readiness programs , and increased GED programs.

 

The Team

Gregory Hernandez is a Bronx native and resident.  He received a Bachelor’s degree in English from Binghamton University, where he concentrated on Creative Writing. His desire to tell stories visually has lead him to study screenwriting, photography, and cinema. Since 2014, he has produced and written over 13 works.

The decision to start a short documentary on the literacy challenge in The Bronx arose from searching for a bookstore to film in for a short film. Upon learning that borough’s sole bookstore was located 10 miles away from his home, Gregory set out to tell a compelling story about how The Bronx had reached this point, what/how Bronxites planned to do to solve this crisis, and how this crisis effects children who live in poverty. The Bronx currently has no bookstores, but one will open soon in the South Bronx, called "The Lit Bar"

Rabia Sultana is a British Archaeologist turned Filmmaker. Born and raised in London, she acted on stage at the renowned Stratford Theatre, Stratford Circus, and the Criterion Theatre in a rendition of The Lion King, before pursuing her BA in Archaeology at the University of Sheffield, UK. Rabia believes that visual media is one of the most powerful tools we have to entertain, inspire and use as a platform to explore social issues, while telling the stories of your everyday, extraordinary lives. It is, for this reason, she works within both narrative and documentary films.

Some of her most recent narrative projects include Interference (2017), Man-Babies (2017) and feature film, Prom King, 2010 (2017).

McKinley Jeter began his career as a social worker in his hometown of Chicago working for local government agencies and community-based organizations. After finding himself constantly filling his time outside of work assisting fashion photographers and filmmakers on set in Chicago and Atlanta, he moved to NYC in 2017 (leaving his beloved Cubs and deep dish pizza behind) to pursue his dream of evolving as a visual artist. Since then has worked collaborated on projects with local creatives and media outlets--while refining his own skills behind the camera and in the editing room.

 

Risks & Challenges

Bringing awareness is part of the goal, but ultimately we want those who see this documentary to rise to action.

We want our viewers to be empowered,  and to become an active member in their community,  and remain vigilant of policies that can have negatively impact the lives of Bronxites.

Filmmaking is an expensive and arduous journey. The phases of research, development, pre-production, production, post-production and distribution are all littered with creative obstacles that require sharpened skills and due diligence to overcome.

Ultimately, the task of completing this film, pales in comparison to getting it seen by as many people as possible. If a film is made, but nobody watches it, is it really a film?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're asking for collaborators!

Even if you cannot donate, you can spread the word through social media and your personal networks through email and word of mouth. Tell all of your friends and family about our efforts.

Post a one minute video on Instagram, with your favorite books, and tell others how reading has had an impact on your life. Our documentary wants to show others that reading is transformative.

Send us suggestions of individuals and organizations to collaborate with. Our documentary has grown time and time again through this type of networking!


Thank you for reading and for your support!

story:
Short Film Synopsis

Murder in a modern Babylon follows the story of Miles Dalmas, a detective working to find a killer who murdered the girl he met the previous night. But when the police block his path and his urge to solve the case becomes too great, he must decide what he is willing to do in order to bring the killer to justice.

The themes of corruption and morality are the heart of the story. Can a person remain good in a world where it's moral arbiters are corrupt? And what is the price paid by those who try to remain good in a corrupt world?

This project is intended as a proof of concept for a larger story. This film will provide an introduction to the world and the characters that inhabit it. While also hopefully giving the audience enough to make them want to see more.

Inspired by both real world news stories about cover ups by british police and the italian giallo films of the 1970's, we aim to make a horror/ thriller that gets people talking. But we need your help.

Our Crew

We are a crew of talented media students at Bournemouth University:

Writer/ Director- Joshua Greally

DOP- Josh Pyman

Editor- Thomas Jackson

What We Need

In order to ensure that we make the best product possible we need funds in order to:

  • Transport cast and crew, as well as accommodate actors
  • Pay for locations (including office spaces and nightclubs)
  • Make props, prosthetics and provide costumes for the actors
  • Compose music
  • Hire additional equipment
  • Provide catering for the cast and crew

We aim to make the best film possible, but as a student team we have very little money to help us make the production as good as it can be. Because of this we need your help.  Every little bit that you can give (even £1 donations) will help us in a big way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some may not be able to donate to the campaign, but if you would like to help us in other ways, then please help us get the word around about our project.

Be sure to share this page with your friends on social media and spread the word to colleagues and neighbours.

If you would like further information or would like to get involved with the project in any way then contact us at: s5075377@bournemouth.ac.uk

THANK YOU FOR READING.

Make props, prosthetics and provide costumes for the actors
Compose music
Hire additional equipment
Provide catering for the cast and crew

We aim to make the best film possible, but as a student team we have very little money to help us make the production as good as it can be. Because of this we need your help.  Every little bit that you can give (even £1 donations) will help us in a big way.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some may not be able to donate to the campaign, but if you would like to help us in other ways, then please help us get the word around about our project.
Be sure to share this page with your friends on social media and spread the word to colleagues and neighbours.
If you would like further information or would like to get involved with the project in any way then contact us at: s5075377@bournemouth.ac.uk
THANK YOU FOR READING.

story:
MEHAR follows the life of a professional wrestler from Singapore in the 1960s until 1990s. He was trained under the great wrestler from Hungary, King Kong and was part of the New World Alliance (NWA) group. Mehar Singh forged a name for himself, having wrestled Jimmy 'Snuka' Superfly, Abdullah the Butcher, partnered Uncle Elmer in a Tag Team match and refereed a historical match that took place in Gay World stadium, Singapore between the legendary Andre the Giant and King Curtis Iaukea in 1977.

Mehar had lived the kind of life that millions of wrestling fans would have dreamt off. He was in good company with wrestlers that later went on to be inducted in WWE Hall of Fame. He has seen it all and he speaks highly about his past achievements. As a small Singh, he makes up for his lack of size with his immense strength of courage. He was unwavering in the ring, collecting scars and fractured bones as memorabilia. 

But that was in the past. Now, he lives his life quietly with his family, working part-time as a house detective for a local supermarket and goes around hardly noticed as the great Singapore wrestler he was in his heydays.

This documentary will explore the life of a wrestler living in 1960s Singapore, the atmosphere surrounding a wrestling match at the once famous Gay World stadium (famously dubbed as the Madison Square Garden of Asia), his life stories as a wrestler growing up in a conservative Hindu family, the peaks and troughs as a wrestler and how WWF changed the entire wrestling business.

Mehar has one wish he wishes to fulfil - to be remembered as a legend. This documentary aims to be the 'voice' for his wish and hopefully be remembered as a wrestling legend within the wrestling community.

What We Need

We aim to raise USD 8000 for this documentary and the bulk of the money goes to the production and post-production of this film - crew, location fee, talent fee (Mehar Singh) and editing fees. A small amount will also be used for film festivals fees and promo/marketing expenses.

Breakdown of Budget

75% - Production + Post Production

25% - Film Festivals, Marketing + Publicity Expenses

What if we fail to raise the intended amount?

Mehar, The Documentary will still move ahead. We will still be as passionate as we were when we started this project and will continuously work towards telling his story to the world - even if it takes a longer time to complete it!

How your support will help us.

We do understand that not everyone can contribute money to our campaign. But, there are other ways you can help us. Start by getting the word out there to anyone and everyone about our campaign. Help us share the campaign through Indiegogo, or on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
 
Do follow us on our website, IG, Facebook for updates.
www.sevenonefilms.sg
www.instagram.com/sevenonefilms/
FB-sevenone films
https://igg.me/at/mehar-docu
 
The more people who hear about the campaign, the more likely we are to succeed!
 
Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi there!

I'm Isabel Canzoneri and I'm from Brazil. I've been living in the US since 2007 when I got married. I have a degree in Marketing and it was quite hard for me when I started to look for jobs here and couldn't get anything in the area that I used to work in my home country and that really frustrated me.

In my frustration I forgot what I really think about life. Everything happens for a reason and everything is always well.

This campaign is very important to me because I think it is important to be compensated for our efforts and work. Actors tend to do a lot of work for free because they love the craft so much and want to be in as many project that they possibly can and it's okay.

However, I understand that besides precious time, actors spend some money too in the process. They pay for gas to get to the set, they buy some snacks, they print the script and call sheet... they spend money so I really think it's important for us filmmakers to compensate them, even if it is only for the gas. It is really appreciated by them and they will want to work again with the people who treated them with the respect they deserve. After all, we are a team so helping each other out goes without saying.

Besides paying cast and crew, filmmakers must feed them while they are on set. It's usually a long day when we are on set and as the day goes by, so do our energy. Can you imagine how a film would look like if the actors were hungry? You know, when you get hungry, you get cranky!

To bring a film to the screen for the enjoyment of an audience, money is necessary and we need a little help and of course that will be more than appreciated.

 

What You Give and What You Get!

  • We need $7500! That will cover all the expenses.
  • With your help, we will be so happy we will be giving shout out to you on social media if that's important to you. We think it's pretty cool! You could also be an Associate Producer! Now, how awesome is that? Seeing your name on the credits on IMDB! Even a thank on IMDB would be super satisfying and we will be happy to add your name to our credits there! Hooray!!!
  • The money will go to paying cast (3) and crew (that one is a minimum, you wouldn't believe this), composers (we have two), editor, DP...
  • Besides paying for cast and crew, then there's food, drinks (no alcohol, I promise that!), snacks, more drinks (it's been so hot lately!), napkins, toilet paper, sun screen (it's been really hot guys!).
  • And then there are expenses such as gas for location scout, drive to and from set a couple of times, batteries for camera, tapes, markers, ink for printer, paper to print release forms, talent release, script, call sheet, folder (you gotta be organized), submission fees and other expenses I can't remember now and I'll find the invoices later! Oh boy!

All contributors will receive a code with 20% off to purchase any product from http://mypowerofone.com/. They have wonderful soft t-shirts, hats and even baby apparel with very inspirational words, just like our film! Head to their website and check them out then come back fast to get your coupon code when you contribute to our campaign. Now, that's a treat! That's what we call good karma!

The Impact

Guys, this project is very up lifting with very positive message. If you knew how precious your life is and the human being you are has so much to offer to the world!

This project came from my heart and we are so pleased with the end product that we are just too happy to express. You know when your heart is so full of gratitude that it feels like it will explode? That's how we are feeling and we want to share that with you as well. We want you to feel your heart with love and gratitude. We want you to share this feeling with someone you love and we know you will love it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Look, we understand that not everybody has money around to spare but we want you to know that every little thing counts. Really! You have no idea. Of course if you have the entire amount we are asking and are willing to invest in us, we will accept without questioning! Anyone? :-)

With that being said, we are taking whatever you can contribute, $100, $50, $40, $20, $10, $6, $5, $2, $1... It doesn't matter the amount you can contribute.

Can't contribute financially, well that's okay, we still like you! Perhaps you can share this campaign with your friends and family and they might be able to help us out a bit and it would be wonderful!

Share our campaign and we will thank you for that as well!! You can share directly from this page, on Twitter or Facebook... The more the merrier

We can't wait to share our beautiful film with you guys.

Thank you so much for your support and kindness!

In Gratitude,

Isabel and Team

story:
Almost two decades ago, I was hired to be a one-on-one aide to a student with cerebral palsy. His name is Mike Berkson. Over the years we have shared many experiences and overcome many obstacles, and we have helped each other discover our mutual talents. Our friendship has translated into a universal message. Our story has been featured in over 250 newspapers across the globe, we have performed our live stage show for over 150,000 people. We are Handicap This Productions.

 

Mike and I have been traveling the country over the past 9 years sharing our story of acceptance and inclusion. We met in 2001 when I was hired to do the things for Mike that he couldn’t do for himself, like taking notes in school, feeding, and helping him with the bathroom, just to name a few.

 

Thru the years our unique bond strengthened and people started asking us to share our story. Before we knew it, we were performing on stages all across the country. During this time we have heard countless stories of how our relationship has helped individuals accomplish more with what they have. Universities have experienced their students become more engaged with making a difference. Corporations have noticed more understanding and compassion in their employees. Our story is powerful and reaches any audience.

 

This campaign is about more than us and the over 150,000 people we have performed for thus far. It is about making minds accessible across the globe. Our goal is to positively impact the masses from the comfort of their own home. We have recorded our show and are making it available online - so anyone with an internet connection can be inspired and uplifted by our story.

 

We are searching for funding in the amount of $26,521. For the past nine years our business operation has been focused on educating, empowering and entertaining our audience. We weren’t necessarily focused on being profitable. Not to get overly in the weeds, but it has been a graduate level course in how to run a business. At times we were successful, other times we were not. Now we are serious about wanting to merge the two, making a positive impact with our message, while increasing our bottom line.

 

Where does this money go? First and foremost it will help us pay for the production of this video of our show. We rented cameras, hired people to run those cameras (a 4 camera shoot!), and now need all the footage edited. If you are fans of ours, you know that we have produced a substantial amount of content, especially in the form of videos. Your contribution will also help us continue to produce this type of content for years to come allowing us to operate our business even more efficiently.

 

What are some of the perks we are offering? The main perk is our show, you will be getting the digital version in 4K quality. We are also offering individualized videos, in person presentations, producer credit, executive producer credit and even Title Sponsor of the digital version. For more detailed info check out the perk page. :)

 

Aside from money, there are some other ways you can help our cause!

 

We need our campaign to make some noise! Share it on your Facebook page, Twitter, Instagram or you can even make a YouTube video about it! Indiegogo has many different “share” options, please use the one you are most comfortable with because we could use the help.

 

If you are part of a corporation, community, or organization, let those members know by sending an email on our behalf. (We will even write one for you!) As you can see, help is needed to create a buzz and if you have read this far, you are just the person we need to help. :)

 

If you are new to our message, you may be wondering how this relationship really started to blossom? Well, in 2005 I decided to run from Orlando, FL to Chicago, IL (where we are from) to increase awareness for how Mike lives, increase awareness around cerebral palsy, and to show people what is possible, because I wasn’t a runner before the Orlando event. That 1,200 mile run put our story on the map and that was the domino that fell and made everything you are reading possible.

 

In 2016, I made that run a second time (at the age of 42!). People would ask me why I would do that run again. I say to them, as I will say to you, because my work isn’t finished, is yours? Our story has a way of bringing out the best in people. We are looking forward to meeting you soon. Thank you for your support. Yours truly, Tim Wambach
