story:
Movie Synopsis

In New York, December 1822, Dr. Clement Moore, a professor of world literature, is inspired to pen a holiday poem for his young children. Influenced by the folklore of Old World culture, Moore crafts his whimsical piece into a magical tale about a kind and generous gift-bearer that secretly visits homes on Christmas Eve, delivering joy to children around the world.

It is while musing about this seemingly mythical character that Moore first learns of the ancient story of a gift-giver from the Greco-Roman Era; one that he comes to believe may be the origin of similar fables throughout the world. What he finds is a tale that ironically would be lost to the lore he was about to immortalize. He soon uncovers the surprising story of a mighty empire at a crossroads in history and of an orphan boy from Asia Minor, whose own journey to find his destiny would one day lead him to the city of Myra.

Moore had discovered the lost legend of Nicholas, a selfless child that became an heroic man of faith, a devout bishop by day and a secret gift-giver by night; a man whom in the face of terrible greed and persecution would prove that not every hero swings a sword. It was the story of Christmas origins, the story of selflessness and sacrifice, yet ultimately it's about the power of storytelling and the hope it can bring. It is the now forgotten tale of the beloved saint named Nicholas...Nicholas of Myra.

Actor Matthew Mesler in "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS"

How You Can Become A Supporter Of The Film

In staying true to the independent spirit of the film, the Indiegogo platform was the clear choice to launch a crowdfunding campaign. With support of backers like you, Gerald Hartke and the creative team behind "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS" subsequently aim to finish the film and screen it for several interested distributors. If you believe in the uplifting message of the movie and the value of family entertainment, as well as the positive example the producers are striving to set for independent filmmaking, please consider backing the effort with your financial support.

Anyone that backs the film for $10 OR MORE, will also have their name placed in the closing credits of the actual film! Below are a list of the perks you can claim and the items that are included in each:

$10 - SAMPLE GIFT PACK

  • Printable 8 x 10 Images - three (3) full-color, print-quality scene and character images from "NICHOLAS OF MYRA"; available for download at 300 p.p.i.

  • Printable Graphic Art - three (3) full-color, print-quality graphic art images created for "NICHOLAS OF MYRA"; available for download at 300 p.p.i.

  • MP3's From Movie Soundtrack - three (3) MP3 orchestral music tracks from the upcoming "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" movie soundtrack and "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS" companion album; created by film composer Seth Stachowski and orchestrated by Phillip Klein

$15 - ONLINE GIFT PASS

  • ​Password To Exclusive Content - view password-protected media for Indiegogo backers; including exclusive videos, photos and information

  • Behind The Scenes Web Access - access behind-the-scenes news and updates; including additional "Making of The Movie" content

  • Streaming Movie Pass - non-expiring pass to stream a private screening of the movie at a future date; streaming release date to be decided

$20 - POSTER GIFT EXCLUSIVE

  • Special Edition Teaser Poster  - 27" x 39" theatrical-size one sheet teaser poster, created exclusively for this offer and signed by the film's star Matthew Mesler and Writer-Director Gerald Hartke; offered in a choice of ten (10) languages; poster packaged in a protective cardboard tube for shipping; cost of shipping will be added to contribution; available ONLY until December 30th!

$30 - DIGITAL GIFT BUNDLE

  • ONLINE GIFT PASS - includes all of the items listed in ONLINE GIFT PASS; plus
  • ​Printable 8 x 10 Image Gallery - twenty-four (24) full-color, print-quality scene, character and graphic art images; available for download at 300 p.p.i.

  • First Ten Pages Of The Script - opening pages of the actual screenplay for "NICHOLAS OF MYRA"; in downloadable .pdf format

  • Children's eBook Story Prelude - free download of "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS" children's picture e-book, a prelude to the story in the film; written by "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" screenwriter Gerald Hartke 

  • Children's MP3 Album Prelude - "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS" companion album featuring downloadable MP3 orchestral music tracks; includes three tracks from the upcoming "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" soundtrack; created by film composer Seth Stachowski and orchestrated by Phillip Klein

$60 - POSTER GIFT BUNDLE

  • DIGITAL GIFT BUNDLE - includes all of the items listed above; plus
  • ​Special Edition Teaser Poster  - two (2) 27" x 39" theatrical-size one sheet teaser posters, created exclusively for this offer and signed by the film's star Matthew Mesler and Writer-Director Gerald Hartke; both prints offered in a choice of ten (10) languages; posters packaged in a protective cardboard tube for shipping; cost of shipping will be added to contribution; available ONLY until December 30th!

$120 - ULTIMATE GIFT BUNDLE

  • POSTER GIFT BUNDLE - includes all of the items listed above; plus
  • $60 (USD) Gift Certificate - non-expiring NOM Entertainment gift certificate that can be used towards retail priced media and merchandise, including the available children's softcover picture book and companion CD album for "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS"; also includes any future releases like the Blu-ray/DVD and CD soundtrack for the film "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS"

Watch the Teaser-Trailer

Movie Sweepstakes Details

Claim any perk to receive the items listed in the accompanying gift package and your name will AUTOMATICALLY BE ENTERED into the "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" MOVIE SWEEPSTAKES for an exciting chance to WIN 1 OF 11 PRIZES. No purchase or claim is required to enter. The sweepstakes will end December 16, 2018. Winners will be posted in the Indiegogo updates and notified through email by NOM Entertainment Group no later than January 15, 2019.

GRAND PRIZE

  • Invitation To The Movie Premiere - Travel & Accommodations Included

  • Authentic Prop From The Movie - In Display Case

  • Limited Edition Movie Poster 1 of 1 - One Of A Kind

1st PRIZE

  • $400 (USD) Amazon Gift Card

  •  Limited Edition Movie Poster #1 of 10 

2nd PRIZE

  • $200 Amazon Gift Card

  • Limited Edition Movie Poster #2 of 10

3rd PRIZE

  • $100 (USD) Amazon Gift Card

  • Limited Edition Movie Poster #3 of 10

4th PRIZE

  • $50 (USD) Amazon Gift Card

  • Limited Edition Movie Poster #4 of 10

5th PRIZE

  • $30 (USD) Amazon Gift Card

  • Limited Edition Movie Poster #5 of 10

​6th PRIZE

  • $20 Amazon Gift Card

  • Limited Edition Movie Poster #6 of 10

​7th - 10th PRIZES

  • Limited Edition Movie Posters #7, #8, #9 & #10 of 10

​

Actor Michael Dentico as Young Nicholas

Project Summary

It is in troubled times that it becomes most important for art to reflect the goodness in the world. With the lack of inspiring family entertainment that Hollywood and independent cinema offer today, there is no better time to tell the story of Nicholas of Myra -- one that does not undo the cherished myth, but reinforces the hope and kindness it kindled within many of us as children. The story leaves no doubt that ole' St. Nick is for real and that he is a sacred part of holiday tradition. He is for people of all ages and not just those who celebrate Christmas. The origins of many age-old traditions are woven together like never before in this dramatic and layered tale that, until now, has been supplanted by folklore for nearly two hundred years.

Young Nicholas and his friend Theo try to stay hidden during a game of hide and seek

In December of 2001, "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" Writer and Director Gerald Hartke, was first inspired to begin writing an historical dramatization that would become the basis for an epic film. After years of research and writing had passed and the final treatment of the story was complete, Gerald became enamored with the idea of a period motion-picture about the untold origin of the age-old legend of Saint Nicholas of Myra. Although he believed the audience for the story already existed, it was a movie that Hollywood clearly had no interest in making. Having developed the project for several more years, Hartke decided to take ambitious and innovative steps to bring the story to the screen for audiences to enjoy. It was then that the idea caught the attention of a group of private, non-industry investors and the film was green-lit as an independent production.

Young Nicholas' father comforts him after a dramatic revelation

In partnership with several individual supporters, Gerald began raising capital and established an independent movie studio to house the production. His aim was to create a film that would pay homage to the classic Christmas movies he grew up on, while providing the audience a new potential classic to enjoy year after year. After assembling a talented team of actors and filmmakers, as well as the cinema production technology a project of this scope required, he has since worked with more than one hundred performers, dozens of crew members and many period sets and locations. Hartke and his creative team also constructed a full-sized replica of a Greco-Roman sailing ship that was required for some major sequences in the film. With extensive sets, costumes, props and models that span two separate historical periods, the sizable production remains headquartered at a studio-soundstage in a suburb of Buffalo, New York. Fueled entirely by private contributions, the goal now is to complete what may be considered the most ambitious independent film production ever attempted.

Sailing ships depart a Mediterranean harbor

Potential Impact Around The World

The production team at NOM Entertainment Group has devoted years of craft to bringing this story to life. Their effort and the historic significance of a film about Saint Nicholas heading to the screen for the first time has created a high level of anticipation, nationally as well as internationally. Early word about the "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" production began spreading some time ago and the movie has since garnered internet and social media attention in very diverse parts of the world. Along with the U.S., Canada and Latin America, several European, Middle Eastern and Asian nations also have established fan bases for the film.

A 4th Century Byzantine palace in Asia Minor

With the growing attention and support from around the globe, the international news media has made effort to cover the project with featured news articles in the U.S., Italy and Brazil. Due to the anticipation, a charitable London premiere with members of England's Royal Family has been discussed by Dr. James Rosenthal, Founder and President of the St. Nicholas Society UK/USA. By telling the life story of the patron saint of children, the movie has the potential to be seen as more than mere entertainment. Already the foundation for "St. Nick's Holiday Mission" (www.stnicksmission.com) that launched in December of 2017, "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS" could become a platform for many more children's charities worldwide in the years to come.

A sailing crew is swept from the deck of their ship during a raging sea storm

Risks & Challenges

It's been a long road that has taken years to travel and there are no guarantees "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS" will be the success that producers believe it can be. However, it certainly could if supporters help spread the word. For the creative team behind the film, it continues to be a rewarding journey and they're grateful for the chance to see it completed and released. To learn more about the artists, musicians and craftspeople behind the epic production, visit the Official Movie Website at www.nicholasofmyra-movie.com.

Nicholas takes shelter in a cave during a pilgrimage to the Holy Land

"I’ve traveled the world in search of Saint Nicholas. After reading the screenplay, I feel as though my journey is complete. The world needs to know the story. This new movie will bring the story of Saint Nicholas, with his selfless generosity, to the general public -- a public that has largely forgotten or never knew his inspiring saga. Nicholas of Myra is for every time, all ages, and those of every creed. It will leave no doubt that Santa Claus is for real, and that he can be as much a part of sacred holiday tradition as secular. I believe this is going to be a worldwide success."  - Dr. James M. Rosenthal (The St. Nicholas Society UK/USA)

A caravan makes its way through a desert canyon on its way to Jerusalem

"We are excited about this important film. The Latino community in the US, Mexico and South America will embrace this story as it finally comes to life…Largo San Nicolás live! Long live St. Nicholas!"  - Monica Pucciarelli (PUNTO Video Magazine)

As the new Bishop of Myra, Nicholas considers taking action in a troubling situation

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember that any support will help with finishing costs for the film. NOM Entertainment Group and Writer-Director Gerald Hartke appreciate your interest and thank you in advance for your support. Feel free to share the following links and help spread the word:

https://www.facebook.com/NicholasOfMyraMovie

https://www.youtube.com/NicholasOfMyraOnline

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4469522
story_txt:
Movie Synopsis
In New York, December 1822, Dr. Clement Moore, a professor of world literature, is inspired to pen a holiday poem for his young children. Influenced by the folklore of Old World culture, Moore crafts his whimsical piece into a magical tale about a kind and generous gift-bearer that secretly visits homes on Christmas Eve, delivering joy to children around the world.
It is while musing about this seemingly mythical character that Moore first learns of the ancient story of a gift-giver from the Greco-Roman Era; one that he comes to believe may be the origin of similar fables throughout the world. What he finds is a tale that ironically would be lost to the lore he was about to immortalize. He soon uncovers the surprising story of a mighty empire at a crossroads in history and of an orphan boy from Asia Minor, whose own journey to find his destiny would one day lead him to the city of Myra.
Moore had discovered the lost legend of Nicholas, a selfless child that became an heroic man of faith, a devout bishop by day and a secret gift-giver by night; a man whom in the face of terrible greed and persecution would prove that not every hero swings a sword. It was the story of Christmas origins, the story of selflessness and sacrifice, yet ultimately it's about the power of storytelling and the hope it can bring. It is the now forgotten tale of the beloved saint named Nicholas...Nicholas of Myra.

Actor Matthew Mesler in "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS"
How You Can Become A Supporter Of The Film

In staying true to the independent spirit of the film, the Indiegogo platform was the clear choice to launch a crowdfunding campaign. With support of backers like you, Gerald Hartke and the creative team behind "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS" subsequently aim to finish the film and screen it for several interested distributors. If you believe in the uplifting message of the movie and the value of family entertainment, as well as the positive example the producers are striving to set for independent filmmaking, please consider backing the effort with your financial support.
Anyone that backs the film for $10 OR MORE, will also have their name placed in the closing credits of the actual film! Below are a list of the perks you can claim and the items that are included in each:
$10 - SAMPLE GIFT PACK

Printable 8 x 10 Images - three (3) full-color, print-quality scene and character images from "NICHOLAS OF MYRA"; available for download at 300 p.p.i.
Printable Graphic Art - three (3) full-color, print-quality graphic art images created for "NICHOLAS OF MYRA"; available for download at 300 p.p.i.
MP3's From Movie Soundtrack - three (3) MP3 orchestral music tracks from the upcoming "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" movie soundtrack and "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS" companion album; created by film composer Seth Stachowski and orchestrated by Phillip Klein

$15 - ONLINE GIFT PASS

​Password To Exclusive Content - view password-protected media for Indiegogo backers; including exclusive videos, photos and information
Behind The Scenes Web Access - access behind-the-scenes news and updates; including additional "Making of The Movie" content
Streaming Movie Pass - non-expiring pass to stream a private screening of the movie at a future date; streaming release date to be decided

$20 - POSTER GIFT EXCLUSIVE
Special Edition Teaser Poster  - 27" x 39" theatrical-size one sheet teaser poster, created exclusively for this offer and signed by the film's star Matthew Mesler and Writer-Director Gerald Hartke; offered in a choice of ten (10) languages; poster packaged in a protective cardboard tube for shipping; cost of shipping will be added to contribution; available ONLY until December 30th!
$30 - DIGITAL GIFT BUNDLE 

ONLINE GIFT PASS - includes all of the items listed in ONLINE GIFT PASS; plus

​Printable 8 x 10 Image Gallery - twenty-four (24) full-color, print-quality scene, character and graphic art images; available for download at 300 p.p.i.

First Ten Pages Of The Script - opening pages of the actual screenplay for "NICHOLAS OF MYRA"; in downloadable .pdf format
Children's eBook Story Prelude - free download of "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS" children's picture e-book, a prelude to the story in the film; written by "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" screenwriter Gerald Hartke 
Children's MP3 Album Prelude - "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS" companion album featuring downloadable MP3 orchestral music tracks; includes three tracks from the upcoming "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" soundtrack; created by film composer Seth Stachowski and orchestrated by Phillip Klein

$60 - POSTER GIFT BUNDLE

DIGITAL GIFT BUNDLE - includes all of the items listed above; plus

​Special Edition Teaser Poster  - two (2) 27" x 39" theatrical-size one sheet teaser posters, created exclusively for this offer and signed by the film's star Matthew Mesler and Writer-Director Gerald Hartke; both prints offered in a choice of ten (10) languages; posters packaged in a protective cardboard tube for shipping; cost of shipping will be added to contribution; available ONLY until December 30th!
$120 - ULTIMATE GIFT BUNDLE

POSTER GIFT BUNDLE - includes all of the items listed above; plus


$60 (USD) Gift Certificate - non-expiring NOM Entertainment gift certificate that can be used towards retail priced media and merchandise, including the available children's softcover picture book and companion CD album for "THE ADVENTURES OF YOUNG NICHOLAS"; also includes any future releases like the Blu-ray/DVD and CD soundtrack for the film "NICHOLAS OF MYRA: THE STORY OF SAINT NICHOLAS"

Watch the Teaser-Trailer
Movie Sweepstakes Details
Claim any perk to receive the items listed in the accompanying gift package and your name will AUTOMATICALLY BE ENTERED into the "NICHOLAS OF MYRA" MOVIE SWEEPSTAKES for an exciting chance to WIN 1 OF 11 PRIZES. No purchase or claim is required to enter. The sweepstakes will end December 16, 2018. Winners will be posted in the Indiegogo updates and notified through email by NOM Entertainment Group no later than January 15, 2019.
GRAND PRIZE

Invitation To The Movie Premiere - Travel & Accommodations Included
Authentic Prop From The Movie - In Display Case
Limited Edition Movie Poster 1 of 1 - One Of A Kind

1st PRIZE

$400 (USD) Amazon Gift Card
 Limited Edition Movie Poster #1 of 10 

2nd PRIZE

$200 Amazon Gift Card
Limited Edition Movie Poster #2 of 10

3rd PRIZE

$100 (USD) Amazon Gift Card
Limited Edition Movie Poster #3 of 10

Limited Edition Movie Poster #4 of 10

$30 (USD) Amazon Gift Card
Limited Edition Movie Poster #5 of 10

​6th PRIZE

$20 Amazon Gift Card
Limited Edition Movie Poster #6 of 10

​7th - 10th PRIZES
Limited Edition Movie Posters #7, #8, #9 & #10 of 10


​
Actor Michael Dentico as Young Nicholas
Project Summary
It is in troubled times that it becomes most important for art to reflect the goodness in the world. With the lack of inspiring family entertainment that Hollywood and independent cinema offer today, there is no better time to tell the story of Nicholas of Myra -- one that does not undo the cherished myth, but reinforces the hope and kindness it kindled within many of us as children. story:
Hi!

Spade here (yea, I changed my name :), I've been planning on making this film for over two years. It marries my passion for social issues and real stories with cinematic language and diverse voices. This film represents everything I am as an artist. 

Production is September 7th, 8th & 9th! I know... it's right around the corner. 

 

Need To Know

  • We're raising $7,535 to tell the very best version of this story possible. This budget covers three days of production, meals, crew and equipment.
  • Our project is woman of color lead: starring, directing & producing , with an incredibly diverse cast. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we're still shooting it. Every bit helps!
  • Production is scheduled for September 7th, 8th & 9th. It's happening!!!
  • We're shooting in Los Angeles, California- where the original crimes took place. 
  • Our crew is made up of incredibly talented, experienced and passionate filmmakers

 

 

Than you for supporting this important project!

Spade

story:
Fortunately enough, we've already shot and edited the film but now we need your help to complete it!

 

ABOUT ME: I'm an independent Brampton based filmmaker and graduate from both York University and Sheridan College's film programs, although the majority of my career has been spent working in television and graphic design. Having a love of cinema that's been building for years, I felt the need to take the next step and start writing and directing stories that are personal to me.     

SYNOPSIS: Following the civil war and the intense bombing campaign in the eastern region of Ghouta, Syria, Sana (37) and her only son, Anouar (20) attempt to repair what remains of their damaged relationship in what may be her last phone call and conversation with her son. He’s trapped in a basement shelter fearing for his life in the bombed out region, and she’s on the other side of the world in Toronto, Canada.

RUNTIME: 11 min

DIRECTOR/WRITER/EDITOR/DP: Samuel Dayomi

CAST: Christina Tannous (SAVING HOPE & DESIGNATED SURVIVOR), Ehren Kassam (DEGRASSI: NEXT CLASS & THE STRAIN)

 

Uncorrected super 16 film stills.

VISION: After following the ongoing Syrian civil war, the refugee crisis it brought, and its drastic turning point in the Ghouta region, I felt the need to do more than just donate money to organizations attempting to help those whose lives had been thrown into chaos. Since films and art, in general, have a way of personalizing and providing an empathetic introspective, maybe more so than any dispassionate news broadcast, I felt that this would be my way of contributing to the greater good.  

Little to say, this is a bit of a passion project for me that was shot with a tiny production crew of 2 people (myself being the other) along with my 2 talented ACTRA cast members and the generous support of the CMPA (Canadian Media Producers Association) and LIFT (Liasion of Independent Filmmakers of Toronto). A lot of work has gone into making the most out of this emotionally ambitious "bottle film," centering the majority of it on creating compelling and believable performances to help ground it in the real world.  

 

Uncorrected super 16 film stills.

What We Need 

I want to make this film the best it can possibly be. I've put every dollar I have, and then some I don't have into this project, paid entirely out of pocket. But costs tend to run high when you're shooting on film and are still relatively new to filmmaking. 

Please help us give that extra level of quality the film needs to truly stand out. We're nearly there. We just need 4K! 

YOUR MONEY WILL COVER:

  • A professional supervised colour grade
  • Foley, supervised sound editing and mixing to stereo & 5.1 surround sound
  • Festival entries
  • Conforming a 1080 DCP master

 

Uncorrected super 16 film stills.

Why On Super 16 Film?

Well, I'm glad you asked. It's because I love to put myself through pain and also because Christopher Nolan said so... All terrible joking aside, super 16 like it's larger and smaller gauges provide a unique look and feel that make it stand out from digital formats. It's all about how it renders colours and the grit it provides in an image as can be seen above.

It's certainly not the first time I've shot on film, having done so in at least two other projects. I can say it's become an important and somewhat inseparable part of how I work. 

All In All

If you have any questions about the film, fundraising, or anything at all, please don't hesitate to let me know.

On behalf of the whole cast and crew, thank you so so much for your interest in the film, your support, large and small, moral and monetary, and for believing, like we do, in this project.

story:
WHO WE ARE

Sugarbabies is a short comedy Written and Directed by Michelle Vuaillat. She has previously worked on short films Backstabbers (2017) (Written by Michelle Vuaillat) and Memories (2017) (Editing and Sound by Michelle Vuaillat). Backstabbers (2017) and Memories (2017) have entered multiple festivals including the Deep Cut Film Festival 2018 (Ontario, Canada), CinefestOz Film Festival 2018 (Busselton, Australia), Revelation Film Festival Next Gen Webfest 2018 (Perth, Australia) and UniGoonies Film Festival (Perth, Australia) with Backstabbers (2017) receiving multiple awards including an Emerging Filmmaker Award (Next Gen Webfest 2018), Debut Award (Deep Cut Film Festival 2018) and Best Production Design Award (Next Gen Webfest 2018) as well as being nominated for Best Editing (Next Gen Webfest 2018) and Best Cinematography (Next Gen Webfest 2018).

The crew at Sugarbabies can't wait to work on a new concoction that they have no doubts will surpass the achievements of their debuts!

THE STORY

The idea of finding a sugar daddy to solve all money struggles is a very topical issue among young women, so it seemed like the perfect time to write a short comedy about it. Sugarbabies brings to life a story that many women in their 20s are already telling each other.

Wrapped in an aesthetic package of pastel blue, pink and yellow hues reminiscent of Wes Anderson and unveiled through comic-book, over-exaggerated style cinematography full of visual gags and fast edits, Sugarbabies will be a fast-paced, energetic display of comedic chaos.

Underneath the comedy, Sugarbabies sheds light on the anxieties of many millennials such as growing debt and ever rising housing prices and the fact that the ‘sugar baby’ business is a sobering reality for some young women.

THE CAST AND THE CHARACTERS

MEET GIGI

Gigi is a loud and charismatic millennial with a deep love for all things extra. Stubborn, wild and ambitious Gigi is a true fan of the sugar baby aesthetic and all things luxury. Like a magpie she likes bright and shiny things and will attack obnoxious boys on bicycles.

Gigi will be portrayed by Olivia Nardini who has already appeared in multiple projects such as the Matchbox/ABC TV series The Heights and short films His Father's Son (2016) and Backstabbers (2018)

MEET CARLA

Carla is a kind, empathetic, people pleaser who never quite left childhood behind, loving all things Disney. She is an introverted creative thinker who is quieter than her best friend Gigi. Carla second guesses a lot and had a tendency to sometimes be naive but she is always loyal and supportive of her friends.

Carla will be portrayed by Natasha Davison who has appeared in short films Busting out the Bells (2018), Gypsy Blood (2014) and All in the Hood (2015).

MEET JANET

Janet is Gigi's mum. She is a conservative Christian woman who would have a mid-life crisis if she found out her daughter called up a sugar daddy. She heavily endorses a healthy lifestyle, with her favourite hobbies being yoga and staying active.

Janet will be portrayed by new-comer Helen Hockley.

MEET THE SUGAR DADDY

Here for a good time the sugar daddy is a mysterious character that inadvertently sets the girl's lives into temporary disarray, however, perhaps he is not what he seems…

The Sugar Daddy will be portrayed by Paul Walenkamp who has previously appeared in Sandman (2018), A Glimmer of Hope (2018) and Be Careful What You Wish For (2018) among a multitude of other projects.

MEET THE CREW

MICHELLE VUAILLAT

WRITER/DIRECTOR

Graduated from Screen Arts at Curtin University in 2017, Michelle specialised in directing and editing and also finessed the art of pretending to enjoy coffee to gain social acceptance among her film school peers.  Michelle's many achievements include a stint in Canada where she got a taste of the Canadian indie film industry, writing award winning film Backstabbers (2018), editing and sound designing Memories (2018) and directing, producing and editing short documentary Blazers (2017) which has traveled to multiple film festivals including Cinefest Oz 2018 and Melbourne Women in Film Festival 2019. The film involved slumming it for 5 intense days in the Australian outback. Michelle is currently an editor at Red Empire Media whilst also offering her services as a freelancer and isn't ashamed to let everyone know she is the proud owner of a full set of Gryffindor robes (including the wand!).

 

ASHLEIGH DEGROOT

1st ASSISTANT DIRECT/SCRIPT SUPERVISOR

Having worked with Michelle on other successful projects Ashleigh is very excited to be working with this amazing crew again! In the past 4 years Ashleigh has worked on quite a few projects including a Documentary/reality TV show, a feature film, numerous marketing campaigns, broadcast/live TV and other short films. If you ask her nicely she might perform Kevin Gnapoor's rap from Mean Girls, she knows it off by heart.

STEPHANIE COLE

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Stephanie holds a BA degree in Screen Production from Curtin University and has experience in camera work, producing, and creating digital content. Her recent short films include Under the Red Light (2018) and Memories (2018). Additionally, she produces corporate videos, podcasts and social media content. Stephanie is presently a content creator at Visible, lending her skills to multiple podcast projects. She loves podcasts, including her own recently launched podcast Modern Adults (check it out!)

ALEXANDER SMITH

ASSISTANT CAMERA AND COLORIST

Yet another Curtin University Graduate, Alexander has worked in the film and screen media industry for the past 4 years. Working daily across a variety of roles such as Camera Operator/DOP, Editor, Motion Graphics and Animator and Graphic designer. His experience also leads him to broadcast camera work for which he has worked on national and international sporting such as World Rugby, AFL and A-League. He aspires towards working on more creative projects such as short and feature films, and music videos. As a teenager Alex had his head in the game playing with the championship team of the WA Basketball League, till he was forced to quit because a real life Troy Bolton was too much for this world to handle.

JOSHUA AMES

PRODUCTION DESIGNER

Josh is the intrepid Production Designer of the crew, having worked on several successful short film projects before such as Memories (2017) and Backstabbers (2017). When not furiously emailing his producers about locations for shooting or arguing with DP’s about how to correctly light his sets/costumes, Josh works mostly as a freelance videographer and blogger, having recently shot and edited footage for the 2018 Worthy Parts Mining Expo in Kalgoorlie. Josh has big plans for Sugarbabies design-wise and has stated he plans to make the short film “the most irresponsibly colourful thing ever committed to screen” as well as make Gigi’s room in particular look like “the inside of a pink birthday cake”. Full of mysterious quirks, the boy comes from a country that no longer exists and is somehow missing a fingerprint (?)

FRANCES THOMAS

PRODUCTION DESIGNER

Frances is a recent screen arts graduate and intense shopaholic who believes production design is one of the most important elements of a film because when she watches films she just sees all the clothes, everyone does right? She started working on Sugarbabies because she wants to create costumes that impact people the same way that Clueless inspired her. Frances has previously done production design on the short film Horses (2017) and works as a freelance photographer and videographer. A very petite German girl, you always hear her before you see her as she roles up in her green hatchback named Randy, blasting death metal music for all of Perth to hear.

CLAIRE POOLE

SOUND DESIGNER

Claire is a recent Graduate from Murdoch University in Sound, also having completed Post Graduate in Media Production. Since graduating at the end of 2017 Claire has worked on short films, music videos and documentaries. Claire is most looking forward to working on Sugarbabies with Michelle as she believes their creative vision for the film is remarkable and that the Sound Design for this film will be incredibly unique, tying in with the film’s idiosyncratic nature and edgy, stylistic approach. When not furiously working on her sound designs, Claire is rereading the entire Lord of the Rings series, at least once per year.

JEREMY MULLALLY

SOUND RECORDIST

Having worked with most of the Sugarbabies crew members on past projects Jeremy is tremendously excited to be working with the crew again, believing the crew dynamic to be unparalleled.
Jeremy studied film and television at Curtin University and is currently working in the field as a freelance videographer which has allowed him to gain an excellent technical understanding and experience of audio and sound as well as rich experience. Jeremy is one of the more amusing people to provide on set catering for as he's full of interesting quirks like the rule that he will not eat anything sweet without a glass of fresh milk.

KATHERINE CAREY

EDITOR

Katherine is a Canadian born editor raised in Perth. She graduated from Curtin University in 2018 with a Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Commerce where she developed a speciality in editing and continuity. Katherine has previously worked on a number of projects including short films, documentary, music videos and television pieces as well as a period of work experience with the editing team at Channel 9 News. Katherine collaborated with Michelle on the documentary Blazers (2017) as editor and cinematographer. Katherine is currently working as an editor on a number of short films including a promotional piece on a new unit within the Bachelor of Arts in collaboration with The University of Western Australia. Whilst juggling all her projects Katherine keeps healthy by making sure to eat a banana a day.

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

With the crew being so passionate about Sugarbabies we hope to create a film that you will enjoy but to do so we need your support for us to be able to create a high quality project.

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

With all of our cast and crew volunteering their time towards this project for free, all funds raised will be going towards production costs. These are expenses such as:

Costuming and Production Design: Josh’s dreams of creating the inside of a fluffy pink birthday cake won’t happen without your help!

Equipment Hire: Not gonna lie, a camera for Steph and Alex to play with would be nice…

Catering: Our producer is a bad cook a the best of times (too much video footage exists to prove this), without your support the crew will have to suffer even more than usual.

Location: Gigi needs a home!

Festivals: Please help Sugarbabies travel the world! We want to share the story with as many of you as possible.

PERKS

We have some delicious perks available including copies of Sugarbabies itself, merchandise, scripts and even invitations to the VIP screening event later this year!

THE IMPACT OF YOUR SUPPORT

For an emerging filmmaker, there is nothing more exhilarating than seeing the story you have dedicated day and night towards come together and light up the big screen and travel the globe.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Being independent filmmakers means you are always pushing your limits. With the cast and crew all willing to donate time, resources and funds to make this film happen, we hope to use our experience on past projects to break new ground with Sugarbabies.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you want to contribute but aren’t able, it would be just as amazing to share this campaign or our film social media pages with your friends and family!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!
story_txt:
WHO WE ARE
Sugarbabies is a short comedy Written and Directed by Michelle Vuaillat. She has previously worked on short films Backstabbers (2017) (Written by Michelle Vuaillat) and Memories (2017) (Editing and Sound by Michelle Vuaillat). Backstabbers (2017) and Memories (2017) have entered multiple festivals including the Deep Cut Film Festival 2018 (Ontario, Canada), CinefestOz Film Festival 2018 (Busselton, Australia), Revelation Film Festival Next Gen Webfest 2018 (Perth, Australia) and UniGoonies Film Festival (Perth, Australia) with Backstabbers (2017) receiving multiple awards including an Emerging Filmmaker Award (Next Gen Webfest 2018), Debut Award (Deep Cut Film Festival 2018) and Best Production Design Award (Next Gen Webfest 2018) as well as being nominated for Best Editing (Next Gen Webfest 2018) and Best Cinematography (Next Gen Webfest 2018).
The crew at Sugarbabies can't wait to work on a new concoction that they have no doubts will surpass the achievements of their debuts!

THE STORY
The idea of finding a sugar daddy to solve all money struggles is a very topical issue among young women, so it seemed like the perfect time to write a short comedy about it. Sugarbabies brings to life a story that many women in their 20s are already telling each other.
Wrapped in an aesthetic package of pastel blue, pink and yellow hues reminiscent of Wes Anderson and unveiled through comic-book, over-exaggerated style cinematography full of visual gags and fast edits, Sugarbabies will be a fast-paced, energetic display of comedic chaos.
Underneath the comedy, Sugarbabies sheds light on the anxieties of many millennials such as growing debt and ever rising housing prices and the fact that the ‘sugar baby’ business is a sobering reality for some young women.
THE CAST AND THE CHARACTERS

MEET GIGI
Gigi is a loud and charismatic millennial with a deep love for all things extra. Stubborn, wild and ambitious Gigi is a true fan of the sugar baby aesthetic and all things luxury. Like a magpie she likes bright and shiny things and will attack obnoxious boys on bicycles.
Gigi will be portrayed by Olivia Nardini who has already appeared in multiple projects such as the Matchbox/ABC TV series The Heights and short films His Father's Son (2016) and Backstabbers (2018)

MEET CARLA
Carla is a kind, empathetic, people pleaser who never quite left childhood behind, loving all things Disney. She is an introverted creative thinker who is quieter than her best friend Gigi. Carla second guesses a lot and had a tendency to sometimes be naive but she is always loyal and supportive of her friends.
Carla will be portrayed by Natasha Davison who has appeared in short films Busting out the Bells (2018), Gypsy Blood (2014) and All in the Hood (2015).

MEET JANET
Janet is Gigi's mum. She is a conservative Christian woman who would have a mid-life crisis if she found out her daughter called up a sugar daddy. She heavily endorses a healthy lifestyle, with her favourite hobbies being yoga and staying active.
Janet will be portrayed by new-comer Helen Hockley.

MEET THE SUGAR DADDY
Here for a good time the sugar daddy is a mysterious character that inadvertently sets the girl's lives into temporary disarray, however, perhaps he is not what he seems…
The Sugar Daddy will be portrayed by Paul Walenkamp who has previously appeared in Sandman (2018), A Glimmer of Hope (2018) and Be Careful What You Wish For (2018) among a multitude of other projects.
MEET THE CREW

MICHELLE VUAILLAT
WRITER/DIRECTOR
Graduated from Screen Arts at Curtin University in 2017, Michelle specialised in directing and editing and also finessed the art of pretending to enjoy coffee to gain social acceptance among her film school peers.  Michelle's many achievements include a stint in Canada where she got a taste of the Canadian indie film industry, writing award winning film Backstabbers (2018), editing and sound designing Memories (2018) and directing, producing and editing short documentary Blazers (2017) which has traveled to multiple film festivals including Cinefest Oz 2018 and Melbourne Women in Film Festival 2019. The film involved slumming it for 5 intense days in the Australian outback. Michelle is currently an editor at Red Empire Media whilst also offering her services as a freelancer and isn't ashamed to let everyone know she is the proud owner of a full set of Gryffindor robes (including the wand!).
 

ASHLEIGH DEGROOT
1st ASSISTANT DIRECT/SCRIPT SUPERVISOR
Having worked with Michelle on other successful projects Ashleigh is very excited to be working with this amazing crew again! In the past 4 years Ashleigh has worked on quite a few projects including a Documentary/reality TV show, a feature film, numerous marketing campaigns, broadcast/live TV and other short films. If you ask her nicely she might perform Kevin Gnapoor's rap from Mean Girls, she knows it off by heart.

STEPHANIE COLE
DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Stephanie holds a BA degree in Screen Production from Curtin University and has experience in camera work, producing, and creating digital content. Her recent short films include Under the Red Light (2018) and Memories (2018). Additionally, she produces corporate videos, podcasts and social media content. Stephanie is presently a content creator at Visible, lending her skills to multiple podcast projects. She loves podcasts, including her own recently launched podcast Modern Adults (check it out!)

ALEXANDER SMITH
ASSISTANT CAMERA AND COLORIST
Yet another Curtin University Graduate, Alexander has worked in the film and screen media industry for the past 4 years. Working daily across a variety of roles such as Camera Operator/DOP, Editor, Motion Graphics and Animator and Graphic designer. His experience also leads him to broadcast camera work for which he has worked on national and international sporting such as World Rugby, AFL and A-League. He aspires towards working on more creative projects such as short and feature films, and music videos. story:
Short Summary

 

PhoenixWorksFilms, with Victor De Almeida at the helm have produced three short films as of 2019 and have two more in the pipeline, with 'The Chair' being one of them. Starting in 2016, the team and their projects have been accepted in festivals such as Independent Days Interntional Filmfest in Karlsruhe, the Short Film Show, Los Angeles Cinefest, Lisbon Rendezvous Film Festival, amongst others. 

In the past three years the team have worked with various talented cast and crew, Roberta Bononi, editor of their first short film, Cain, went onto work for Netflix, whilst Korsshan Sclauer, cinematographer on 'The Bear' and 'I'll Always Love Tuesdays' has worked on a number of mainstream music videos by artists such as Royksopp, Miles from Kinshasa and Bexey. 

This campaign and its success is vital for us if we are to continue to make powerful, thought provoking short films. Up until this point we have been entirely self-funded, and whilst we are passionate enough to continue to do this, ultimately, the help of those who enjoy seeing creatives succeed is appreciated and needed. 

At PhoenixWorksFilms, we do not choose or projects lightly, we attempt to hand pick special concepts which we think will leave a lasting impression. Your contribution will help us continue to be able to curate, high production value projects. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £1,200 which will go towards part of the budget, this will help us pay for the location and keep the cast and crew fed! Anything over the required budget will help us pay the cast and crew for their dedication which we think will be an added bonus for all their efforts.

Anything that is donated to the project will make a massive difference and will mean that we do not have to worry about cutting costs and simply focus on making the best film possible. 

As previously mentioned, this is to be our fourth project since 2016, that is 4 films in 3 years, we currently have two projects in the festival rounds and two of our films have been accepted into the same film festival, a feat which although not unique, is still rare.

Risks & Challenges

Making short films is very rarely a profitable enterprise to get involved in and as such any donations made will not result in the doners becoming the next Jerry Bruckheimer. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to contribute, but if you have followed our story from the start or seen us on social media or watched any of our projects, please feel free to share this link with your followers as one of them may decide to help us reach our goal. Spreading the word is just as important as a donation.

story:
Welcome to our crowdfunding campaign for: Here we will hope to explain our campaign in reasonable detail to ensure you all know what your hard earned money would be going towards. We will break down "Captive" as a concept first, then delve into the intricacies of where the money will be spent and then we'll follow that up with a quick introduction to some of the project's crew who are invested in bringing this small but ambitious short film project to life!

*cough* and discuss the risks and challenges that we may face *cough*

We hope that you join us on this journey and help us make something we are truly proud of.

Captive is a comedy-horror short film that follows the story of Dave, a man soon to be married who is captured and held prisoner by a suspected cannibal murderer - only to realise, after a bloody escape, that it was a stag do prank staged by his mates to prepare him for the weekend ahead! It's an ambitious piece that hopes to really use strong aesthetics and performances, along with the crucial support in the post-production stages, to draw audiences into a world of horror long enough to catch them out with the film's comedic punchline!

Our crowdfunding campaign is aiming to raise at least £1000 to bring Captive to life. Despite £1000 possibly seeming like a lot of money to create a short film, the unfortunate reality is that film props, costumes, equipment, travel expenses and catering can all mount up to hefty sums of money... never mind the cost for submitting the finished product into film festivals around the world!

Our team consists of young but experienced filmmakers who are always striving to hone their craft and develop themselves as creative storytellers. With Captive being a project where mise en scène is crucial, we can't afford to scrimp on props and costumes within the story. It is also crucial for us to be able to feed our hardworking cast and crew, along helping them afford transport to and from the set as they are working on this project with NO WAGE - simply because they're invested in the project.

If we fail to make our target, our film festival run and expenses will suffer - however, if we SURPASS our target then we have no excuse but to make a fantastic short film!

Any donation which you feel suitable for this project would be fantastic and truly appreciated! Please make sure to check out the selection of different perks and bundles available in exchange for your support. Thank you.

Can't afford to support our project financially? Share us on your social media accounts to help us spread the word - IndieGoGo offer some really handy share tools to help you share the project with your family and friends!

 

Thomas is an award-winning filmmaker, having received awards for his debut feature documentary Autism: A Curious Case of the Human Mind (2016) and smaller documentaries such as Sticks & Feathers (2018). Currently studying Film at Edge Hill University, Thomas is looking to continue creating films outside of his education - allowing him to develop a project where both he and his crew are not restricted by particular criteria, allowing them to flourish.

Captive feels like the perfect project to do so.

 

Nathan Little has worked amongst film crews for almost a decade now, crafting everything from corporate and music videos to short films and documentaries. He has good a experience within the comedy genre, an experience that will be vital whilst making Captive. Nathan was awarded a university scholarship as a reward for one of his previous filmmaking endeavours and he is now studying an MA in Documentary Production at Liverpool John Moores University.

 

Josh White is currently enrolled at Edge Hill University studying Film Studies and Film Production, alongside the director of Captive. He and Thomas worked together earlier this year on Guilty Innocence (2018) and whilst on set developed an efficient and successful working relationship and friendship.

 

Tom Forfar will be working on set as our sound recordist but will also be in charge of Captive's overall sound mix and score. Just coming off the back of a gap year in the film industry, he is set to enter his final year of a Music at the University of Leeds. Tom has worked on everything from shorts to features, comedy to thriller and everything in between. He is a horror fan and takes inspiration from plenty of different films within the genre such as The Witch, The Conjuring and the Saw franchise.

"Personally, horror is one of my favourite genres and this is the first horror I’ve really been able to be a part of so I’m looking forward to it... When I work on a piece, I mainly aim to capture the feeling of the scene and bring it to life. And this is one thing I loved about the plot for Captive. I feel that I could really help drive the story and push the feeling shift from the beginning to end. The script goes from one extreme to another and I feel like I could help embellish that and really make it stand out."  - Tom

 

James Lyall has experience in a plethora of roles on a film set, however, the majority of them include him being a camera operator/cinematographer. He's worked on various short films and documentaries, collecting valuable knowledge over multiple genres. He was recently the cinematographer on a thirty-minute thriller pilot entitled 'Discretion' - a project which is going into further production later this year.

"The script for Captive had me laughing out loud and itching to read on. The possibility of it is incredible and I can’t wait to be involved with what I expect to be an amazing production!"
- James

 

Every film production comes with its own risks such as people pulling out of the project last minute, bad weather affecting shooting days or even that our crowdfunding campaign fails to reach its original £1000 target. We are a creative team of experienced filmmakers that have faced similar risks and challenges on previous projects, and therefore are more prepared and equipped to deal with them might they arise. Any delays to the proposed October/November 2018 shooting period due to cast/crew leaving the project, or weather conditions interrupting travel arrangement will only postpone the shooting of

Captive to a later and more achievable date. In regards to our crowdfunding campaign - if our £1000 target is NOT reached, then travel expenses and film festivals will be the first to take a hit. The film being made is the priority, cast and crew who are less experienced and therefore more prepared to cover their own expenses may have to be hired and a film festival budget may have to be sought out through a follow-up crowdfunding campaign (although we'd just prefer to smash this one to be honest with you, haha).

Any questions or queries about the project please do not hesitate to get in contact via email at tomgriffithsfilms@gmail.com

He and Thomas worked together earlier this year on Guilty Innocence (2018) and whilst on set developed an efficient and successful working relationship and friendship.
 

Tom Forfar will be working on set as our sound recordist but will also be in charge of Captive's overall sound mix and score. Just coming off the back of a gap year in the film industry, he is set to enter his final year of a Music at the University of Leeds. Tom has worked on everything from shorts to features, comedy to thriller and everything in between. He is a horror fan and takes inspiration from plenty of different films within the genre such as The Witch, The Conjuring and the Saw franchise.
"Personally, horror is one of my favourite genres and this is the first horror I’ve really been able to be a part of so I’m looking forward to it... When I work on a piece, I mainly aim to capture the feeling of the scene and bring it to life. And this is one thing I loved about the plot for Captive. I feel that I could really help drive the story and push the feeling shift from the beginning to end. The script goes from one extreme to another and I feel like I could help embellish that and really make it stand out."  - Tom 

James Lyall has experience in a plethora of roles on a film set, however, the majority of them include him being a camera operator/cinematographer. He's worked on various short films and documentaries, collecting valuable knowledge over multiple genres. He was recently the cinematographer on a thirty-minute thriller pilot entitled 'Discretion' - a project which is going into further production later this year.
"The script for Captive had me laughing out loud and itching to read on. The possibility of it is incredible and I can’t wait to be involved with what I expect to be an amazing production!"- James
 


Every film production comes with its own risks such as people pulling out of the project last minute, bad weather affecting shooting days or even that our crowdfunding campaign fails to reach its original £1000 target. We are a creative team of experienced filmmakers that have faced similar risks and challenges on previous projects, and therefore are more prepared and equipped to deal with them might they arise. Any delays to the proposed October/November 2018 shooting period due to cast/crew leaving the project, or weather conditions interrupting travel arrangement will only postpone the shooting of
Captive to a later and more achievable date. In regards to our crowdfunding campaign - if our £1000 target is NOT reached, then travel expenses and film festivals will be the first to take a hit. The film being made is the priority, cast and crew who are less experienced and therefore more prepared to cover their own expenses may have to be hired and a film festival budget may have to be sought out through a follow-up crowdfunding campaign (although we'd just prefer to smash this one to be honest with you, haha).
Any questions or queries about the project please do not hesitate to get in contact via email at tomgriffithsfilms@gmail.com

story:
The Story

A mother's day is abruptly changed when she receives a call from her daughter who's caught in a school shooting. 

This is not an action flick, but a 10-12 minute window to a parent's desperation to do something in a situation where there is so little they can do. 

The film will be shot in Dogme 95 style with long handheld shots as it is the emotions of the reality there's the sole focus. 

---

Why Ally?

I grew up in a country that have only ever experienced one school shooting and I hadn’t even been born then. I grew up in a country were pepper spray is illegal; guns are not even up for discussion. I have never once even considered myself in danger while being at school, not until last year when my feet touched American ground for the first time. I hadn’t been here for a week when I saw the news of a school shooting in Washington. Only a week later another found place in Illinois. Since then there has been another four school shootings just in California. Our teachers have been on a required course in what to do in case of a school shooting. It is terrifying. I want to show this feeling more than I want to tell the story, as I don’t find this to be my story to tell. I want to simply portray the fear and overwhelmingly, all-petrifying powerlessness that must take place in all the parents having received this call from their child. A call, that I now understand, is much more of a reality than I ever thought possible. During my casting I had people who broke down as they simply auditioned for the radio voice. This fear is present and real, and I want nothing more and nothing less than to simply portray that. 

---

Cast & Crew 

Ally by Allie Costa - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2812175/?ref_=nv_sr_1

Jennifer by Sarah Sypniewski - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm10003517/?ref_=fn_a...

Stacy by Heidi Kurzejka - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6239349/?ref_=nv_sr_1 

Radio by Paul Carpenter - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6208783/?ref_=fn_al... 

 

Director/Producer/Writer: Katrine Dolmer

1st Assistant Director: Theresa Eschbacher

Director of Photography: Sathish Shankutty

The rest of the Crew List can be provided upon request. 

 

Why Donate?

Films are expensive, especially when one is a student in Los Angeles. 

As a producer student I am highly addicted to making detailed budgets and schedules, and I'm happy to find that I can keep my budget under $2000! Unfortunately I can only find little of this amongst my non existing savings, and this is where I need your help.
I hope to find people who love film or love supporting creators, to be part of this journey. Also, I hope to find people who find this story as important to tell as I do, as this topic needs all the attention it can possibly get. 

Funding this film is more than just a donation, it's joining the team. No matter how much you donate, the support would mean a lot to me, and be a step, no matter how big, in the right direction for finalising Ally.

Your money will be going to all aspects of production, some of the most important listed below:

- Location and Permit

- Catering

- Props 

- Equipment (additional rentals to equipment provided by school)

- Paying our SAG/Union actors

- Insurance

Luckily since this is a student production in association with The New York Film Academy, certain expenses that would drastically increase the budget are covered, making it possible to keep the budget much lower than a lot of other short films.

If you have any concerns or questions, please reach out to me at marie.dolmer@nyfa.edu.

story:
Description of the Project

“Trapped” is a short dance film inspired by the hard moment we go through in life. The story is based on the psychological dead end we get stock in. It explore this feeling of hopelessness and helplessness, those moment when we loose track of our life path and that our own existence becomes meaningless to us. When darkness and loneliness take over and unable us to stand up in the morning. We get stuck in a small box that shakes us around and leave us with only the taste of claustrophobia and depression.

Film Storyline

Part 1 The Fall

A man is slowly sliding into his mental box, still sleeping, unaware of the situation. When he wakes up, he’s stroke by this feeling of despair and claustrophobia and fall slowly into the darkness of his depression. He doesn’t give up without a fight but the box is stronger than him and leaves him almost lifeless in a corner.

Part 2 The Partner

Fortunately, his partner can’t let the situation happen. So, in order to get him out of there, she has to get inside his new world. So she slides in and reaches for him. After many reassuring thought, she finally confront him to show him that his world is in fact much bigger than this tiny box he lives in. After the conversation, she gives him space to think. She knows that she can only open the door, but that he will have to take the decision to exit the room. So, she exit the box and will come back only to give him a last hand to get out.

About Me

Born in France and raised in Canada where I studied Dance at L’école de Ballet Contemporain de Montréal. I am currently Soloist with the National Theatre Brno in Czech Republic.

Since I am 12 years old, I have been attracted by photography which became a major part of my life in 2015 when I started to cooperate with my dance company and produce bodies of work for them.

Recently, I came up with this project, and thought that it would use many skills I developed along the way like dance, choreography and photographic composition as well as adding experiences in new fields such as cinematography and musical composing.

This project is a very exciting challenge for my creativity and I am enjoying all the steps of the journey so far!

Help me on my journey of artistic development and discovery.

My Team

Jaime Segura Montero

Born in Albacete, Spain, where I studied dance at Conservatorio Profesional de Danza José Antonio Ruiz. After that, I moved to Zaragoza to start my universitary studies and to finish my dance formation at Estudio de Danza María de Ávila. In 2016, I joined Narodni Divadlo Brno where I had the opportunity to discover and develop my dancing in so many ways. Now, It is time for a new adventure exploring our self's through dance with the help of a box and a camera.

Kristýna Kmentová​

My name is Kristýna Kmentová and I am dancer born in south Moravia, where I currently work and live. I studied Dance conservatory in Brno and after graduation I was hired as dancer in ballet company in National theatre Brno. It’s my third season now in this company and I’ve been asked by my colleague Arthur Abram to be part of his project. I enjoy being part of creative process of artists around me. I didn’t only feel touched by Arthur’s idea and vision of this specific project, but also by his photographic work. I am looking forward to new experiences, which are waiting for me in this cooperation.

Hana Minaříková alias Hana Foss

Hana is a human, native of the Czech Republic. She studied Multimedia Composition at Janáček Academy of Music and Performing Arts in Brno. Since her childhood, she wonders how the world works, she studies to play various kinds of flutes, singing, piano, music theory, languages, soldering, she reads, travels, meets extraordinary people, miraculous situations, etc. At the same time, she makes instrumental and electro-acoustic music pieces which come from her unlimited need to express and share the beauty of music and sound.

Her art pieces have been presented in the Cabinet Gallery (2016), JAMU Music Faculty building (permanent installation Janáček Quotes from 2012; interactive sculpture Nice to meet you, 2015) and other small spaces.

Currently, she works at the Theatre “U stolu” and Theatre “Na Orli” in Brno, as a audio engineer. Simultaneously, she works as a freelance composer and she is a member of Mirror Ensemble (live electronics, interactive projection, bass recorder).

Why a Fundraiser

The reason why I reach out to you is to help me cover the inevitable fees of the creation process.

The money you kindly donated will be used for:

  • The creation of the music
  • The rehearsing time and filming time of the dancers
  • Fabrication of the Box
  • Rental of the Filming equipment
  • Rental of the rehearsing space

This project is non-profit.I will not take any salary for the creation of this project. All the money will go exclusively to the 5 points mentioned above. I think that since it’s a personal project aimed at developing my creativity and sharing my voice as an artist, I shouldn’t include myself and instead use the entire budget to make sure I can produce the highest quality of work and take care of my collaborators.

Donor Advantages

As a donor, you will have access to the Blog I created specifically for this project. I will put Updates on the creation process as well as some behind the scenes of the work involving the dancers.

Thank You for your Support and come with me on this exciting journey!

Arthur

story:
Origins:

What started out as a local leadership project (Class L-30) that turned into an award winning documentary called “Homeless in Huntsville”, three of the creators (Brett Jones, Isaiah Williams & Jeremy Price) decided to move their experiences into creating a narrative piece that would further dive into the challenges of homelessness and specifically, a homeless veteran.

The Story:

After months of discussions and revisions with a trusted core group “Only Easy Day” evolved into a poignant & powerful story about a former Navy SEAL and his challenges of living with PTSD, addiction and the sequence of events and post war “battles” that end up defining him.  

The Production:

We are very excited about the film we have "in the can" and we would not have been able to achieve incredible production value on our micro budget had it not been for our special muse, wonderful donations of equipment, many locations, crew working below their rate, and the selfless help and donations we received from the Huntsville community and our previous Indiegogo campaign.  The common denominator:  “everyone involved is passionate about making sure this story is told”.

The Finish Line:

...we are not there yet!!  We are finished with principle photography but as with all films the post-production faze is extremely necessary.

This is where you come in:  to get us to the finish line we are raising more funds that will go to editing, sound design, sound mixing, color correction, distribution & marketing and possible additional photography.

If you haven’t already, please check out our trailer, and then pick a level for your “OED” swag.  Thank you in advance for contributing what you can and for being part of the journey to help us tell this story. 

Sincerely,

Dir/Prod - Tim Reischauer & the “Only Easy Day” Team

 

The Featured Cast & Crew "Only Easy Day"

To see the IMDB page of the following actors click on their picture.

 

Only Easy Day Team

DIRECTOR/PRODUCER:  Tim Reischauer is an award-winning director/producer and Assistant Director known for indie and studio projects including Slice of Pie, Impulsive, Desperate Housewives, It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia, Medium, 13 Going on 30, and many more.  

EXEC PRODUCER: Rob Wolfe is a producer, entertainment attorney, and law professor from Birmingham, AL. His military career includes service as an interrogation specialist in the U.S. Army in the 24th ID, 3rd ID, and 20th Special Forces Group (Airborne). 

C0-WRITER/EXEC. PRODUCER: Brett Jones is a published author, principal at Riley Security, and former Navy SEAL. He served with SEAL Team 8 and is a plank owner of SEAL Team 10. He also spent 13 years working for the Global Response Staff (GRS) in the CIA.

SR. EXEC. PRODUCER: J. SPENCER as a business executive & part time professional photographer, J naturally migrated to the film industry becoming Executive Producer on films & TV series such as “I Don’t Believe in Ghosts”, “Art of the Dead”, “Super Special”, “The Dawn”, “Bliss Maybe” and the new cult favorite “Party Bus to Hell”.  Being totally immersed in the process you may also see J in minor roles in his films, as well as some crew positions. 

CO-WRITER: Isaiah Williams is a writer, editor, videographer, musician, photographer, and founder of Sharpenedge media.  He is also a full time VibroAcoustics Engineer in Huntsville, Alabama.

POST PROD. SUPERVISOR/EDITOR: Tommy Hodge - as the founder/owner of Prototype Multimedia, Tommy has worked for nearly 2 decades all areas of post production including Broadcast TV, Music Videos, Animation, Graphic Design, CGI and Web Design.

COMPOSER: Jeremy Price - as a multi-instrumentalist Composer & Sound Designer, Jeremy has developed years of music production knowledge heading up studio sessions, live sound applications and has recently focused on composing for Film, TV and Commercials.  He has a BA from the UNA in Entertainment Industry Management with a concentration in Sound Engineering.   

ASSOCIATE PRODUCER/ADVISOR:  Kasey Brown along with his expertise in film production, Kasey was a DOD contractor with operational media experience for over 20 years.  as a crewmember and Helicopter Pilot with the US Army and flew Geospatial Survey aircraft as a contractor

CINEMATOGRAPHER: Tommy Wood - known as one of the busiest cinematographers in the region for over a decade, Tommy got his start in the industry doing drone shots for ESPN before he moved on to doing specialty shots on movies like “Woodlawn” and “Let There Be Light”.  

CASTING DIRECTOR: Ayoka Billions - after a successful decade in Los Angeles, Ayoka returned home to Huntsville to open a casting office that serves the southeast United States.  Some of her recent credits include U.S. Casting Director for “Zero” (Bollywood Feature with Shah Rukh Khan),  “On the Run” (with Swiss Army Man director Daniel Scheinert), and Emmy-award winning TV Show “Gulf Coast Detectives”.

 

The Perks:

Green Pea Press is a local business in Huntsville Alabama that will be fulfilling all the swag orders for this campaign. Pictures of the swag will be available in a few days.

Shirt Sizing Chart:
