story:
The Story of Attentive

Attentive presents a unique take on a woman's path to motherhood, representing the journey of pregnancy in an external form. The story focus' on Isla, who previously having struggled to have a successful pregnancy, battles with her own fears and insecurities surrounding her unconventional methods of conceiving.

In this story we want to highlight not only how powerful a mothers relationship with her unborn child can be, but to also show the transfer of love, life and energy between the two. Attentive also comments on modern relationships as Isla resists the help of her casual lover, wanting to raise her baby alone.

 

Budget

We have an amazing, generous crew on board who are giving their hard earned money to the project, but we still need your help! Here's a break down of what we'll be spending our money on:

Our total budget for this project is £4,450.

 

Your Perks

We want to thank you for helping our project by giving something back! We'd like to share some of the more personal aspects of our film with you such as one of a kind concept art, our expertly made props from the film, and behind the scenes photos!

And for our fellow filmmakers out there, we'd love to cater a perk just for you: to say thank you for showing us your support, we want to show you ours! We want you to send us anything from your work - a poster or a prop, for example - that can be used within our set; its nice to be nice! Look for the perk titled 'Lights, Camera, EGG-TION'.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge lies with our very talented ladies in the Production Design team. They have a lot to do in such a short amount of time, such as building the eggs in extreme detail, building a set and so on. This, and travel costs, are the biggest strain on our budget.

This where our campaign comes in! We're asking for your help in order to overcome these risks and challenges.

 

The Impact

Your love and support for our project will have a massive impact on the production value and what we can achieve! We desperately want to make the best of our final year at university, and are keen to create a film we're wholeheartedly proud of. This final project is what we venture out into the world with, and hopefully, will help with employment post graduation

For many of us, this will be our first festival submission. We hope we can translate how special and unique this film is onto the big screen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel as strongly as we do about this project, but can't help us financially, don't worry! You can help us in other ways by showing your support via our social media pages, and at our local events:

  • Like, comment and share our updates on Attentive
  • Share our Indiegogo campaign!
  • Follow us on Instagram @attentive_film
  • Follow us on Facebook @attentivefilm
story_txt:
The Story of Attentive

Attentive presents a unique take on a woman's path to motherhood, representing the journey of pregnancy in an external form. The story focus' on Isla, who previously having struggled to have a successful pregnancy, battles with her own fears and insecurities surrounding her unconventional methods of conceiving.
In this story we want to highlight not only how powerful a mothers relationship with her unborn child can be, but to also show the transfer of love, life and energy between the two. Attentive also comments on modern relationships as Isla resists the help of her casual lover, wanting to raise her baby alone.
 
Budget
We have an amazing, generous crew on board who are giving their hard earned money to the project, but we still need your help! Here's a break down of what we'll be spending our money on:

Our total budget for this project is £4,450.
 
Your Perks
We want to thank you for helping our project by giving something back! We'd like to share some of the more personal aspects of our film with you such as one of a kind concept art, our expertly made props from the film, and behind the scenes photos!
And for our fellow filmmakers out there, we'd love to cater a perk just for you: to say thank you for showing us your support, we want to show you ours! We want you to send us anything from your work - a poster or a prop, for example - that can be used within our set; its nice to be nice! Look for the perk titled 'Lights, Camera, EGG-TION'.
 
Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge lies with our very talented ladies in the Production Design team. They have a lot to do in such a short amount of time, such as building the eggs in extreme detail, building a set and so on. This, and travel costs, are the biggest strain on our budget.
This where our campaign comes in! We're asking for your help in order to overcome these risks and challenges.

 
The Impact
Your love and support for our project will have a massive impact on the production value and what we can achieve! We desperately want to make the best of our final year at university, and are keen to create a film we're wholeheartedly proud of. This final project is what we venture out into the world with, and hopefully, will help with employment post graduation
For many of us, this will be our first festival submission. We hope we can translate how special and unique this film is onto the big screen.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you feel as strongly as we do about this project, but can't help us financially, don't worry! You can help us in other ways by showing your support via our social media pages, and at our local events:

Like, comment and share our updates on Attentive
Share our Indiegogo campaign!
Follow us on Instagram @attentive_film
Follow us on Facebook @attentivefilm

story:
MINDFULNESS IS THE INSPIRATION

"We are living in a mindfulness revolution."

- TIME MAGAZINE -

" A truly life changing documentary, that will change the way you look at how you live your life. Prana Warriors shows you how you can turn your challenges in life, into fuel for your soul. I love how this tribe raises money prior to filming, invests in local communities on the ground in need and then continues to raise money through viewers investment in the mission, as the documentary airs around the world. Breathtaking, original, mindful and inspirational."

-TOM TUOHY -

Founder of Dreams For Kids

"I'm grabbing my passport, to go pay it forward and packing my yoga gear to go flow and meditate in the jungles of Mexico. This is an amazing wanderlust movement that is going to inspire so many people to make change in their life. I'm on a spiritual high! "

- GINA INCANDELA -

The Dailey Method

 

"I want to get on this journey and mindfully travel wherever the Prana Warriors tribe go! What an inspiring docuseries that digs deep into the spiritual pockets of Tulum, Mexico, highlights mindful experiences for your spirit, gives back to those in need and helps people find their purpose and happiness to make this world a better place for us all to live in.  There is nothing like this on television today! It's rich with purpose and it's time for this kind of inspiration in the  entertainment world."

 - JORDAN COBB -

Made Good

 

THE MINDFUL PRODUCERS

 

My name is Vanessa Palmer and I am the creator of Prana Warriors -  a mindful and philanthropic travel, documentary series that takes you on a journey of self-discovery, while raising awareness and support for underprivileged communities around the world . 

I have been passionate about traveling the world, immersing myself in new cultures, the mindful movement, and bridging the gap in philanthropy for as long as I can remember. Alongside my near 20 year career as an artistic entrepreneur and creative film producer, being a mom, mindfulness author and yoga and meditation teacher, I had a really deep calling to make an inspirational documentary series about finding your true spirit and happiness and creating a new way of giving back through experiential philanthropy globally.

Being immersed in finding creative ways to raise money and then actually going in on the ground and getting involved with the community you are helping, is nothing short of life changing. For me, telling a story through film is such a powerful medium and I truly listened to the pulling of my heart strings to create this and share this inspirational movement with the world in a very unique way.

My team and Executive Producers, James Langer and Taz Rashid, and the countless other amazing people that have been on this project, have been working extremely hard over the past 3 years to finance, film, edit and get this documentary, movement and inspiration out into the world.  We are so close to finishing it and it will be ready for release in March 2019!

Our world is at a crossroads. We need more inspirational film and people finding their purpose and light in this world to make global change.

 

 

PRANA WARRIORS

 TULUM, MEXICO

 SEASON ONE

DOCUMENTARY SERIES  |  6 EPISODES   

2 + HOURS OF  LOVE, MINDFULNESS, WANDERLUST & INSPIRATION

We really need your help and contribution to cover our production, editing and marketing costs of Prana Warriors, and to help get this out into the world so we can start inspiring and making change.

Season One is filmed and in its final stages of editing. We will be screening our first premier, February 21st, 2019. 

 

 Prana Warriors, Tulum, Mexico, will start airing globally in March 2019, on a soft launch. Further international and network distribution are in the works!

 

 

Your contribution and support gets you early access to the documentary on VIMEO (only) and some other amazing mindful perks and experiences -  it also helps us get the message of inspiration out in a very big way in early stages. Movements require a lot of passion and people on board to make change, that is why we need you!!!

 

PAY IT FORWARD

"If we can bring down global walls that divide us, embrace all cultures, inspire people to give back and become more involved in experiential philanthropy while becoming more mindful              - we have made a difference in this world. " 

- PRANA WARRIORS - 

 

In season one we travel to Tulum, Mexico, and on this journey of self-discovery, we crowdfunded over $5000 prior to filming with our cast and crew for Ciudad De Angeles Orphanage. As season one airs globally, with viewer support, we will continue raising more funds for a new center they are building.  Episode 4 is purely dedicated to our day at Ciudad De Angeles. There will be plenty of calls to action where people can go to Ciudad De Angeles and directly donate to help us pay it forward. We hope our documentary will continue to raise close to $100,000 more for their projects and expansion to change the lives of these kids in need.

 

                                                         

 

CIUDADDEANGELES.ORG

 

FIND YOUR WARRIOR SPIRIT

"We are all warriors, and we all have a story the has changed us."

- PRANA WARRIORS -

 

 

HELP US GET THIS MINDFUL MOVEMENT FLOWING

 Share this campaign on - Text, Email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, etc. with everyone you know using the hashtag.

 #PranaWarriors

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT WE GIVE BACK

 

Filming, producing and marketing a project of this scale, comes with a sizeable investment. We have invested over $150,000 thus far in filming season one and setting up our own production company and editing bay to make this season and many more future Prana Warriors around the world. We are looking to raise $30,000 at the minimum in this campaign to help cover some of those costs and the marketing going forward.

If we can crowdfund more, we are one big step closer to making season 2!

(Hint.. we are going to Nepal to build a school!)

 

THE EXPERIENCES & THE PERKS 

Just some of the perks we have for your support of this movement.

  • A Digital link copy of the documentary on VIMEO and other perks receiving a free copy to pay it forward to someone you know in need of inspiration in their life right now.

 

  • VIP tickets to our mindfulness film screening in Chicago, February 21st, 2019 and a special space at the private Cacao Ceremony beforehand.

 

  • Associate Producer Credit! Yes your name on all 6 episodes as a contributing supporter.

 

  • 60 Seconds On The Screen  - Be part of our movement with your story as an inspiring individual, or how your brand is making a difference in this world. A 60 second filmed spot at the end of one of our 6 episodes for season one. Check out the black screen sequence above FIND YOUR WARRIOR SPIRIT  that could be you! Do you want to share your inspiration or the message of your brand or life work? Then this is the space for you.

 

  • Prana Warriors Tulum Experience - A curated mindfulness retreat in Tulum, Mexico. September 18th, 2019 (3 nights/ 4 days). Experience being behind the scenes of filming in Season One. SUP Yoga, Mayan Cacao Ceremony, Zip Lining, The Shaman in The Jungle, Daily Meditation and Yoga. A Special Invitation to the TULUM Film Screening of Prana Warriors Mexico on the beaches of Tulum.     
  • ONLY 15 spaces available for this intimate, once in a lifetime experience.  Visit our website for more details on this experience. www.pranawarriors.com/retreat

 

THE GLOBAL IMPACT OF THE PRANA WARRIORS

MINDFUL MOVEMENT

 

 The positive impact this movement will have on the world is priceless.

Join our movement to help inspire and make global change.

Prana Warriors Mexico, Season One is just the beginning. We are already in planning stages of Season 2, to travel to Nepal, raising money to build a school in the region, and exploring the beauty, history and mindful experiences of the Buddhist and Nepalese people.

Future Seasons we are planning for - Africa, Australia, Bali, Peru and more.

 

WE ARE ALMOST THERE

Being an Indie film makers, raising capital and filming a documentary has its challenges -  but nothing we feel we could not do, because the passion and purpose deep inside to inspire others and make global change was our calling. We filmed it, we made it happen and we are almost complete with the first 2 + hour docu-series ready for release in March 2019!! 

With Indie film making, there is a lot of risk that requires a tremendous amount of passion to get your project over the line. With support of investors, brand partners and contributors like you we are making this happen! 

 

WE NEED YOUR WARRIOR SUPPORT

  • Please share this campaign on social media - FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, EMAIL BLAST, TEXT, SNAPCHAT, TWITTER, TELL A FRIEND! 
  • Mindful noise makes change! Help us shout this from the rooftops!
  • Use all the INDIGOGO share tools available!

Thank you for visiting our campaign.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out.

 

 

PRANAWARRIORS.COM

INSTAGRAM

FACEBOOK

TWITTER

story:
The Coffee Experience 

 My name is Grant Garry, and boy do I love coffee! If there was a way to get a government issued license that said I was married to coffee, I probably would! Coffee brings everything and everyone together. A coffee EXPERIENCE is the environment, energy, human interaction, and much more. It is so sensory oriented that it's what the cool kids would call 4-D! Have you ever stopped and thought to yourself "Heck, I am doing more than just drinking a cup of coffee." That is the central theme of "Room for Cream." I will be exploring the experience(s) you can have while drinking specialty coffee.

  • What goes into creating the coffee experience?
  • Can we create a better world if we are present and savor a moment? 
  • Did you know that we are basically experiencing coffee today the way people did in the early 1800's? 
  • What psychological aspects are behind behind it? 
  • What other themes are associated with drinking coffee?
  • Most importantly, why? WHY DO WE LOVE COFFEE SO FREAKING MUCH!?!?!?!

For the past three months, I have been doing research with Chuck Jones of Jones Coffee Roasters in Pasadena. I believe Chuck Jones knows exactly what is needed to create the perfect coffee experience. I have attended coffee cuppings (very fun), spent time in the roasting room, sat in on client meetings, and learned about the overall specialty coffee experience. I plan to explore this "experience" and showcase the vertical integration of Chuck's company. The Jones family has a coffee farm in Guatemala, which I believe makes for even more fascinating storytelling. 

How the funds will be used 

Funds raised will be used to send my camera crew to the family's coffee farm in Guatemala. The production relies heavily on your support as a way to create jobs, hire professional crew members, rent camera equipment, and complete the overall vision of the project. Together my crew and I plan to film at specialty coffee shops, interview roasters, shop owners, and psychology experts.  

Additional costs will include but are not limited to editing, sound mixing, color correction, and festival submissions.

My last film, Black Cat, was featured in over 60 film festivals worldwide, won 6 best feature awards, and is now streaming on iTunes. I am confident that I have the skills to create another successful film and tell an amazing story. 

Want to grab coffee with me? Want some quality beans of your own? Join us on set? Check out the perks! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, I welcome you to share via email, social media platforms, or word of mouth with lovers of coffee or lovers of life!!!

And that's it! Let's get some coffee! 

Best wishes,

Grant

story:
Fresh off a winning case that brought her unwanted internet fame, a rising ADA learns of the district's most respected judge allegedly assaulting her best friend. She starts a case but is surprised to be met with resistance by the district attorney who mentored her, her best friend who questions the system and her motives, and the judge himself who knows her own dark secret.
 

From the Director:
This story started with the intention of exploring the idea of what justice would look like if we only thought in terms of right and wrong - free from the influence of politics, clout, discrimination, etc. I found myself wanting to tell a story centered on a character with a strong IQ and EQ, which led to creating a young ADA bound by the logic of law to contrast against a professional superior she's compelled to prosecute for personal reasons. 

The dual vision of strong female characters and a rock-solid ensemble appealed to me from the very beginning. I also wanted to explore how different people involved in one case navigate through what their own definition of "right" is. 

Speaking on behalf of the creative team, it is our hope that this film will encourage those who have directly or indirectly been made to feel that their stories and their feelings are ignored. We believe any victim of any kind of abuse is worthy of justice, validation, and closure, and we salute them and the people fighting for them. 

 

With the clock ticking for major film festival submission deadlines, we need your help to bring this project to completion. We need to raise $10,000 to put WORTHY through post-production and submissions to specifically targeted film festivals. The funds raised will go directly to editing, sound mixing, coloring, original music, film festival submission entry fees, and Indiegogo campaign hosting fees. Here is our breakdown:

 

KALLY KHOURSHID as ADA Ruth Bryant

Kally was born in Chicago, Illinois and grew up in Boca Raton, Florida. She holds collegiate and professional training in multiple performing arts disciplines. Kally has been the lead in over 20 films, including Revoked (winner, “Best VR Doc/Empathetic Film” at Cinequest Film & VR Festival; showcase selection, Festival de Cannes’ Marche Du Film), The Operator (winner, “Best U.S. Short Film” at Catalina Film Festival), and more. Kally is a passionate advocate of the arts as means to bring important issues to light, challenge perspectives, encourage understanding, and reignite hope. 

 

TOM JENKINS as Judge Kevin Lestin

Born in Kentucky and raised in West Virginia, Tom's parents always said, "Son, you have nowhere to go but up!" After honing his acting in Florida, and an appearance on Nickelodeon's, Clarissa Explains It All, Tom made the big move to Los Angeles. He is now a veteran of over 50 commercials with national brands such as Allstate, Activia, Ford, Rite Aid, Toyota, Kay Jewelers, and Hallmark. Tom also has several network television appearances, including Criminal Minds and Days of our Lives, as well as numerous film shorts under his belt. Tom is always looking to lend his common-man affability to any role.

 

MATTHEW HANCOCK as DA Alvis Morris

Matthew Hancock is an L.A. transplant who hails from Columbus, Ohio. He enrolled at the New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts, then at Adelphi University, where he received his Bachelor of Fine Arts degree. In addition to film, his theatre work has earned him a Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award, a LA Stage Raw Award, and nominations for LA Stage Alliance Ovation, Broadway World Los Angeles, and NAACP Theatre Awards. His work in the short film Martyr recently earned Matthew a Best Actor nomination at the California Women’s Film Festival.

 

SANDY RATHER as Kansas Smith

Sandy Rather is an actress/singer from Houston, Texas and a graduate from Stella Adler’s Art of Acting Studio in Los Angeles. She received her BA in Theatre from Centenary College of Louisiana. During her time in LA, she has played some of her favorite roles, such as: Afak in Othello & Otis, Cordelia in Lear’s Daughters, Meg/Ketch in Our Country’s Good, Jaques in As You Like It, and Fabiana Aziza Cunningham in The Last Days of Judas Iscariot. She is grateful for the continuous love and support she receives from God, her family, friends, and mentors. She would like to thank Mike Vaughn and the amazing cast and crew of “Worthy” for the tremendous opportunity to tell such a hauntingly beautiful story.

 

MICHAEL V. HERNANDEZ writer/director

Michael is a Trinidadian-American writer and director from Miami, currently residing in Los Angeles. Growing up both in Miami and the Caribbean, Michael has been exposed to many richly diverse cultures and people from such vibrantly different walks of life. From Bollywood to Asian films to American movies and beyond, he is grateful to have experienced time and time again how cinema is a powerful and meaningful way to connect to the people and world around us. 

Michael earned his Bachelor’s of Science degree from Florida State University, after which he held positions as Creative Director of Marketing, Media Director, Graphic Designer, Editor, and Director of Photography, the culmination of which in 2012 materialized into his career path as a film director. He utilized his skills and years of experience to bring into full realization the production company CreativeDuet Media. Over the last six years he has continuously worked as a director for music videos, commercials, industrials, marketing campaigns, and narrative short films. Worthy is the first of four next-level projects his team is undertaking to not only solidify their presence in the narrative film world, but also to inspire and challenge audiences in the real world

 

BRIAN M. TANG cinematographer

Brian M Tang is a cinematographer and director based in Los Angeles. Originally from New Jersey, Brian has been a freelance cinematographer whose work has reached millions of views and collaborated with numerous companies and directors on narrative short films as well as music videos and feature length films. Brian’s latest feature is called “The Last Whistle” starting Brad Leland (Friday Night Lights) and Jim O’Heir (Parks and Recreation).

 

AHMED ARIFIN composer

Ahmed Arifin is an award-winning film composer. Born in Bangladesh into a musical family, Ahmed has been surrounded by music since his very conception. He started with tabla (a south-Asian percussion instrument) and continued on to learn guitar, piano, and drums. His music career began while he was still in college, scoring various of films while completing his Bachelor’s Degree in  Recording Arts at Full Sail University. Since moving to Los Angeles, Ahmed has composed for numerous renowned music houses working on studio films, trailers, and beyond.

 

We tremendously appreciate contributions of any size - even a dollar! Alongside contributing monetarily, the most valuable thing you can do to help us out is spread the word and share this campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues. You can directly share this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other platforms with the icons at the bottom of this page.

From the entire WORTHY team: We thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Fresh off a winning case that brought her unwanted internet fame, a rising ADA learns of the district's most respected judge allegedly assaulting her best friend. She starts a case but is surprised to be met with resistance by the district attorney who mentored her, her best friend who questions the system and her motives, and the judge himself who knows her own dark secret. 


From the Director:This story started with the intention of exploring the idea of what justice would look like if we only thought in terms of right and wrong - free from the influence of politics, clout, discrimination, etc. I found myself wanting to tell a story centered on a character with a strong IQ and EQ, which led to creating a young ADA bound by the logic of law to contrast against a professional superior she's compelled to prosecute for personal reasons. The dual vision of strong female characters and a rock-solid ensemble appealed to me from the very beginning. I also wanted to explore how different people involved in one case navigate through what their own definition of "right" is. Speaking on behalf of the creative team, it is our hope that this film will encourage those who have directly or indirectly been made to feel that their stories and their feelings are ignored. We believe any victim of any kind of abuse is worthy of justice, validation, and closure, and we salute them and the people fighting for them. 
 

With the clock ticking for major film festival submission deadlines, we need your help to bring this project to completion. We need to raise $10,000 to put WORTHY through post-production and submissions to specifically targeted film festivals. The funds raised will go directly to editing, sound mixing, coloring, original music, film festival submission entry fees, and Indiegogo campaign hosting fees. Here is our breakdown:

 


KALLY KHOURSHID as ADA Ruth Bryant
Kally was born in Chicago, Illinois and grew up in Boca Raton, Florida. She holds collegiate and professional training in multiple performing arts disciplines. Kally has been the lead in over 20 films, including Revoked (winner, “Best VR Doc/Empathetic Film” at Cinequest Film & VR Festival; showcase selection, Festival de Cannes’ Marche Du Film), The Operator (winner, “Best U.S. Short Film” at Catalina Film Festival), and more. Kally is a passionate advocate of the arts as means to bring important issues to light, challenge perspectives, encourage understanding, and reignite hope. 
 
TOM JENKINS as Judge Kevin Lestin
Born in Kentucky and raised in West Virginia, Tom's parents always said, "Son, you have nowhere to go but up!" After honing his acting in Florida, and an appearance on Nickelodeon's, Clarissa Explains It All, Tom made the big move to Los Angeles. He is now a veteran of over 50 commercials with national brands such as Allstate, Activia, Ford, Rite Aid, Toyota, Kay Jewelers, and Hallmark. Tom also has several network television appearances, including Criminal Minds and Days of our Lives, as well as numerous film shorts under his belt. Tom is always looking to lend his common-man affability to any role.
 
MATTHEW HANCOCK as DA Alvis Morris
Matthew Hancock is an L.A. transplant who hails from Columbus, Ohio. He enrolled at the New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts, then at Adelphi University, where he received his Bachelor of Fine Arts degree. In addition to film, his theatre work has earned him a Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award, a LA Stage Raw Award, and nominations for LA Stage Alliance Ovation, Broadway World Los Angeles, and NAACP Theatre Awards. His work in the short film Martyr recently earned Matthew a Best Actor nomination at the California Women’s Film Festival.
 
SANDY RATHER as Kansas Smith
Sandy Rather is an actress/singer from Houston, Texas and a graduate from Stella Adler’s Art of Acting Studio in Los Angeles. She received her BA in Theatre from Centenary College of Louisiana. During her time in LA, she has played some of her favorite roles, such as: Afak in Othello & Otis, Cordelia in Lear’s Daughters, Meg/Ketch in Our Country’s Good, Jaques in As You Like It, and Fabiana Aziza Cunningham in The Last Days of Judas Iscariot. She is grateful for the continuous love and support she receives from God, her family, friends, and mentors. She would like to thank Mike Vaughn and the amazing cast and crew of “Worthy” for the tremendous opportunity to tell such a hauntingly beautiful story.
 

MICHAEL V. HERNANDEZ writer/director
Michael is a Trinidadian-American writer and director from Miami, currently residing in Los Angeles. Growing up both in Miami and the Caribbean, Michael has been exposed to many richly diverse cultures and people from such vibrantly different walks of life. From Bollywood to Asian films to American movies and beyond, he is grateful to have experienced time and time again how cinema is a powerful and meaningful way to connect to the people and world around us. 
Michael earned his Bachelor’s of Science degree from Florida State University, after which he held positions as Creative Director of Marketing, Media Director, Graphic Designer, Editor, and Director of Photography, the culmination of which in 2012 materialized into his career path as a film director. He utilized his skills and years of experience to bring into full realization the production company CreativeDuet Media. Over the last six years he has continuously worked as a director for music videos, commercials, industrials, marketing campaigns, and narrative short films. Worthy is the first of four next-level projects his team is undertaking to not only solidify their presence in the narrative film world, but also to inspire and challenge audiences in the real world

Brian M Tang is a cinematographer and director based in Los Angeles. Originally from New Jersey, Brian has been a freelance cinematographer whose work has reached millions of views and collaborated with numerous companies and directors on narrative short films as well as music videos and feature length films. Brian’s latest feature is called “The Last Whistle” starting Brad Leland (Friday Night Lights) and Jim O’Heir (Parks and Recreation).

Ahmed Arifin is an award-winning film composer. Born in Bangladesh into a musical family, Ahmed has been surrounded by music since his very conception. He started with tabla (a south-Asian percussion instrument) and continued on to learn guitar, piano, and drums. His music career began while he was still in college, scoring various of films while completing his Bachelor’s Degree in  Recording Arts at Full Sail University. Since moving to Los Angeles, Ahmed has composed for numerous renowned music houses working on studio films, trailers, and beyond.

Alongside contributing monetarily, the most valuable thing you can do to help us out is spread the word and share this campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues. You can directly share this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other platforms with the icons at the bottom of this page.From the entire WORTHY team: We thank you for your support!

story:
WHY WE'RE MAKING IT:

We believe state politics are often overlooked and the easiest step in improving people's lives would be for everyone to be more involved and knowledgable about their state officials. By shining a light on this single election, hopefully viewers will be more motivated to become active in their community, and it may even inspire others to seek office themselves.

We know times are tough and most people don’t have any expendable income; that’s one of the reasons we’re making this film. Any pledge, no matter how small, would be immensely appreciated, as it would get us another step closer to making something we hope will be entertaining, inspiring, and impactful.

 

WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

We are raising money to cover some of the costs of making the film: travel, lodging, hard drives, expendables, feeding volunteers, and equipment. We are blessed to have a team of professionals willing to take time off from work and family life to make something special, and want to limit out-of-pocket expenses for those doing so. If we exceed our goal, we can make the film better with additional crew and equipment.

 

OUR TEAM:

Benedict Kasulis - Benedict has worked in documentary film and television for 13 years, mostly as an editor. His documentary feature credits include Tribeca Film Festival selections JUST LIKE US and 14 MINUTES FROM EARTH. Most recently, he’s worked Netflix’s QB1, Starz’s WARRIORS OF LIBERTY CITY and MURDER MOUNTAIN, coming soon to Netflix. When he was 18, he won a Nathan’s hot dog eating contest in Tallahassee, Florida and has been futilely trying to do something as great ever since.

Ryan Dismukes - Ryan has worked as a cinematographer all over the world, notably for the TLC smash series 90 DAY FIANCE, and its various spinoffs. He has filmed documentaries about third-world midwives, exotic pets, and sanitation workers. Everybody likes him, which is sort of annoying when comparing yourself to him, but very useful when he is filming documentaries.

Filipe Bessa - Filipe has worked as a cinematographer on films, documentaries, commercials and music videos. When he’s not shooting around the world for Facebook, he’s working on acclaimed sports documentaries like ESPN’s 30 FOR 30, QB1, and UFC’s EMBEDDED or popular documentary series like DOOMSDAY PREPPERS. He’s talented, Brazilian, and is raising a bilingual daughter with his wife. The total package.

Nora Chute - Nora is a gifted producer who has spent her career in documentaries, such as NOBODY SPEAK on Netflix, QB1, History’s LA ‘92 and Pivot’s TRUTH AND POWER. She’s also so nice that she politely hides how smart she is until necessary, and then it’s hilariously obvious.

Carson Aune - Carson’s a self-taught composer always experimenting with new techniques in music and sound. His scores have defined such works as QB1, HBO’s STATE OF PLAY, the hit documentary WAR DOG: A SOLDIER’S BEST FRIEND, and History’s THE WARFIGHTERS. He was also an actor when he was younger and was even in an episode of TRUE BLOOD, so us working with any other composer simply wouldn’t make sense.

 

Thank you for your time, and please share with anyone else you know who may be interested.

story:
Short Summary

We're Ella and Nick and we'd love for you to help us make our short!

In this near futuristic drama, we explore how technology has made it both easier and also more difficult for people to connect.

Jade is in that awkward on again/ off again relationship stage. Disappointed by the lack of closeness with her “ex-girlfriend,” she decides to sign up for FRNDLNK, an online friend service that allows people to interact with professional friends in a virtual reality. She is matched with a very highly rated FRNDLNK friend, Charlie.

Charlie takes Jade on a series of “ virtual excursions” where they begin to initiate a friendship. From exploring abandoned water parks to breaking and entering into lavish mansions to bonding over shared experiences as queer people, they do it all. With each experience, Jade feels a growing connection to Charlie.

But can a relationship be maintained solely through virtual interaction?

As two highly motivated and sensitive queer people, we hope that our common goal of bringing forth stories with complex and fully realized LGBTQ characters to the screen inspires you to want to help us make that happen.

The LGBTQ community is an underrepresented and marginalized class in many parts of the world so it's important that we start to see representation for queer characters that isn’t only defined by who they love so that we may better see them in all facets of life as equals. We all have a lot more in common than we like to think or care to know and that understanding can lead to helping us end divisiveness.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is roughly $5 k. We'll be investing our own money and are hoping to raise enough to meet our goal.

We'll be using all the money, whether we reach the goal or not, to pay for all of our equipment (including the camera and lights), the sound, the props, hair & make up, our actors, locations, post production and food!

There are some small and big perks as gifts for helping us out!

The Impact

We really feel this film will bring something meaningful to the world that audiences will resonate with on a personal level.

For the LGBTQ community, it is a rare occurrence that their lives on film aren't reduced to their sexual preferences. We have a responsibility to share the beauty of being a queer person and to use our voices to uplift those like us who often feel underrepresented in media.

After working on countless productions and creating our own work to great success in the past, we're confident that with your help we can create something truly magnificent!

The Team

Director/ Writer/ Actor - Ella Lentini

Ella (Until Dawn, 9-1-1, Disconnect) is a New York City native actress and filmmaker. She graduated from New York University's Gallatin school, where she concentrated in “Screenwriting as a Weapon” and acting. Ella worked with an Oscar- nominated director for three years before writing and co- starring in her award-winning directorial debut, Piece of Cake. Inspired by her eclectic childhood, mom who immigrated from Peru, and father from Sicily and identifying with the LGBTQ community, her goal is to make impactful female-driven stories that authentically portray marginalized communities.

Director/ Writer/ Actor - Nick Smoke

A native of The Bronx, New York, Nick is an actor and filmmaker who’s been most notably featured in The Social Network, People Like Us and This Is Us on NBC. He co-wrote the short film Queen, for which has garnered official selections at over twenty film festivals including Cinequest, Boston International, Edinburgh, and Humboldt International, where he won the award for Best Narrative. In 2013 he was diagnosed with a rare liver disease known as Budd-Chiari syndrome and was put on the wait list for a liver transplant. This profound and life changing experience inspired him to create more meaningful work and drives him to tell stories that bring an insight into the world of those who are vulnerable and often forgotten.

And we have more exciting announcements to come!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can donate, if you like the idea, and we hope that you do, please feel free to share it with friends! We'd really appreciate it!

story:
Sabüi Studios started as a very small organization. Technically speaking, one-person small. So I might as well talk in the first person...

Sabüi is named in dedication to a close friend, band leader, and teacher, Ousmane Camara, a Guinea-born Griot, master-balafonist, and Vermont resident since 2014. I started playing drums in Ousmane's band, Sabouyouma in 2016 (along with Assane Coly). My experience in Sabouyouma with Assane and Ousmane– and their experience in West-African Griot culture– inspired me to want to share their stories. "Sabüi" translates roughly to "Someone you're eternally grateful to" in the Guinea language Susu (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hBG5wlUYIn8). Sabüi has co-produced and released three studio singles for Sabouyouma in 2018 with a full-length album due in 2019 (https://open.spotify.com/artist/14h4VYxpbC6JDfU...).

My first official release was shot in Matanzas, Cuba with members of "Los Muñequitos de Matanzas". With 1 camera, 1 lens, and a zoom h4 plus a few mics, I tracked and produced "De Cuba Soy": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zSf6BaQejXQ

In 2017, I returned to Cuba and recorded "Para Que Un Dia Vuelvas" (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKLmxB6npfc), this time adding an additional camera to my rig and bringing on my good friend: Dubai-based drummer, and incredible audio engineer Ratish Chadha. While living in the U.S., Ratish toured with Toubab Krewe as their audio-engineer and was freelance musician in New Orleans (where we originally met).

In 2018 I made my second trip to Senegal, this time accompanied by Assane and Ratish. It was our most ambitious project, shooting with three cameras, and recording 5 bands and over 25 musicians total over two weeks.

This is a dream "job" for us– having the privilege to help share the stories of the torch-bearers of West-African percussion– the music which is the rhythmic-grandmother of all things blues, jazz, funk, R&B, soul, and "American Music" as we know it: but it's been a enormous investment of time and money.

As our toolbox gets bigger, and our vision and ambition expands, our bank account has gone in the opposite direction.

 

The Impact

This project has been 100% self-funded from the beginning– dipping deep in to savings to make a dream come true. The estimated costs of the initial video– (not counting an additional $15,000 in additional gear investments over a couple years)– in 2018 were:

2018 Costs:

  • Plane tickets for 3 people (myself, Ratish + Assane):  $4000.00
  • AirBnb:                                                                                          $500.00
  • Food for 3:                                                                                    $600.00
  • Payment to musicians:                                                            $1000.00
  • Estimated editing/post (150 hours * $20/hour):          $3000.00
  • TOTAL                                                                               $9000.00

Costs this year are lower as I'll be doing both the audio and video myself:

2019 costs:

  • Plane ticket for me:                                         $1500.00
  • AirBnb:                                                                 $200.00
  • Food:                                                                     $150.00
  • Additional investments in video gear:       $4000.00
  • Mixing/Editing/Mastering the album:      $4000.00
  • Payment to musicians                             As much as is humanly possible

 

Power to the people

I do not want to profit from this campaign. Just the opportunity to see this project through to completion is payment enough for me, and simply put– I'll most likely be able to find more web design and commercial video production work long after this project is finished, and have no problem at least partially-self funding. Long story short– I want as much of the proceeds from this campaign to go direct to the artists (and their families) who made it possible.

 

Goal #1:

Be able to logistically afford to finish this project. Part of "finishing" this project for now means that it ripples and echos well into the future. Being able to create a compelling audio experience from the video recordings, and turning that into an album (who's proceeds will go 100% direct to the artists) that could create passive future revenue for these artists is a very important part of that.

 

Goal #2:

Give the majority of the funds to the artists and pay them a generous rate by American standards. A dollar goes a long way in Senegal and the musicians we worked with (and their family's) do not live in luxury. With your help, I would like to ensure that they are able to very comfortably afford some simple luxuries in the coming year. 

 

Dedicated to Solange Sylva

Just two weeks before Assane returned to Senegal in November of 2018, his mother passed away. Some of the proceeds from this campaign will also help Assane and his family recoup the significant funeral and associated costs from this devastating loss.

Food for 3:                                                                                    $600.00
Payment to musicians:                                                            $1000.00
Estimated editing/post (150 hours * $20/hour):          $3000.00
TOTAL                                                                               $9000.00

Costs this year are lower as I'll be doing both the audio and video myself:
2019 costs:

Plane ticket for me:                                         $1500.00
AirBnb:                                                                 $200.00
Food:                                                                     $150.00
Additional investments in video gear:       $4000.00
Mixing/Editing/Mastering the album:      $4000.00
Payment to musicians                             As much as is humanly possible

 
Power to the people
I do not want to profit from this campaign. Just the opportunity to see this project through to completion is payment enough for me, and simply put– I'll most likely be able to find more web design and commercial video production work long after this project is finished, and have no problem at least partially-self funding. Long story short– I want as much of the proceeds from this campaign to go direct to the artists (and their families) who made it possible.
 
Goal #1:
Be able to logistically afford to finish this project. Part of "finishing" this project for now means that it ripples and echos well into the future. Being able to create a compelling audio experience from the video recordings, and turning that into an album (who's proceeds will go 100% direct to the artists) that could create passive future revenue for these artists is a very important part of that.
 
Goal #2:

Give the majority of the funds to the artists and pay them a generous rate by American standards. A dollar goes a long way in Senegal and the musicians we worked with (and their family's) do not live in luxury. With your help, I would like to ensure that they are able to very comfortably afford some simple luxuries in the coming year. 
 
Dedicated to Solange Sylva

Just two weeks before Assane returned to Senegal in November of 2018, his mother passed away. Some of the proceeds from this campaign will also help Assane and his family recoup the significant funeral and associated costs from this devastating loss.

story:
Hi there! I am Duyen Nguyen, writer and director of The Masterpiece. Let me tell you a little bit about who I am.

I was born and raised in Vietnam. Then I moved to Florida from July 2018 after four years of living in Japan to pursue my passion for filming. Currently, I am in the Film Production MFA program at Full Sail University.

Everybody says that I'm lucky to know what I want to do in life and that I am lucky enough to even get the opportunity to be here, in the US, to follow my dream. Yes, I am a lucky girl. But it took me quite a while to have enough courage to overcome all my self-doubt, insecurities and fears, to get out of my comfort zone and start my journey with filming. And trust me when I say this: that journey has never been easy. Now, as I am surrounded by the creative world that I yearn to be in my whole life, I struggle from internal conflict every day. As a young artist, I usually find myself in a dilemma - being true to my own artistic view or following what people like. Because you cannot just make art for self-enjoyment, but at the same time you also want to be recognized as who you truly are. There is no right or wrong in the art world because everything is subjective. Everything sounds so simple but when it comes to reputation and recognition, it is really hard to make the right decision.  I realize that learning to be true to who you are while being open to criticism is the key to survive and develop as an artist.

The idea of The Masterpiece hit me when I was struggling with the screen writing workshops in class. After receiving tons of different feedbacks from the instructor as well as my classmates about one of my screenplays, I was completely bewildered. Because I wanted people to like my work, I tried to apply those feedbacks and made changes to my screenplay accordingly. To my surprise, after reading my updated version, people asked me why I changed it and said that they liked the old idea better. I found myself similar to Costi, my protagonist in The Masterpiece. We both desperately force ourselves to please people.

I believe that many young artists are facing the same problems as I do. Therefore, I want to tell this story visually as a lesson and a motivation for all of us to be true to ourselves and keep moving forward to pursue what we believe is right even when it does not bring us reputation or recognition. 

 

 

 

 

Duyen Nguyen - Writer Director

Filmmaking is my passion for life. I have been working as a writer/director throughout my four years of college in Japan as well as my MFA program at Full Sail University. Those projects consist of three 2-hour plays, 4 short films, 1 documentary and two commercials as well as numerous short promotional videos for Japanese organizations. I also worked as a Media Creator position during my internship at Wancher.Inc in Oita, Japan. During that time, I was in charge of creating content and producing the fundraising video for the "Deam Pen" project that later became the most funded project for fountain pen on Kickstarter. Thanks to my multicultural background, I want to bring a new perspective into every film I make so that the audience can have a fresher approach to mainstream topics. 

Steven Lamar - Producer

With a passion for creating, Steven Lamar is a creator of all sorts. As a graphic designer, videographer, and photographer, he has played a vital role in the marketing world producing creative content for the past seven years. Moving his creative skills into the film industry in 2018, Steven Lamar now serves as a video editor, producer, and director. His keen sense of details and marketing background will play an essential role in producing the vibrant and colorful world of our film.

Anna Ruth Brown - Producer 

Anna ’s interest in film began when she was five years old, and throughout her childhood and high school years she worked on developing her craft. During her time at Full Sail University she has developed skills in many different departments, including lighting, directing, writing, and producing.

Khann Le Nguyen - Cinematographer

Khann has been pursuing his passion for cinematography for more than 5 years. With his meticulousness, Khann is one of the most trustworthy DP at Full Sail University. He has been working as DP and camera department for numerous production on and outside campus includings short films, music videos and documentaries. Khann has also developed himself as a professional steadicam operator. Check out his IMDB:

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9877344/?ref_=nv_sr_1

Ryan Rainey - Production Designer

Ryan Rainey was a stop motion animator for six years until going to college to study Film. He began working in production design early 2018 after his first film. He has been working on many others building and designing the sets and props for each project. Ryan is looking forward to creating the colorful world the artist of the film live.

 

The money raised is used for creating the stunning production design with numerous paintings and authentic costumes to emphasize the 90's look of the film, nutritious meals for the amazing casts and crews during the 3 days of shooting and distribution fee to enter the film festivals. 

Production design: $800 for the original and messy paintings, 90's authentic hair and costume, a quirky suit for Gunocatui, an overall for Costi, the food stall's signs, all the props that create the "accidental masterpiece" such as hotdog, coffee, ketchup, soccer balls, etc.

Food: 3 days

1st day- 30 people: $250

2nd day - 15 people: $150

3rd day - 15 people: $150

Production Design: $800

Festival Application fee: $200

Posters and Rewards for backers: $200

Back up: $250

We are lucky enough to receive the free resource of equipment including professional lighting system and Arri Alexa camera as well as the location from our school. That is why we believe with $2000, we can produce the film with high quality.

If you are interested in our project but do not have the resources to help, don't worry! You can still lend us a hand by: 

- Spreading our campaign to your family and friends to give us a hand

- Providing any foods, drink or snack if you can. It will help us a great deal to keep the best energy on set.

 

Funding can help create significant difference in film production.

I would not say that we cannot make a good movie with zero budget because during my study at Full Sail University, I have been to many low budget productions and the outcomes was fantastic.

However, financial constraint strongly prevents us from extending our creativity and quality to the next level. Therefore, with The Masterpiece, I really hope that we get enough financial support to deliver our best performances, especially because this screenplay requires meticulous art design to set up the colorful and quirky world that I want to show my audience.

 

There are 2 biggest challenges to produce this film. They are the authentic 90's production design and large sums of extras to create the real atmosphere on a side walk in New York City. 

In order to reduce the cost of catering, we will shift all the wide shots that requires extras to the first day.

Instead of buying new costume, one of my friends helps us create the layout for the outfits and we will try to utilize what we can find at the thrift shop that fit the concept of the film

Instead of buying painted painting, we decided to make everything from scratch with the help of our talented production designer and his friend. That way we will only have to pay for the paints and canvas.

 

We are planning to shoot the film in February 2019 with 3 days of shooting at Full Sail University's backlot in Winter Park, Florida. The film is estimated to be 7 minutes long. Post- production is expected to take 1 month. When it is finished and polished, we will submit it to the worldwide film festival. 

Since you are a part of the film, we will keep you guys updated about the process during pre-production and production on our official website here.

Thank you so much for your support. Let's bring this story to life together.

Best regards, 

Duyen Nguyen

story:
"Perpetuity" Story, Cast & Crew

SPECIAL THANKS:  To all that supported our first campaign, which showed that interest in a film such as this was indeed high.  The funds for the first campaign started us on our journey and we can't thank you enough for getting the ball rolling for us.  The first campaign helped us begin pre-production, and this campaign will actually fund production. Thank you so much!

With the exposed allegations of Harvey Weinstein that shook our nation, and the consequent rise and empowerment of women sharing their abuses of the past, came next the fall of some of America's most prominent men.  The proliferation of "Me Too" and other movements have changed the course of history, not only in American, but worldwide. 

This story is of a woman who had no chance to lead a productive life, as like many women, she has no recollection of the youthful trauma she experienced. They are buried memories she's repressed in order just to survive and exist.  "Perpetuity" is how this woman, in the most extreme and dire of circumstances, gets a second chance at life by finally facing the horrors of her youth as those painful memories stream unbidden back into her consciousness as she also fights for her life physically.

Jennifer Tremain is a maintenance worker at a large high-end office building, one of a string of jobs she's had as she struggles to maintain her self-destructive lifestyle. 

On this particular morning, Jennifer has only just arrived at work when the room she's in suddenly implodes. The mirrors shatter, sending fragments in a hundred directions. The fire extinguisher dislodges and slams into Jennifer's throat, her body already thrown back across the room from the violent lurch of the entire room. The ceiling caves, the walls bend, the room is chaos. Jennifer lands on her back unconscious along with myriad debris.

When she wakes, Jennifer begins her fight for survival.  Almost mortally wounded, a shaft of metal having embedded her leg, a broken arm, and with no power of speech from her damaged throat, Jennifer must navigate the continually decaying room, fighting fire, falling water, building fragments, glass shards and smoke inhalation, all the while trying to seek some kind of rescue while dressing her own wounds in an attempt to stay alive.

It is in this hell . . . that she starts to remember.  To recall, little by little, the forgotten memories of the one other instance in her life that she had had to fight to survive.  

This story is about how a woman, faced with the most incredible crisis, fights for a chance to not only survive her current circumstances, but along the way finds surprisingly, and excruciatingly, the opportunity for the healing she has never experienced. 

Producer/Writer/Director - Patrick James Carson

Patrick James Carson's recent screenplay was adapted into the motion picture "9/11" starring Whoopie Goldberg and Charlie Sheen, released theatrically worldwide late last year with video rights picked up and released by Fox Entertainment.  Mr. Carson has directed in the past, most notably the movie "Deadly Ritual," but has focused on script writing for the past many years.  His works "Elevator" and "The New American Candidate" were produced into plays (Elevator is what was adapted into "9/11"). 

While several of his scripts have been purchased in recent years, his script "Perpetuity" renewed his desire to direct again, especially with the rise of abuse victims speaking out of late and after witnessing how his script for "9/11" was so drastically changed by Hollywood, and frankly exploited, for the making of the film.  He wants "Perpetuity" to be made without exploitation.

Mr. Carson has written over thirty screenplays, many that have sold and been made, and has directed over 20 films (shorts, corporate, feature) and dozens of commercials. He founded a film actor's workshop in Tucson.

Producer/Director - Alan Williams

Alan Williams, with a film degree from the University of Arizona, has been shaping the Arizona film community for 20 years, with his career actually heating up of late.  He's won film festival awards for both writing and directing for his shorts, including "Best of Arizona" for his film, "The Avenue" at the Arizona International Film Festival. He is directing a web series (being made for Netflix) "You Only Live Twice" and just won "Best Action Short" at the Chandler Film Festival.

Alan's activity in the Southern Arizona motion picture world is well known, and even started the non-profit "Picture Arizona" to help bring the business and film communities to a better working relationship.  Alan, his wife and three children live in Tucson, Arizona. 

Actress - Autumn Flint

Autumn Flint, also well known as Autumn Ivy, is not only our lead actress in "Perpetuity," but after hiring her, she was so devoted to the work of helping with the film that she has become invaluable, and consequently is now an associate producer on the film.  While always acting, she also became very involved in cosplay, the comic world, and has gone on to do voice-overs for various gaming MODS as well.  She also co-created a new comic book with Co-Writer and Co-Creator Raven Gregory.  She's a body builder, involved with the wrestling world, and there is no adventure that this versatile performer won't pursue.  Her own hard upbringing brought home a special place for this powerful movie in her life.  She's an astounding actress and person.  

Cinematographer - Avai d'Amico

Avai d'Amico, cinematographer and adventurer, has been film-making since high school. Of late Avai is known in his local film community as the hottest cinematographer in town, working on several projects including a series intended for Netflix and shooting his own feature film, "Tiny House." He's also recently won a Best Film award for a short comedy, and also a Best Documentary.  His mission as an artist?  "I think one role of artists has always been to influence society by telling stories that aren’t necessarily pretty all the time, but are rooted in truth.  I don’t want to tell people what to do, but I want to get the conversations started so we as a society can think more critically."

SFX - Donna Dungan

Donna Dungan is a registered nurse, a makeup artist at Flash in the Past Studio, and freelance special effects makeup artist, Donna also is a prior military officer with nine years of combat readiness and mass casualty training. It was there she was introduced to the importance of a great wound moulage team to create a realistic training experience. Inspired by the "behind the scenes" work of Hollywood special effects guru Greg Nicotero and the KNB EFX team she decided to combine her medical knowledge and makeup application expertise to make realistic wounds and makeup effects for film and mass casualty exercises. She loves working along side other special effects artists and filmmakers. Donna currently does freelance work in Arizona and southern California. She also studies under Stan Winston School for Special Effects.

Graphic Designer - Tyler G. Woida

Tyler G. Woida, born and raised in the Tucson film community, is a freelance filmmaker and photographer soon to graduate from the University of Arizona, yet he established his own company "Hyn May Productions" back in 2010. Tyler worked on "Perpetuity's" pre-shoot photography and posters, and has already produced award-winning music videos and specializes in photoshoots, weddings, headshots, promotional materials and film-making.     

About the Production

Even though "Perpetuity" has an edge-of-your-seat backdrop, the film actually only takes place in one location, with only one main actor.  This allows for a superior opportunity to make a low-budget, yet high production value looking motion picture.  Only one set is needed, and a minimal crew, to make this an exciting, insightful film.  Shooting is scheduled to start in Spring.

Mr. Carson, through his founding of the Film Actor Workshops, has had the opportunity and honor of meeting the best filmmakers, film artists and film technicians in Arizona.  It is only with their support, and expertise, that this film can be made.  Together with Alan Williams and his reach and history with the collective film community, there is virtually no one in Arizona that won't be part of this endeavor.  

The money raised will go to:

  • Paying the actor(s) and crew appropriately and feeding them.
  • Rent for location building.  A warehouse that has high ceilings and can facilitate interior rain (and even fire) shots (needs a drain).
  • Set construction material, including removable walls, ceilings, and decoration, both before the explosion and after.
  • Broadcast camera equipment, lighting, sound and post are all supplied by the hired crew.
  • Site Insurance

Please Share Our Film With Others

We appreciate not only any financial support, but please share our Indiegogo page with your social media friends to help us achieve our goal.  

Indiegogo share tools are available on this page.

Inspired by the "behind the scenes" work of Hollywood special effects guru Greg Nicotero and the KNB EFX team she decided to combine her medical knowledge and makeup application expertise to make realistic wounds and makeup effects for film and mass casualty exercises. She loves working along side other special effects artists and filmmakers. Donna currently does freelance work in Arizona and southern California. She also studies under Stan Winston School for Special Effects.Graphic Designer - Tyler G. WoidaTyler G. Woida, born and raised in the Tucson film community, is a freelance filmmaker and photographer soon to graduate from the University of Arizona, yet he established his own company "Hyn May Productions" back in 2010. Tyler worked on "Perpetuity's" pre-shoot photography and posters, and has already produced award-winning music videos and specializes in photoshoots, weddings, headshots, promotional materials and film-making.     About the ProductionEven though "Perpetuity" has an edge-of-your-seat backdrop, the film actually only takes place in one location, with only one main actor.  This allows for a superior opportunity to make a low-budget, yet high production value looking motion picture.  Only one set is needed, and a minimal crew, to make this an exciting, insightful film.  Shooting is scheduled to start in Spring.Mr. Carson, through his founding of the Film Actor Workshops, has had the opportunity and honor of meeting the best filmmakers, film artists and film technicians in Arizona.  It is only with their support, and expertise, that this film can be made.  Together with Alan Williams and his reach and history with the collective film community, there is virtually no one in Arizona that won't be part of this endeavor.  The money raised will go to:
Paying the actor(s) and crew appropriately and feeding them.
Rent for location building.  A warehouse that has high ceilings and can facilitate interior rain (and even fire) shots (needs a drain).
Set construction material, including removable walls, ceilings, and decoration, both before the explosion and after.
Broadcast camera equipment, lighting, sound and post are all supplied by the hired crew.
Site Insurance
Please Share Our Film With OthersWe appreciate not only any financial support, but please share our Indiegogo page with your social media friends to help us achieve our goal.  Indiegogo share tools are available on this page.

story:
Press Film Festival is a fete of feature stories and photo-essays dedicated to Gordan Lederer and two Russian journalists (Genedij Kurinoj and Viktor Nogin) killed in Hrvatska Kostajnica while doing their job. Each year Festival covers different topic and this year's 5th edition is entitled „Fake News – False News“. („Fake News – Misleading News“) This topic has become the focus of global interest and will certainly draw attention of media people in the region and out of it.

Press Film Festival is supported by the Croatian Journalists' Association and the official program will be followed by public discussions, lectures, photo-exhibitions and book promotions. We hope it will reach our goal to extend interest to new audience and young students of journalism will be invited. It also means decentralization of cultural events and gives the Pounje region a new start in the process of social revitalization.

Unfortunately, the Ministry of Culture did not recognize its potentials and did not support it financially this year. Therefore we have opened campaign to raise means needed to organize the 5th Press Film Festival, a cultural and media event opened to all.

story:
It all begins with...

Thirteen-year-old strong-willed Mercy who is struggling to understand why her family is falling apart. To cope and navigate the new family dynamic, she masks her pain through anger and rebellion.

When we first meet her, she's with her father Emiliano at The Recovering Hearts Assembly; his court-assigned therapy group. The participants share their painful stories and the courageous steps they've taken to heal. Instead of seeing these as an opportunity for growth, they only fuel Mercy's pain and anger. By the time Mercy's father shares his story and his desires to create a better relationship with her, she explodes with her frustrations of believing in something that was found not to be true and that -- because of him -- she's become an Atheist.

With encouragement from a participant in the group, Mercy finds it deep down to forgive her father and make peace in order to maintain a healthy relationship.

The story explores the theme that love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.

To Create the Best, We Need the Best.

From equipment to talented and skilled people, the $3,400 will help us cover the following:

  • The Perfect Location for our scenes
    • NVisionate Studios in Burbank has the sets we can customize to fit the hospital and living room locations we need for the film.

  • Highland Park Ebell Club in Highland Park has a open space where we can capture the Recovery Group scenes in an artistic and visually appealing way

Even if we don't reach the full $3,400, we intend to split the funds we do raise between the various departments below:

If we do raise more than our goal, this will ensure a higher production value with our equipment, set design, and post production.

 

What You Do Makes the Difference

The film is being produced with the assistance of the Hollywood New Collective. By contributing and supporting this film, you're not only making an impact for one female filmmaker, but you're taking a stand to help support all women and the efforts to bring more diversity to Hollywood.

Because of the industry push to provide more opportunities to women and diverse voices, there are many ways this film can seen and enjoyed by many. Our previous projects like this have gone on to screen at the Grand Junction Film Festival, Pasadena International Film Festival, Albuquerque Film Festival, and more.

Great Things Do Not Happen By Themselves

Comprised of award-winning talent, our team continues to grow and work with the best in the industry.

Roe Moore

Director, Writer, Producer

Roe's career in the entertainment industry has taken her both in front of and behind the camera on notable film and television shows including upcoming Disney+ talk show Earth To Ned, El Rey Network's Lucha Underground, and CW's Masters of Illusion. Her directing career choice was solidified at the Hollywood Brisk Festival when she directed RECESS by Kara Emily Krantz and won for Best Play! She has also directed for the OC-Centric New Plays Festival, Inkfest, and Hollywood Fringe Festival. Previous to directing, writing, and producing this film, she has also shadowed great directors like Tim Mancinetti (Late Late Show with James Corden), Mark Cendrowski (The Neighborhood), and Patrick McManus (America Ninja Warrior). She is a proud member of the Producers Guild of America, is a Local 871 Script Supervisor, and is eligible to join the DGA.

Israel Arias

Cinematographer

Israel Arias has been an experienced Director of Photography for 8 years. His passion began in his college years at the age of 19 years old. Israel received his Bachelors of Fine Arts at the Art Institute of Portland in the year 2014. As he has grown in this industry he has had the opportunity to work alongside Leslie Bloom, a film and television Director/Producer. In addition Israel has worked with Director of Photography; Randolph Sellars, as well as feature film and television director; Thad Smith. He is known for his work “Woodstock or Bust” featuring Willow Shields (Hunger Games) and Meg Delacy (The Fosters) and A Fairy’s Game Ava Kolker (Girl meets world and Insidious Chapter 4). His experience includes feature films, short films, television commercials and web ads. Paying close attention to detail and taking all aspects into consideration when it comes to creating a great image, he leaves the audience in great admiration.

Damian Rodriguez

Producer

Damian is the team's secret sauce. Nobody really knows what he does, but he does it well. His contributions as a producer have included working on the creative side of the script as well as helping with all things production. He has experience from working on multiple talk shows including producing his own show Deep Cuts.

When You Make a Plan and God laughs...

Making a film has its risks. From the small technical issues to the unexpected acts of God, we are prepared and dedicated to see this film through to the end. If issues do arise, we have contingencies to cover any costs of replacement equipment, personnel, and locations because of the relationships we have built with our various vendors.

We believe in Neil Gaiman's statement of "Do what only you do best. Make good art." We have seen first hand through our previous projects that when we make something good, it is recognized and receives the acknowledgement it deserves. Whether that be film festival screenings or through the various streaming opportunities, we will pursue the multiple outlets available to give our film a home where people can see and enjoy the film's message.

Every Little Bit Matters

As you'll see, we have offered a multitude of perks in exchange for your contribution. You can also choose to contribute an amount you decide! Either way, we're grateful for any penny that we receive to create the highest quality story.

 

Can't Donate and All You Have

Are Thoughts & Prayers...

And that's okay! The best way to help us is to spread the word about our film with your friends and family. You can easily do that through using the Indiegogo Social Shares at the top of this campaign!

story:
Overview

When a young homeless girl's car breaks down in the middle of the forest, the only thing nearby is a cabin built on top of an asylum ground. An old book she finds opens a portal to her past. She struggles to survive what cannot be undone.

'The Asylum' is a junior thesis film in the Narrative Production program at CSULB created by Jeffrey Sarceno.

 

The Crew

Jeffrey Sarceno, a Rancho Cucamonga native, is pursuing a career in cinematography at California State University, Long Beach. He has worked on many short film productions in prior semesters, growing his skills in the film industry. His experiences allowed him to work with professionals and different styles of filmmaking. He is a passionate Cinematographer and visual storyteller.

 

Sharon De La Mora grew up in North Hollywood, surrounded by creative minds. She fell in love with film when she realized what a beautiful way it was to share visions and stories. She came to Long Beach State as a Marine Biology major, but her passion for film grew much too strong to ignore. She is now a film major pursuing what she truly loves and gives her purpose. Sharon throws her all into filmmaking, and is determined to do whatever is in her power to bring this wonderful short film to life.

 

Nayeli Quiroz is a student at Long Beach State studying Communication Studies with an emphasis on Culture and Public Affairs, and minoring in Film and Electronic Arts focusing on Production Management. Her love of movies inspired her to become more involved in the entertainment industry using a Communication Studies degree as an asset. Coming on board as co-producer will be a learning opportunity to further a career in the arts and help fellow crew to create an amazing film.

 

Ally Bravo, born and raised in Southern California, dabbled in fine arts, film, and music all her life. Growing up in the suburbs of Upland, California, Ally vicariously lived through movies and television shows. Soon, her interest in cinema grew to love, to the point where it could no longer be "just a hobby". Through producing short student films, her passion for film and her knack for organization shine. In her free time, one can usually spot her awaiting her next project, eating local food and pretending she's a botanist (like Matt Damon in The Martian).

 

Mackenzie Dobias grew up in Southern California surrounded by a variety of art forms, thereby developing her love for camera, music, and other mediums of art. She became inspired from many photographers and cinematographers and grew in love with studying the different ways to use a camera. By enrolling at CSULB, Mackenzie Dobias is studying what she loves and is very excited for the opportunity to film The Asylum. 

 

Shruthi Anand is a creative storyteller studying Directing at California State University, Long Beach. Working on a variety of film sets has taught her the importance of collaboration, patience, and thinking on her feet. Assistant Directing is one of her favorite jobs on set; Shruthi enjoys communicating with every member of the crew to ensure a smooth production. On her free time, she likes watching psychological thrillers and going to the beach!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute to the campaign, we completely understand! Here's what else you can do to help us reach our goal:

Get the word out and share our campaign on social media platforms

Share the campaign with your friends and family

Indiegogo conveniently has some share tools you can use!

Thank you so much to everyone who takes the time to share this, contribute to our campaign, or even read through it.

story:
Please consider a contribution of any amount. No amount is too little!

This film means so much to me as the topic of mental health awareness hits close to home. 
Making this film from a short into a feature length film is just one of our goals. The biggest goal is to be able to tell a story that moves people and most importantly raise awareness to help reduce the stigma attached to getting help for mental illnesses.

Mental illnesses affect 19% of the adult population, 46% of teenagers and 13% of children each year. People struggling with their mental health may be in your family, live next door, teach your children, work in the next cubicle or sit in the same church pew.

However, only half of those affected receive treatment, often because of the stigma attached to mental health. Untreated, mental illness can contribute to higher medical expenses, poorer performance at school and work, fewer employment opportunities and increased risk of harming themselves.

We really hope to garner the attention of producers/executives to expand this story further into a feature length film that can reach out globally and touch someone who is dealing with mental health issues and/or the people around them.
